original: de'i shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na thun mongs ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na thun mongs ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: because it is the nature of that consciousness, it is not shared.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni chu ma yin pa la yang chu'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni chu ma yin pa la yang chu'i rnam par ro //
translated: “Thus” means that even in what is not water, there is the appearance of water.

original: de ni @171a * //
analyzed: de ni @171a * //
translated: “That” refers to

original: zhes bya ba ni snang bzhin pa'i chu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snang bzhin pa'i chu'o //
translated: the water that is appearing.

original: rang ri rnams par rtog pa yin yang /
analyzed: rang ri rnams par rtog pa yin yang /
translated: Although it is a conception of water,

original: phyi rol gyi thob par bya ba'i tha snyan byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi thob par bya ba'i tha snyan byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir na /
translated: because it is the cause for the conventional expression “that which is to be obtained externally,”

original: thob par bya ba ma yin pa rang gi rnams pa'i tha snyad mi byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thob par bya ba ma yin pa rang gi rnams pa'i tha snyad mi byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is not the conventional expression “that which is not to be obtained” in regard to its own appearance. This is the meaning.

original: 'di'i ming ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyi don ni 'di las ni dus gzhan du yang 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ming ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyi don ni 'di las ni dus gzhan du yang 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “This is its name” means that this very object is called “this” at another time.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus gzhan na med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus gzhan na med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: “Not its own characteristic” means that it does not exist at another place and time. This is the idea.

original: bzlog pa ni zhes bya ba ni goms pa'am /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni zhes bya ba ni goms pa'am /
translated: “The opposite” means that it is familiar.

original: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can yin pas so //
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can yin pas so //
translated: because it is the one who has the thought that is prior.

original: rtog pa po gnyi ga yang mdor bsdus nas ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa po gnyi ga yang mdor bsdus nas ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The one who has the thought is both, and this is indicated by the word “both” in the verse.

original: 'di'i ming 'di zhes bya ba ni brda nyid kyi don to //🔽de ltar re zhig gang zhig dngos po kho nar brda 'dzin pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i ming 'di zhes bya ba ni brda nyid kyi don to // de ltar re zhig gang zhig dngos po kho nar brda 'dzin pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the word “this” is just the conventional symbol.🔽Thus, first of all, the one who holds the conventional symbol in regard to the entity is stated.

original: de ni zhig rang nyid kho na tha snyad las brda rtogs pa de brjod pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhig rang nyid kho na tha snyad las brda rtogs pa de brjod pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Then, the one who understands the conventional symbol from the expression is stated by the word “that.”

original: de la na yang rtogs pa ldan pa dag rtog par 'gyur ro zhes blta par bya'o //
analyzed: de la na yang rtogs pa ldan pa dag rtog par 'gyur ro zhes blta par bya'o //
translated: And in this regard, the one who understands is the one who has the thought, as should be seen.

original: 'ga' zhig gis 'di 'on cig ces brjod pa las so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis 'di 'on cig ces brjod pa las so //
translated: The word “this” is the expression “bring that.”

original: sgra 'di las zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i sgra las so //
analyzed: sgra 'di las zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i sgra las so //
translated: The word “from this” is from this kind of expression.

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de phyir brda'i dus na yang zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel nyid rnam pa gzhan du 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de phyir brda'i dus na yang zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel nyid rnam pa gzhan du 'chad pa'o //
translated: Or, the word “that” and so on is an alternative explanation of the expression “at the time of the conventional symbol.”

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus na'o //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus na'o //
translated: The word “before” is at the time of the conventional symbol.

original: rang gis rtogs pa'i 'bras bu can zhes bya ba 'di'i don brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rang gis rtogs pa'i 'bras bu can zhes bya ba 'di'i don brjod pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the expression “having the effect of the understanding of itself” is stated:

original: gzugs de'i 'bras bu yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs de'i 'bras bu yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The effect of that form” and so on.🔽In order to avoid the implication that the exclusion is something different, he states:

original: ldog pa ni tha dad pa kho na'o zhes bya rgyal ba 'ga' zhig dgongs par 'gyur bas na de nye bar bkod nas sun 'byin pa ni ldog pa de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa ni tha dad pa kho na'o zhes bya rgyal ba 'ga' zhig dgongs par 'gyur bas na de nye bar bkod nas sun 'byin pa ni ldog pa de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The exclusion is just difference.”

original: bkar nas zhes bya ba ni gsal ba las so //
analyzed: bkar nas zhes bya ba ni gsal ba las so //
translated: “Explicitly” means from the manifest.

original: ldog pa yan rtog pas bkar na /
analyzed: ldog pa yan rtog pas bkar na /
translated: If the exclusion is explicitly distinguished by thought,

original: da de dang gcig tu tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da de dang gcig tu tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is the same as that, because it is designated as such.

original: de ltar gyur na zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don ni sgrub pa'i tshul du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don ni sgrub pa'i tshul du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of “in that case” is stated in “in the manner of proof” and so on.

original: ji srid du rigs mthun pa'i gsal ba mtha' dag la sgra mthong ba de srid du sgra nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji srid du rigs mthun pa'i gsal ba mtha' dag la sgra mthong ba de srid du sgra nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that as long as the word is seen in all the manifest entities of the same type, it is not the entity word.

original: gal te gsal ba rnams la brda byed pa yin na de'i tshe nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na cis kyang brda ni spyi la yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba rnams la brda byed pa yin na de'i tshe nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na cis kyang brda ni spyi la yin no zhe na /
translated: If the word is applied to the individual things, then this fault would ensue. But the word is applied to the universal.

original: spyi la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word is applied to the universal.

original: ci rigs mi mthun pa'i gsal ba dag la med pa dang bcas pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du sgra gzhan du ma mthong ba la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i don to //
analyzed: ci rigs mi mthun pa'i gsal ba dag la med pa dang bcas pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du sgra gzhan du ma mthong ba la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i don to //
translated: The point of the argument is this: The word is applied to the individual things, whether they are similar or dissimilar, in order to make known the presence of the universal, which is not seen elsewhere.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni lan @171b no ;
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni lan @171b no ;
translated: But if that is so, then the word is applied to the individual things.🔽This is clarified:

original: /'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gsal ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: /'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gsal ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The word is applied to the individual things.

original: de las gzhan las zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa med pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan las zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa med pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: From that, from the universal, the word is applied to the individual things, which are not dissimilar, which possess the universal.

original: gal te gsal ba rtogs pa med pa nyid de ba lang tsam zhig rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba rtogs pa med pa nyid de ba lang tsam zhig rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the individual things are not understood, then the word is applied to the individual things, which are not dissimilar, which possess the universal.

original: des na gsal ba nyid rtog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na gsal ba nyid rtog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, the individual things are understood.🔽Thinking that this is so, he says:

original: ci ste brjod snyam du bsams nas smras pa ni gsal nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste brjod snyam du bsams nas smras pa ni gsal nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The individual things are understood.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: “No” is the refutation.

original: ci nyis rim gyis zhes dris pa na gzhan lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: ci nyis rim gyis zhes dris pa na gzhan lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: When asked, “Is it by a series of two?” the reply is:

original: rtog pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “It is by imagination.”

original: nang gi khyad par zhes bya ba ni thung du dang ring po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par rtog pa ni mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi khyad par zhes bya ba ni thung du dang ring po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par rtog pa ni mi srid pa'o //
translated: “The difference in the internal” is the difference in the nature of the short and long, etc.

original: da yang zhes bya ba ni khro bo la sogs pa khyad par gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: da yang zhes bya ba ni khro bo la sogs pa khyad par gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: “Also” means that anger, etc. are the nature of the difference.

original: gsal ba rnams zhes bya ba ni rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las ldog pa rnams so //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams zhes bya ba ni rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las ldog pa rnams so //
translated: “The manifest” means that which is distinguished from the homogeneous and heterogeneous.

original: spyis zhes bya ba ni ba lang nyid kyis so //🔽khyad par gyi rang bzhin de gdon mi za bar rtogs pa nyid yin nam zhes bya ba'i don 'di la tshad ma med de /
analyzed: spyis zhes bya ba ni ba lang nyid kyis so // khyad par gyi rang bzhin de gdon mi za bar rtogs pa nyid yin nam zhes bya ba'i don 'di la tshad ma med de /
translated: “By the universal” means by cowness.🔽There is no means of valid knowledge for the meaning of the question, “Is the nature of the difference necessarily imagined?”

original: nges na ji ltar gdon mi za bar khyad par 'ga' zhig yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges na ji ltar gdon mi za bar khyad par 'ga' zhig yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is ascertained, then the meaning is, “How can there be some difference that is not necessarily imagined?”

original: de ltar na 'di ni spyi rtogs par khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni spyi rtogs par khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this is a statement made by one who accepts the understanding of a universal.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin na zhes brjod pa ni ci yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin na zhes brjod pa ni ci yang zhes bya'o //
translated: And if that does not exist, what is it that is said to be the object of the word?

original: blo nyid de de yul gyi ma yin no //
analyzed: blo nyid de de yul gyi ma yin no //
translated: It is the cognition itself, not its object.

original: gal te ji ltar gzhan las ldog pa las 'jug pa zhes brjod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar gzhan las ldog pa las 'jug pa zhes brjod pa de bzhin du /
translated: If you say that, as in the case of the exclusion of other, the word applies to the universal,

original: kho no cag kyang gsal ba nyid dam spyi nyid la 'jug go zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kho no cag kyang gsal ba nyid dam spyi nyid la 'jug go zhes brjod do //
translated: we also say that the word applies to the universal or to the individual.

original: stong pa'i rang bzhin gyi ldog pa la ni su yang 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa'i rang bzhin gyi ldog pa la ni su yang 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: No one applies a word to an exclusion that is empty of an object.🔽We see that a word applies only to an object.

original: dngos po kho na 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes dgos pa la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po kho na 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes dgos pa la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say that the word is applied to the exclusion of other, we reply that if that is so,🔽then the word does not apply to the universal or to the individual, just as it does not apply to the exclusion of other.

original: slu bar gyur na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: slu bar gyur na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o //
translated: The word does not apply to the exclusion of other, because it is empty of an object.🔽The word does not apply to the universal or to the individual, because they are empty of the exclusion of other.🔽The word does not apply to the exclusion of other, because it is empty of an object.🔽The word does not apply to the universal or to the individual, because they are empty of the exclusion of other.🔽The word does not apply to the exclusion of other, because it is empty of an object.🔽The word does not apply to the universal or to the individual, because they are empty of the exclusion of other.🔽The word does not apply to the exclusion of other, because it is empty of an object.🔽The word does not apply to the universal or to the individual, because they are empty of the exclusion of other.🔽The word does not apply to the exclusion of other, because it is empty of an object.🔽The word does not apply to the universal or to the individual, because they are empty of the exclusion of other.🔽The word does not apply to the exclusion of other, because it is empty of an object.🔽The word does not apply to the universal or to the individual, because they are empty of the exclusion of other.🔽The word does not apply to the exclusion of other, because it is empty of an object.🔽The word does not apply to the universal or to the individual, because they are empty of the exclusion of other.

original: slu bar gyur na ji ltar spyi 'am gsal bar sgra'i don ma yin pa de bzhin du gzhan sel ba yang ngo zhes bsams pa'o //🔽'di la brjod pa nig zhan mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: slu bar gyur na ji ltar spyi 'am gsal bar sgra'i don ma yin pa de bzhin du gzhan sel ba yang ngo zhes bsams pa'o //🔽'di la brjod pa nig zhan mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word does not apply to the exclusion of other, because it is empty of an object.🔽The word does not apply to the universal or to the individual, because they are

original: don 'di yin te gzhan sel ba ni slu ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: don 'di yin te gzhan sel ba ni slu ba med pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning is this: the exclusion of other is infallible.

original: 'di ltar bum pa khyer la shog ces bya ba'i ngag 'di'i don ni bum pa ma yin pa khyer la ma 'ong zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa khyer la shog ces bya ba'i ngag 'di'i don ni bum pa ma yin pa khyer la ma 'ong zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the statement “Bring the pot” is “Do not bring what is not a pot.”

original: btsugs pa'i skyes bu yang bum pa ma yin par mthong yang de mi len te des na sgra'i don gang yin pa de la ni slu ba med do //
analyzed: btsugs pa'i skyes bu yang bum pa ma yin par mthong yang de mi len te des na sgra'i don gang yin pa de la ni slu ba med do //
translated: Even though one sees a man who is not a pot, one does not take him, and therefore there is no deception with regard to the meaning of the word.

original: bum pa nyid nas 'ong ba'i sgra'i don nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa nyid nas 'ong ba'i sgra'i don nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the meaning of the word “pot” that comes from the pot,

original: des na bum pa ma mthong ba gal te khyer nas 'ong ba med pa de lta @172a * //
analyzed: des na bum pa ma mthong ba gal te khyer nas 'ong ba med pa de lta @172a * //
translated: and therefore, even though one does not see the pot, if one brings it,

original: na yang sgra'i don ma yin pa'i phyir slu ba med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: na yang sgra'i don ma yin pa'i phyir slu ba med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is not the meaning of the word, and therefore there is no deception.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni bum pa las gzhan ma thong yang de las gzhan mi len pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni bum pa las gzhan ma thong yang de las gzhan mi len pa'i phyir te /
translated: The same point is expressed in the statement “Even though one does not see what is other than the pot, one does not take what is other than it.”

original: bum pa las gzhan mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa las gzhan mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not take what is other than the pot.

original: slu ba yod pa ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: slu ba yod pa ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: There is no deception.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni bum pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin de ni'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni bum pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin de ni'o //
translated: The clarification of this is: the nature of that which is not a pot is not a pot.

original: gzhan zhes pa ni bum pa ma yin pa las gzhan de bum pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan zhes pa ni bum pa ma yin pa las gzhan de bum pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The other is the nature of the pot, which is other than that which is not a pot.

original: de ltar na re zhig rtogs pa gang zhig gzhan gyi brda 'dzin du bcug pa de la ltos nas rnam 'grel sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rtogs pa gang zhig gzhan gyi brda 'dzin du bcug pa de la ltos nas rnam 'grel sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Thus, first of all, the application of the expression is in dependence on that which is understood, having been caused to hold the sign of another.

original: da ni gang zhig bdag nyid tha snyad la brda rtogs pa de la ltos nas sbyor bar byed pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni gang zhig bdag nyid tha snyad la brda rtogs pa de la ltos nas sbyor bar byed pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, the application in dependence on that which itself understands the sign of the expression is indicated by “or.”

original: bye brag tu zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye bar ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye bar ro //
translated: “Distinctively” means in distinction.

original: dngos po 'di 'on cig ces bya ba'i dag 'di'i byed pa ni len pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po 'di 'on cig ces bya ba'i dag 'di'i byed pa ni len pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of “bring this thing” is not the taking of this,

original: dngos po nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: but rather the thing itself.

original: med pa ni blang bar mi nus so //
analyzed: med pa ni blang bar mi nus so //
translated: And that which does not exist cannot be taken.

original: des na khyer te 'ong ba la /
analyzed: des na khyer te 'ong ba la /
translated: Therefore, in the case of that which is brought,

original: byed pa 'jug pa'i phyir na yod pa nyid la yang byed pa 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rtsod ba'i don to //
analyzed: byed pa 'jug pa'i phyir na yod pa nyid la yang byed pa 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rtsod ba'i don to //
translated: the opponent’s point is that since the activity is engaged, the activity is engaged in that which exists.

original: gal te gdon mi za bar byed khyer te 'on bar 'gyur na ni de'i tshe yod pa nyid la byed pa 'jug par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te gdon mi za bar byed khyer te 'on bar 'gyur na ni de'i tshe yod pa nyid la byed pa 'jug par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were the case that one must necessarily take it and come, then at that time one would be engaged in activity with respect to an existent.

original: 'on kyang gdon mi za ba khyer te 'ong ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan gyi don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang gdon mi za ba khyer te 'ong ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan gyi don to //
translated: But it is not the case that one must necessarily take it and come. This is the meaning of the reply.

original: 'o na yod pa nyid du gang la rtogs shes de ni zhes bya ba ste sgras ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: 'o na yod pa nyid du gang la rtogs shes de ni zhes bya ba ste sgras ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: Now, with respect to what is understood as existent, it is not by the word. The meaning is that it is not by the word.

original: dper na byis pa mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po slong ba de la 'di byis pa 'dis blang ba de na gor ma chag pa dngos po yod dgos so zhes bya ba'i don gyis go bar 'gyur ram ci de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang don gyis go🔽ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na byis pa mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po slong ba de la 'di byis pa 'dis blang ba de na gor ma chag pa dngos po yod dgos so zhes bya ba'i don gyis go bar 'gyur ram ci de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang don gyis go ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, when a child asks for a desired object, does the meaning become understood by that child that the object that he is asking for must necessarily exist? In the same way, it is not by the meaning that there is understanding for others.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi srid na ni len pa yin no ;
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi srid na ni len pa yin no ;
translated: It is not otherwise. The meaning is that if it is impossible, then it is taken.

original: / gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni lha dbang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / gzhan dag ni zhes bya ba ni lha dbang la sogs pa'o //
translated: Others refers to Indra and so on.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gcig tu gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gcig tu gtso bo yin la /
translated: The forward and reverse orders are the same in the principal case.

original: sgrub pa ni phal pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni phal pa nyid du khas blangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But in the secondary case, the proof is accepted as being the reverse.

original: 'di la lan de ni mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan de ni mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is: “That is not correct.”🔽This is just a statement made by accepting the opponent’s position.

original: 'di yang khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi 'di ni yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi 'di ni yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is: “This is not so.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gsal ba cig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gsal ba cig ces gsungs so //
translated: Why? Because the manifestation is the same.

original: yang na la la kho nar sgas bstan pa de thob pa de la ltos te mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na la la kho nar sgas bstan pa de thob pa de la ltos te mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is because the manifestation is seen in relation to the attainment of that which is manifested.

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained as follows:🔽The statement “This is the man” indicates that this is the man.

original: 'di'i mi 'di yin no zhes brjod pa 'di las ni 'dir @172b tha dad du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig yin te zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: 'di'i mi 'di yin no zhes brjod pa 'di las ni 'dir @172b tha dad du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig yin te zhes bya bar ro //
translated: This is just the point.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dngos po mthong na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dngos po mthong na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if the thing is seen,

original: ji ltar me'i khyad par la the tshom za zhes bya ba ni spyi mthong ba'i phyir dang / khyad par ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / khyad par dran pa'i phyir the tshom du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar me'i khyad par la the tshom za zhes bya ba ni spyi mthong ba'i phyir dang / khyad par ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / khyad par dran pa'i phyir the tshom du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “how can there be doubt about the particular of fire” is that there is doubt because of seeing the universal, because of not seeing the particular, and because of remembering the particular.

original: lan ni rtogs pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni rtogs pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “merely through understanding.”

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni re zhig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni re zhig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what is being taught: “First of all, . . .”

original: gang du zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i gzhi ni 'di yin te ci me yod dam 'on te med ces the tshom za'o zhes ci ste brjod de /
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i gzhi ni 'di yin te ci me yod dam 'on te med ces the tshom za'o zhes ci ste brjod de /
translated: The point of contention is this: why is it said that there is doubt as to whether fire exists or not?

original: gang gi phyir 'di la me yod do zhes nges par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la me yod do zhes nges par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because it is ascertained that fire exists here.

original: 'di la lan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di la lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di la lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “no.” The meaning is that there is no answer.

original: de la ni reg pa'i khyad par la'o //
analyzed: de la ni reg pa'i khyad par la'o //
translated: “There, in the particular of contact” is the point of contention.

original: ji ltar rtogs zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'o //
translated: “How is it understood?” is the question.

original: dro ba tsam zhig ces bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: dro ba tsam zhig ces bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “Merely the warmth” is the answer.

original: khyad par gyi rim pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par rim pa la ma gtogs pa dro ba'i spyi ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rim pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par rim pa la ma gtogs pa dro ba'i spyi ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because there is a gradation of differences.

original: dgongs pa 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni khyad par rim pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba la'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni khyad par rim pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba la'o //
translated: This very intention is clarified: “in regard to the division of gradation of differences, etc.”

original: gcig nyid ni zhes bya ba ni yul gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid ni zhes bya ba ni yul gcig pa'o //
translated: “The same” means having the same object.

original: res 'ga' ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba rtsa las byung ba'am res 'ga' ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni lo ma las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba rtsa las byung ba'am res 'ga' ni 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni lo ma las 'byung ba ste /
translated: “Sometimes it is like this” means it arises from the root; “sometimes it is like this” means it arises from the leaf.

original: de ltar yul dang gzhan la blo skye ba'i phyir gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yul dang gzhan la blo skye ba'i phyir gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because the cognition arises in regard to the object and another, it is not the same.

original: gcig ni zhes bya ba ni rtsva las 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: gcig ni zhes bya ba ni rtsva las 'byung ba'am /
translated: “The same” means it arises from grass;

original: 'o ma las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'o ma las 'byung ba'o //
translated: or it arises from milk.

original: de 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'thad pa yin no //
translated: That is tenable.

original: bya ba ni gzhan sel ba'i yul can de'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni gzhan sel ba'i yul can de'o //
translated: The object of the activity is the exclusion of another.

original: ldan pa snang ba'i phyir rdzas 'brel pa'i rtog pa dbang po'i rnam pa shes pa la yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: ldan pa snang ba'i phyir rdzas 'brel pa'i rtog pa dbang po'i rnam pa shes pa la yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar blta'o //
translated: Therefore, the conceptual thought of substantial connection exists in the cognition of the sense faculty.

original: gzhan rtogs pa'i rgyus mdun na gnas pa de la skyes bu rnam pa rtog pa mi byed kyang dngos po gnyis po de'i ngo bor snang ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan rtogs pa'i rgyus mdun na gnas pa de la skyes bu rnam pa rtog pa mi byed kyang dngos po gnyis po de'i ngo bor snang ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though a person does not conceptualize the form of another person standing in front, the appearance of the nature of those two things does not exist.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni de tsam 'ba' zhig snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni de tsam 'ba' zhig snang ba nyid do //
translated: “Just that” means that only that much appears.

original: ldan rtog pa yang zhes brjod pa ni gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: ldan rtog pa yang zhes brjod pa ni gnyi ga'o //
translated: “Conceptual thought of connection” is both.

original: las las skyes pa'i ldan pa ni sha gzhan gnyid kho na'i'o //
analyzed: las las skyes pa'i ldan pa ni sha gzhan gnyid kho na'i'o //
translated: “Connection arisen from action” is the connection of flesh alone.

original: gang yang rung ba'i las las  skyes pa ni gangs can dang mi la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba'i las las  skyes pa ni gangs can dang mi la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: “Connection arisen from any action” is the connection of the Himalayas and humans, etc.

original: ldan pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'bras bu'i ldan pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: ldan pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'bras bu'i ldan pa skye ba'o //
translated: “Connection arisen from connection” is the connection of space and fruit.

original: 'di la gzhan gyis brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyis brjod pa ni /
translated: Here, others say:

original: dngos po gnyis po de nyid ni ldan par gyur pa yin no zhes rtogs pa yang med par gyur te ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gnyis po de nyid ni ldan par gyur pa yin no zhes rtogs pa yang med par gyur te ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not understood that these two things are connected, because they are not connected.
Therefore,

original: na ste de lta bur gyur pa'i rtogs pa'i yid pa'i phyir ldan pa gzhan yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: na ste de lta bur gyur pa'i rtogs pa'i yid pa'i phyir ldan pa gzhan yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: the thought is that connection is something else, apart from the cognition of those two things.

original: snga ma dang lhan cig tu rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ldan par gyur pa rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes byar ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang lhan cig tu rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ldan par gyur pa rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes byar ro //
translated: But it is not understood that the connected is the cognition, because there is no cognition of the connected together with the prior cognition.

original: gang zhig mi ldan par gyur pa de ni ldan par gyur pa 'di yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig mi ldan par gyur pa de ni ldan par gyur pa 'di yin la /
translated: That which is not connected becomes the connected.

original: de bzhin du 'di na slar yang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di na slar yang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: And in the same way, it is thought that the connected becomes disconnected.

original: so sor 'gyur ba dang 'di gnyis kyi dang nas gcig gis bdag ni 'bras bu byed mkhan yin no zhes de ltar rtogs pa gsum srid pa na ldan med rtogs par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: so sor 'gyur ba dang 'di gnyis kyi dang nas gcig gis bdag ni 'bras bu byed mkhan yin no zhes de ltar rtogs pa gsum srid pa na ldan med rtogs par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: And from the separation of those two, one thinks, “I am the agent of the effect.”

original: gal te rtogs pa de lta bu med na ni de'i tshe ldan par rtogs pa don med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa de lta bu med na ni de'i tshe ldan par rtogs pa don med pa kho na'o //
translated: If such a cognition does not exist, then the cognition of the connected is meaningless.

original: 'o na 'bras bu dang bcas par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /🔽'di ni gcig 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu dang bcas par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na / 'di ni gcig 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But how can it be said to be associated with a result?🔽The meaning of the phrase “it is just this” is that it is associated with a result.

original: ldan pa'i dngos po 'di ni 'ba' zhig kyang 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ldan pa'i dngos po 'di ni 'ba' zhig kyang 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “it is just this” is that it is associated with a result.

original: mngon sum ni de ltar 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni de ltar 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: Direct perception does not operate in this way,

original: 'byung ba dang byung zin pa dang dag la de 'jug pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang byung zin pa dang dag la de 'jug pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that it operates in regard to that which is in the process of arising or that which has already arisen.

original: des na mngon sum la ni ldan pa snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mngon sum la ni ldan pa snang ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, association does not appear in direct perception.

original: gal te de ltar ldan pa mi snang ba'i phyir rdzas 'brel pa'i rtogs pa ma yin mod /
analyzed: gal te de ltar ldan pa mi snang ba'i phyir rdzas 'brel pa'i rtogs pa ma yin mod /
translated: If you say that the cognition of substance is not a conceptual cognition because association does not appear in this way,🔽then the cognition of the sense faculties would not be nonconceptual, because it is a conceptual cognition in regard to the initial object.

original: sgra sbyor bar ni 'gyur ba yin te des na dban po'i shes pa rnams par rtog pa med pa ma yin te des dang po'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin no zhe na /🔽sga sbyor bar byed pa yang zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: sgra sbyor bar ni 'gyur ba yin te des na dban po'i shes pa rnams par rtog pa med pa ma yin te des dang po'i rnam par rtog pa ma yin no zhe na / sga sbyor bar byed pa yang zhes gsungs so ;
translated: The root text states, “The cognition that connects the word and the object. . . . ”

original: / de la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la snang ba'i dngos po la'o //
analyzed: / de la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la snang ba'i dngos po la'o //
translated: The phrase “in regard to that” refers to the object that appears in direct perception.

original: dogs pa ni brda'i dus na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni brda'i dus na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is expressed by the words “at the time of the convention. ”

original: 'di la rjod pa ni de dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la rjod pa ni de dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is “that. ”

original: brda'i dus na yod pa dang ngo //
analyzed: brda'i dus na yod pa dang ngo //
translated: The convention is that the word is present at the time of the convention.

original: re zhig brda 'chad pa ni 'di la ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig brda 'chad pa ni 'di la ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the convention is “this is a cow. ”

original: 'di ni mngon sum la snag ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum la snag ba'o //
translated: This is the appearance to perception.

original: gal te 'di ba lang gi sgra ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ba lang gi sgra ma yin na /
translated: If this is not the word “cow, ”

original: 'o na ji ltar na 'di 'di zhes bya ba dang ba lang gi sgra dang / gzhi mthun par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar na 'di 'di zhes bya ba dang ba lang gi sgra dang / gzhi mthun par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: then how can it be the same as the word “cow” and the word “this”?

original: de dang 'brel pa ni ba lang gi sgra dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa ni ba lang gi sgra dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: The connection is the connection with the word “cow. ”

original: gal te 'di la ba lang gi sga'i zhes rnam pa de ltar na brda mi byed kyi /
analyzed: gal te 'di la ba lang gi sga'i zhes rnam pa de ltar na brda mi byed kyi /
translated: If the convention is not made in this way, “This is the word ‘cow,’ ”🔽then how is the convention made?

original: 'on kyang 'di ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba yin no snyam na /🔽de la tshig gi zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba yin no snyam na / de la tshig gi zhes gsungs te /
translated: The answer is “that. ”

original: ba lang gi sgra zhes bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi sgra zhes bya ba 'di'o //
translated: The word “cow” is this.

original: phyogs gcig ni ba lang zhes bya ba yin te de sbyar bas so //
analyzed: phyogs gcig ni ba lang zhes bya ba yin te de sbyar bas so //
translated: The word “this” is one part of the word “cow,” because it is connected with it.

original: tshig gi phyogs gcig gi rnams pa brjod pa ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshig gi phyogs gcig gi rnams pa brjod pa ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of a part of the word is “cow.”

original: brda bshad nas dran pa 'chad pa ni ba lang de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brda bshad nas dran pa 'chad pa ni ba lang de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the sign is “that cow.”

original: gal te 'das pa dang 'brel pa gzung pa na 'das pa @173b 'dzin gyi 'brel pa med par ni ma yin na de ci ltar thams cad pa brjod par brjod snyam na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te 'das pa dang 'brel pa gzung pa na 'das pa @173b 'dzin gyi 'brel pa med par ni ma yin na de ci ltar thams cad pa brjod par brjod snyam na zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one grasps the connection with the past, it is not without a connection with the past. How is it that all is expressed?

original: dran par bya ba dang yongs su mthong bzhin ba nyid lhan cig nyid du'o //
analyzed: dran par bya ba dang yongs su mthong bzhin ba nyid lhan cig nyid du'o //
translated: The object of memory and the object of seeing are simultaneous.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni dran par bya ba mi bden pa dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni dran par bya ba mi bden pa dang ngo //
translated: “ That” refers to the unreal object of memory.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni sngon mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni sngon mthong ba nyid do //
translated: “ That itself” refers to the past seeing.

original: de'i don bya ba gang yin pa de byed ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don bya ba gang yin pa de byed ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it performs the function of that.

original: don bya ba don bya ba zhes bya ba de yang dran pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: don bya ba don bya ba zhes bya ba de yang dran pa nyid yin te /
translated: The function of the object is the object of the function. That also is memory.

original: de ni da lta mngon sum gyis gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni da lta mngon sum gyis gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not grasp the present by direct perception.

original: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba la yod pa'i de'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid kyang dran pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba la yod pa'i de'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid kyang dran pa nyid do //
translated: The word “that” in the phrase “that very thing” refers to the object of memory.

original: des na mngon sum gyi yul ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyi yul ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the intended meaning is that it is not the object of perception.

original: gzhan yang de nyid kyis don bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i nges pa yang med de gzhan gyis kyang byed ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid kyis don bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i nges pa yang med de gzhan gyis kyang byed ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, there is no certainty that the thing that is perceived is the thing that is to be used, because another person can use it.

original: des na don bya ba de byed pa'i phyir dngos po 'di de nyid yin no zhes kyang 'grub pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni de nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na don bya ba de byed pa'i phyir dngos po 'di de nyid yin no zhes kyang 'grub pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni de nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the statement “This thing is that very thing because it performs the function of that thing” is not established.

original: 'di ni tha snyad tsam du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni tha snyad tsam du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Merely conventionally” means

original: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: that the statement “That very thing is this” is merely conventional.

original: gal te gcig med par ni don nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gcig med par ni don nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the thing is not the same in the absence of the other,

original: de'i don nyid ni zhes gsungs so //🔽mtshams sbyor bar byed pa las /
analyzed: de'i don nyid ni zhes gsungs so // mtshams sbyor bar byed pa las /
translated: then the meaning of that statement is as follows.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽If you say that the thing is not the same in the absence of the other,

original: blangs pa la yon tan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: blangs pa la yon tan brjod pa ni /
translated: then the meaning of that statement is as follows.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the absence of the other” is a mere convention.🔽The statement “The thing is not the same in the

original: mtshams sbyor ba po gcig yin zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba po gcig yin zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say that there is one who connects, no.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: No, is the reply.

original: da ni bdag gi khas blangs kyang snga ma dang phyi ma dag gcig tu 'dzin pa med do zhes ston pa ni gal te mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni bdag gi khas blangs kyang snga ma dang phyi ma dag gcig tu 'dzin pa med do zhes ston pa ni gal te mngon sum zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, in order to show that even though he accepts the self, he does not hold that the prior and subsequent moments are identical, he says: If you say that it is perception, no.

original: de tsam gyi zhes bya ba ni bdag la brten pa tsam gyi sos //
analyzed: de tsam gyi zhes bya ba ni bdag la brten pa tsam gyi sos //
translated: To that extent, is the extent of the self’s dependence.

original: de ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum mo //
translated: That is perception.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis shes pa'o //🔽'o na dbang po nyid snga ma dang phyi ma dag la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis shes pa'o // 'o na dbang po nyid snga ma dang phyi ma dag la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: That is, the cognition of perception.

original: des na de la brten pa yang 'jug pa yin no snyam na dbang po yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na de la brten pa yang 'jug pa yin no snyam na dbang po yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Well, then, the sense faculty itself would be engaged with the prior and subsequent moments, and so that which depends on it would also be engaged.

original: dbang po snga ma dang phyi ma la mi 'jug mod /
analyzed: dbang po snga ma dang phyi ma la mi 'jug mod /
translated: The sense faculty is not engaged with the prior and subsequent moments.

original: de'i rje su 'brel pa ni 'jig gog snyam pa ni de'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rje su 'brel pa ni 'jig gog snyam pa ni de'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: However, its continuum is engaged.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: No, is the reply.

original: de'i zhes bya ba dbang po'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba dbang po'i'o //
translated: Its, of the sense faculty.

original: de nyid ces brjod pa ni sngon gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces brjod pa ni sngon gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “that” refers to the previous.

original: sngon gyi dngos po la zhugs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de'i rjes su 'brangs pa de'i med pa ni snga ma la 'jug pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: sngon gyi dngos po la zhugs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de'i rjes su 'brangs pa de'i med pa ni snga ma la 'jug pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that the cognition that engages the previous thing does not engage the nonexistence of that thing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de las gzhan pa'i zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i zhes gsungs te /
translated: He says, “because it is different from that.”

original: mig la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i shes pa mngon sum zhugs pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa ni dbang po de'i rjes su 'brangs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ba chol yin no //🔽de nyid bsdus te @174a * //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i shes pa mngon sum zhugs pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa ni dbang po de'i rjes su 'brangs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ba chol yin no // de nyid bsdus te @174a * //
translated: The cognition that is different from the eye, etc., and that engages the direct perception is the one that engages the sense faculty. This is a mere repetition.

original: ston pa ni gcig nyid du bya ba'o //
analyzed: ston pa ni gcig nyid du bya ba'o //
translated: He summarizes that point and teaches it in a single statement.🔽The meaning of the sentence is that the cognition that is understood to be a single thing is not produced from a sense faculty.

original: mngon sum la gcig nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dbang po las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la gcig nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni dbang po las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent is not refuting the fact that the cognition that is understood to be a single thing is produced from a sense faculty.

original: mngon sum la gcig nyid du rtogs pa gang yin pa dang / gzhan gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum la gcig nyid du rtogs pa gang yin pa dang / gzhan gang yin pa ste /
translated: The cognition that is understood to be a single thing is different from the cognition that is produced from a sense faculty.

original: gnyis po de ni khyad par med de /
analyzed: gnyis po de ni khyad par med de /
translated: These two are not different,

original: gnyis ka yang gcig tu rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang gcig tu rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are of the nature of the realization of unity.

original: mngon sum la gcig nyid du rtogs pa yin pa de ni gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum la gcig nyid du rtogs pa yin pa de ni gsal ba yin la /
translated: The direct perception is the clear realization of unity,

original: gzhan ni mi gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni mi gsal ba yin te /
translated: and the other is the unclear realization.

original: des ji ltar khyad par med ces brtsad pa na grub pa'i mtha' gsungs pa ni gsal nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des ji ltar khyad par med ces brtsad pa na grub pa'i mtha' gsungs pa ni gsal nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the opponent argues that there is no difference between the two, the treatise responds with the lines: “Clarity itself, and so on.”

original: de ltar byung ba ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin dang gcig tu 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de ltar byung ba ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin dang gcig tu 'gyur mod /
translated: Thus, the arising of the object is indeed of the nature of clarity.

original: sngar mthong ba de lta bu dang gcig par ji ltar 'gyur de ni mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba de lta bu dang gcig par ji ltar 'gyur de ni mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But how can it be the same as the previously seen object, since that was unclear?

original: gal te sngon mthong ba 'di dang gcig par mngon sum gyis khong du chud par mi 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te sngon mthong ba 'di dang gcig par mngon sum gyis khong du chud par mi 'gyur mod /
translated: If the opponent argues that the direct perception does not ascertain the object as being the same as the previously seen object,

original: de ltar mthong ba 'di go sngon mthong ba de dang cig car mngon sum gyis ci ste mi rtogs zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba 'di go sngon mthong ba de dang cig car mngon sum gyis ci ste mi rtogs zhe na /
translated: then why does the direct perception not ascertain the object as being simultaneous with the previously seen object?

original: zhes bya ba'o rtsod ba 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa nyid gzung 'jig pa ni gnyi ga zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o rtsod ba 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa nyid gzung 'jig pa ni gnyi ga zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is not a refutation of the opponent’s argument.

original: gal te dran pa med par mthong ba 'byung mod /
analyzed: gal te dran pa med par mthong ba 'byung mod /
translated: If it is granted that there is a perception without memory,🔽then memory is a cooperative condition of the sense faculty.

original: de lta na yang dran pa dbang po'i lhan cig byed par ni 'gyur ba yin no zhe na gang zhig gang gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang dran pa dbang po'i lhan cig byed par ni 'gyur ba yin no zhe na gang zhig gang gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In response to this, Vasubandhu says, “What is it that is the cause of what?”

original: 'dir dper na sa la sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir dper na sa la sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here he gives an example: “It is like the earth, etc.”

original: dran pa dbang po'i lhan cig byed pa ma yin gyi'o //
analyzed: dran pa dbang po'i lhan cig byed pa ma yin gyi'o //
translated: Memory is not a cooperative condition of the sense faculty.

original: de zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the sense consciousness.

original: gzhan dun zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa tha mi dad pas rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: gzhan dun zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa tha mi dad pas rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na'o //
translated: “ Otherwise” means that if it is associated with conceptualization, it is not nonconceptual.

original: mthong ba de yod na yang me dpar 'gyur lam thong ba de med na yang yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de dang ste de lta bu'i rnam par tog pa dang mthong ba de gcig nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba de yod na yang me dpar 'gyur lam thong ba de med na yang yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de dang ste de lta bu'i rnam par tog pa dang mthong ba de gcig nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If that seeing exists, then the thought “The fire exists” arises. If that seeing does not exist, then the thought “The fire exists” does not arise. How could that thought and that seeing be the same?

original: bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid can 'gal ba'i chos dang lnga par brjod pa'i rnam par rtog pa can de ni'o //
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid can 'gal ba'i chos dang lnga par brjod pa'i rnam par rtog pa can de ni'o //
translated: The thought that has the characteristic that has been explained, and that is said to possess contradictory properties, is the thought of the opponent.

original: gal te shes pa de nyid mthong ba de yod kyang 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba yang yin na de'i tshe 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan par brjod pa mdzes pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa de nyid mthong ba de yod kyang 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba yang yin na de'i tshe 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan par brjod pa mdzes pa zhig na /
translated: If that consciousness arises when that seeing exists, and does not arise when that seeing does not exist, then it would be correct to say that it possesses contradictory properties.

original: 'on kyang gang zhig 'ga' zhig pa de ni gzhan kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang zhig 'ga' zhig pa de ni gzhan kho na yin la /
translated: But if that consciousness is different from that seeing,

original: de dang lhan cig pa gang yin pa de yang gzhan yin te /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig pa gang yin pa de yang gzhan yin te /
translated: and if it is different from that which is simultaneous with it,

original: des na 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pas tha dad par ji ltar 'grub snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pas tha dad par ji ltar 'grub snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: then how could it be established as different through possessing contradictory properties?

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de lta yin @174b na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de lta yin @174b na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is: “If that is so, then…”

original: shes pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar ngo shes pa yod kyang /
analyzed: shes pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar ngo shes pa yod kyang /
translated: There is recognition in the form, “This is the same consciousness.”

original: 'dir tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir gzhan du yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir gzhan du yang ngo //
translated: But here, since difference is accepted, it is also different.

original: shes pa las gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub po zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa las gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub po zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The point is that it is not established as being the same as consciousness.

original: ha cang thal bar yang zhes byas ba ni sngon po dang ser po dag kyang gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar yang zhes byas ba ni sngon po dang ser po dag kyang gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: “It would follow, absurdly, that…” means that it would follow, absurdly, that blue and yellow are the same.

original: de yang sngon po 'ba' zhig ba las tshogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang sngon po 'ba' zhig ba las tshogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: This is because, just as in the case of blue, they are different from the collection of causes.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'o //
translated: “That” refers to seeing.

original: gzhan gyi tshe yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med par ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med par ro //
translated: “At other times” refers to the time when there is no conceptualization.

original: nam yang zhes bya ba ni phun po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi lus ni shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam yang zhes bya ba ni phun po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi lus ni shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Never” means that the body, which is characterized by the five aggregates, is the cause of consciousness.

original: shes pa de gnyis zhes bya ba ni mig dang rnam ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa de gnyis zhes bya ba ni mig dang rnam ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: “Those two consciousnesses” refers to the eye consciousness and the mental consciousness.

original: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni ba lang mthong ba'i dus su ba lang du rnam par rtog pa ni yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni ba lang mthong ba'i dus su ba lang du rnam par rtog pa ni yang ngo //
translated: “Also in another way” means that the conceptual thought of a cow is also at the time of seeing a cow.

original: gnas skabs de na zhes bya ba ni brdar rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs de na zhes bya ba ni brdar rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: “At that time” means at the time of conceptual thought as a conventional symbol.

original: tha snyad las zhes bya ba ni ba lang la 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid las so //
analyzed: tha snyad las zhes bya ba ni ba lang la 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid las so //
translated: “From convention” means from the definition of engagement and disengagement with regard to a cow.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rnam par tog pa bsgrub par bya ba 'dir ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rnam par tog pa bsgrub par bya ba 'dir ro //
translated: “Here” means in the proof of conceptual thought.

original: 'dra zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa bde ba'i 'bras bu yin pas ji ltar mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'dra zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa bde ba'i 'bras bu yin pas ji ltar mi 'dzin te /
translated: “Like” means that since the conceptual thought of a cow is the effect of pleasure, why would it not be apprehended?

original: ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa de yang yod pa kho na'o zhes bya bar bsam pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa de yang yod pa kho na'o zhes bya bar bsam pa'o //
translated: The thought is that the conceptual thought of a cow also exists.

original: sgra sbyor bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgra sbyor bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: “The application of the term” means the conceptual thought of a cow.

original: rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is understood.

original: sbyor ba ni 'dir ltar yin te gang zhig gang du tha snyad byed pa de thams cad ni de'i rnam par tog pa sngo du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'dir ltar yin te gang zhig gang du tha snyad byed pa de thams cad ni de'i rnam par tog pa sngo du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: The syllogism is as follows: Whatever is designated as something must be designated as that by the power of that thing, as in the case of a pot, for example.🔽

original: dper na ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa'i de ma thag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa'i de ma thag pa bzhin no //
translated: The argument is as follows: Whatever is the subject of a convention, all that is the object of a concept, as, for example, the cow concept.

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis de ma thag pa 'di yang tha snyad yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis de ma thag pa 'di yang tha snyad yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Immediately after that, there is the other concept, which is the convention.🔽But if, etc. is not the response to the objection that the conclusion is not established by the otherness, etc.🔽Here, the proponent of the conclusion says, “It is not so,” and the response is, “What is it then?”🔽The response is, “It is not the case that the object of a convention is the object of a concept.”🔽The proponent of the conclusion says, “It is not so,” and the response is, “What is it then?”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan nyid kyis sgrub pa'i mtha' gra ba'i dogs pa bsu nas lan 'dabs pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan nyid kyis sgrub pa'i mtha' gra ba'i dogs pa bsu nas lan 'dabs pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, “It is not the case that the object of a convention is the object of a concept.”🔽The proponent of the conclusion says, “It is not so,” and the response is, “What is it then?”🔽The response is, “It is not the case that the object of a convention is the object of a concept.”🔽The proponent of the conclusion says, “It is not so,” and the response is, “What is it then?”🔽The response is, “It is not the case that the object of a convention is the object of a concept.”🔽The proponent of the conclusion says, “It is not so,” and the response is, “What is it then?”🔽The response is, “It is not the case that the object of a convention is the object of a concept.”🔽The proponent of the conclusion says, “It is not so,” and the response is, “What is it then?”🔽The response is, “It is not the case that the object of a convention is the object of a concept.”🔽The proponent of the conclusion says, “It is not so,” and the response is, “What is it then?”🔽The response is, “It is not the case that the object of a convention is the object of a concept.”🔽The proponent of the conclusion says, “It is not so,” and the response is, “What is it then?”🔽The response is, “It is not the case that the object of a convention is the object of a concept.”🔽The proponent of the conclusion says, “It is not so,” and the response is, “What is it then?”

original: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra bas brjod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o / de'i rjes su bya ba ni me rjes su dpong pa'i tshe'o //🔽rjes su dpag pa nyid ston pa ni rig pa ste dro ba'i rnam shes dang / gzhan gyi tha snyad de mi bde ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'dir grub pa'i mtha' smra bas brjod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o / de'i rjes su bya ba ni me rjes su dpong pa'i tshe'o //🔽rjes su dpag pa nyid ston pa ni rig pa ste dro ba'i rnam shes dang / gzhan gyi tha snyad de mi bde ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The response is, “It is not the case that the object of a convention is the

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i me bdag nyid ni grang ba zlog pa na ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i me bdag nyid ni grang ba zlog pa na ste /
translated: The assertion of the opponent is stated in the words “the hidden fire itself is inferred from the cold being stopped.”

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad de las sam /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad de las sam /
translated: The convention of pleasure, etc. is from that,

original: rang gi rig pa'i rnam par shes pa las rtogs pa zhes de ltar @175a * //
analyzed: rang gi rig pa'i rnam par shes pa las rtogs pa zhes de ltar @175a * //
translated: or it is understood from the consciousness that is self-awareness.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas brjod pa la gzhan gyis de yang 'thad par dka' zhes smras so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas brjod pa la gzhan gyis de yang 'thad par dka' zhes smras so //
translated: Thus, the proponent of tenets states. The opponent says, “That is also difficult to accept.”

original: the tshom gyi rnam pa brjod pa ni res 'ga' me med kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi rnam pa brjod pa ni res 'ga' me med kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of doubt is “sometimes there is no fire.”

original: du ba'i rang bzhin las me rtogs pa gang yin pa de de'i dus phyis kyi rig pa'i rnam par shes pa'am grang ba bzlog pa'i tha snyad gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: du ba'i rang bzhin las me rtogs pa gang yin pa de de'i dus phyis kyi rig pa'i rnam par shes pa'am grang ba bzlog pa'i tha snyad gang yin pa des so //
translated: That which is the understanding of fire from the nature of smoke is the consciousness that is the awareness of that at a later time, or the convention of the stopping of cold.

original: de rtogs na ste me de rtogs par khas len na /
analyzed: de rtogs na ste me de rtogs par khas len na /
translated: If that is understood, if one accepts that fire is understood,

original: reg pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: reg pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: it is from the characteristic of the consciousness of touch,

original: gzhan gyi tha snyan gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid de la'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tha snyan gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid de la'o //
translated: or it is from the characteristic of inference from the convention of another.

original: 'di ltar gang dang gang la reg pa'i rnam par shes pa'am grang ba sel ba'i tha snyad yod pa de na med yod pa sngon nyams su myong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dang gang la reg pa'i rnam par shes pa'am grang ba sel ba'i tha snyad yod pa de na med yod pa sngon nyams su myong ba bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, when there is a consciousness that touches or the expression “cold is removed,” there is the absence of cold, as one has experienced it previously.

original: 'di na yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di na yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: And it is the same here. This is an inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa de la yang mi 'khrul pa yang rje su dpag pa gzhan gyis yin no zhes bya ba 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de la yang mi 'khrul pa yang rje su dpag pa gzhan gyis yin no zhes bya ba 'di gang las she na /
translated: And in this inference, the non-erroneous nature is established by another inference. How do you know?

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that it is an inference.

original: gnod par byed pag zhan yang brjod pa ni rig pas ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnod par byed pag zhan yang brjod pa ni rig pas ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The expression “even though weak” refers to the fact that the refutation is established by reasoning.

original: dro ba'i rig pas so //
analyzed: dro ba'i rig pas so //
translated: The reasoning is that of heat.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni mdog gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni mdog gsal ba'o //
translated: The word “form” refers to the clear color.

original: reg pa'i shes pa ni gzugs tsam gyi sgrub byed yin gyi //
analyzed: reg pa'i shes pa ni gzugs tsam gyi sgrub byed yin gyi //
translated: The consciousness of touch is the proof of form alone.🔽If one were to prove a particular form, it would be inconclusive.

original: gzugs kyi khyad par sgrub na ni ma nges pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khyad par sgrub na ni ma nges pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intention.

original: dung ser po ni shes pa'i yul gser mdog dur gang yin pa de la 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dung ser po ni shes pa'i yul gser mdog dur gang yin pa de la 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The yellow conch is the object of the consciousness that is the color of gold. It is the object of the consciousness that is the color of gold.

original: 'di ni rab tu grags pa'i dung dang gser mdog gi dung la re ga'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rab tu grags pa'i dung dang gser mdog gi dung la re ga'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: This is like the case of the consciousness of a conch shell and the consciousness of a golden shell, which are similar.

original: gzugs khyad par dkar po'am ser po ni sgrub par mi nus so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs khyad par dkar po'am ser po ni sgrub par mi nus so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is not possible to establish that the form is white or yellow.

original: gal te reg pa'i rnams par shes pa 'khrul na 'o na gzhan gyis me 'di ba'i tha snyad las rogs so snyam na /
analyzed: gal te reg pa'i rnams par shes pa 'khrul na 'o na gzhan gyis me 'di ba'i tha snyad las rogs so snyam na /
translated: If the consciousness of touch is mistaken, then how is the convention of fire established from the convention of heat?

original: gang du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang du zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “Where?”

original: blo sngon du btang nas byas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan du yang yod pa'o //
analyzed: blo sngon du btang nas byas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan du yang yod pa'o //
translated: “Having previously applied the mind” means that it exists in another way.

original: dper 'ol ma de'i phung po grang ba bzlog pa'i don spre'u rnams kyis bsten par bya ba yin de ci me 'de ba'i tha snyad mthong ba las rjes su dpag par bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: dper 'ol ma de'i phung po grang ba bzlog pa'i don spre'u rnams kyis bsten par bya ba yin de ci me 'de ba'i tha snyad mthong ba las rjes su dpag par bya ba yin nam /
translated: For example, a pile of snow is used by monkeys to remove cold. Is that to be inferred from seeing the convention of fire?

original: ci zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: What is the intention?

original: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here, the proponent of the philosophical system says:

original: de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is also not true.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the inference.

original: rnam par rog pa'i sgrub byed ni de ltar de du ba dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rog pa'i sgrub byed ni de ltar de du ba dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: The proof of the conceptual thought is that it is not related to the smoke.

original: de mi zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de mi zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the hidden.

original: rgyang ring ba la sogs pa zhes sogs pa'i sgras ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid gzung ngo //
analyzed: rgyang ring ba la sogs pa zhes sogs pa'i sgras ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid gzung ngo //
translated: “Far away, etc.” The word “etc.” includes the hidden.

original: des na gzhan rnam par rtog pa'i @175b dus na ni rnam par rtog pa rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa mi 'thad do zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan rnam par rtog pa'i @175b dus na ni rnam par rtog pa rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi yul yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa mi 'thad do zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, when the other conceptual thought occurs, it is not tenable that it is an inference, because it is the object of the direct perception of reflexive awareness.

original: gal te zhes pa la dbang po las 'das pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te zhes pa la dbang po las 'das pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: If you say, “The existence of the imperceptible is like that of the color of the moon.”

original: de lta ma yin na gzhan gyis ci'i phyir ma dmigs des na rnam par rog pa yod kyang res 'ga' dmigs par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhan gyis ci'i phyir ma dmigs des na rnam par rog pa yod kyang res 'ga' dmigs par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it were not so, why would others not perceive it? Therefore, even though the conceptual thought exists, sometimes it is not perceived.

original: khra bo nyid kyang zhes mtshos te dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: khra bo nyid kyang zhes mtshos te dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyang ngo //
translated: “Even the variegation” is a simile for the imperceptible.

original: khyi mthong ba ni g-yung ba'o //
analyzed: khyi mthong ba ni g-yung ba'o //
translated: “The perception of the dog” is the variegation.

original: de ltar rtogs par bya ba ni grang ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs par bya ba ni grang ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
translated: The realization of that is the realization of the nature of cold.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba ba'o //
translated: The expression “in another way” is “in this way.”

original: skye sbu goms pa med pa'i tha snyad na /
analyzed: skye sbu goms pa med pa'i tha snyad na /
translated: The convention of non-habituation is

original: dpyod sogs te rnam par rtog pa dang / the tshom la sogs pa med pa'i phyir tha snyad srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpyod sogs te rnam par rtog pa dang / the tshom la sogs pa med pa'i phyir tha snyad srid pa ma yin no //
translated: “analysis, etc.,” because there is no conceptualization, doubt, etc.

original: de yod na zhes bya ba ni goms pa dang ldan pa nyid yod na ni rnam par dpyod pa la sogs pa med kyang tha snyad de 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de yod na zhes bya ba ni goms pa dang ldan pa nyid yod na ni rnam par dpyod pa la sogs pa med kyang tha snyad de 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: “If that exists” means that if there is the existence of habituation, then that convention is possible even without analysis, etc.

original: rnam pa gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma dpyod pa med par yang ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma dpyod pa med par yang ngo //
translated: “In another way” means without analysis of the prior and the subsequent.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kho po cag gi brjod pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan du ma yin te mi brdzun to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kho po cag gi brjod pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan du ma yin te mi brdzun to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Not in another way” means that what we have said is not otherwise, i.e., it is not false.

original: de'i phyir rna par rtog pa med kyang goms pa las srog chags rnams kyi tha snyad 'jug pa yin no /
analyzed: de'i phyir rna par rtog pa med kyang goms pa las srog chags rnams kyi tha snyad 'jug pa yin no /
translated: Therefore, even without conceptualization, conventions are used by living beings through habituation.

original: 'o na ma goms pa'i gnas skabs na rjes su dpag pas rang gi rgyud kyi tha snyad rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ma goms pa'i gnas skabs na rjes su dpag pas rang gi rgyud kyi tha snyad rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that at the time of non-habituation, one understands the convention of one’s own continuum through inference,

original: mthong ba de nyid la brten te dmigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba de nyid la brten te dmigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: we reply: it is only in dependence on that very seeing.

original: des na mngon sum gyi sgrub pa'i phyir ro //🔽goms pa'i gnas skabs sam /
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyi sgrub pa'i phyir ro // goms pa'i gnas skabs sam /
translated: Because it is established by direct perception.

original: ma goms pa'i gnas skabs su tha snyad kyi rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma goms pa'i gnas skabs su tha snyad kyi rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: Whether at the time of habituation or at the time of non-habituation, there is no inference of convention.

original: dpyod sogs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpyod sogs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Analysis, etc.”

original: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: refers to conceptualization, etc.

original: rnam pa gzhan du 'ang zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa la sogs pa med par yang ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du 'ang zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa la sogs pa med par yang ngo //
translated: “ In another way” means without analysis, etc.

original: dpe dang don dag mtshungs pa nyid ston pa ni de la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe dang don dag mtshungs pa nyid ston pa ni de la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The similarity of the example and the meaning is shown by “in that case.”

original: 'brel pa med par ni mi slu ba nyid mi srid do zhes tha snyad tsam du 'brel pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa med par ni mi slu ba nyid mi srid do zhes tha snyad tsam du 'brel pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression “in this way” is used to indicate a mere conventional connection.

original: gzhi mthun pa ste yul mtshungs pa dag la yod pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa ste yul mtshungs pa dag la yod pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: The expression “in a common locus” means in a common object.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni pa la nga gi mtshan nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni pa la nga gi mtshan nyid kyi'o //
translated: The expression “its” refers to the characteristic of a cow.

original: rtogs pa 'di nyid yin no brjod pa ni ba lang gi sgra ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa 'di nyid yin no brjod pa ni ba lang gi sgra ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression “this is the cognition” is the statement “the word cow.”

original: de ltar bur gyur pa'i yul zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi yul la'o //
analyzed: de ltar bur gyur pa'i yul zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi yul la'o //
translated: The expression “in the object that is like that” refers to the object of perception.

original: 'di yang tha snyad kyi brjod pa yin te /🔽de ltar ma yin na brjod par 'dod pa tsam las byung @176a * //
analyzed: 'di yang tha snyad kyi brjod pa yin te / de ltar ma yin na brjod par 'dod pa tsam las byung @176a * //
translated: This is also a conventional expression.

original: ba'i sgra rnams gang la mi srid pas yin /
analyzed: ba'i sgra rnams gang la mi srid pas yin /
translated: If it were not so, then the words that arise from the mere desire to speak would not be possible in any case.

original: de mthong ba na zhes bya ba ni shing mthong ba na'o //
analyzed: de mthong ba na zhes bya ba ni shing mthong ba na'o //
translated: The expression “when that is seen” means when a tree is seen.

original: ci de ltar rtogs pa mthong ngam zhe na /
analyzed: ci de ltar rtogs pa mthong ngam zhe na /
translated: Is there such a cognition?

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression “by me” refers to the person.

original: mthong ba la ni mthong bzhin pa'o //
