analyzed: mthong ba la ni mthong bzhin pa'o //
translated: That which is seen is the present.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni de ni 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni de ni 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of that is “this.”

original: de zhes bya ba snang ba tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba snang ba tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa ste /
translated: That which is called “this” is the cause of the differentiation of the different appearances.

original: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin ma yin na'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin ma yin na'o //
translated: If there were no different natures,

original: dngos po 'ga' yang tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' yang tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: no entity would be different.

original: 'o na 'di'o zhes snang ba ni don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po'i 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na 'di'o zhes snang ba ni don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po'i 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: But if it is said that the appearance of “this” is the apprehension of an entity that performs a function,

original: des na mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhe na 'di'o zhes bya bar snang ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhe na 'di'o zhes bya bar snang ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the appearance of “this” is also the appearance of “that.”

original: 'di ni de'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni de'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The expression “this is that”

original: shes pa 'di la 'di'o zhes bya bar snang ba yang mdun na gnas pa thams cad kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa lhag par zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa 'di la 'di'o zhes bya bar snang ba yang mdun na gnas pa thams cad kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa lhag par zhen pa yin te /
translated: is the adherence to the nature that is not shared by all that is present in front of one, which appears in this cognition as “this.”

original: des na mngon sum du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na mngon sum du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How then could there be perception,

original: thun mong ba'i dngos po med pas na dngos po la reg pa'i nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ba'i dngos po med pas na dngos po la reg pa'i nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since there is no contact with an entity because there is no common entity?

original: 'on te gang gi tshe mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po gcig la lhag par zhen par byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang gi tshe mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po gcig la lhag par zhen par byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if one is attached to a single thing that is present before him, how is that?

original: thun mong ba nyid dang bral na ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thun mong ba nyid dang bral na ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “If it is devoid of generality.”

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis go nas rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid du sgrub pas brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis go nas rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid du sgrub pas brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to prove that it is non-conceptual by another method, he says, “If it is a conceptual cognition.”

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don la 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don la 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It engages an object that is hidden” means

original: mngon sum du gyur pa la sgra mkho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur pa la sgra mkho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that it is not necessary to have a word for a present object.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni sgra'i yul la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni sgra'i yul la'o //
translated: “In that case” means in the case of a word.

original: sgra dang rtags dang rnam par rtog pa rnams ni yul gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra dang rtags dang rnam par rtog pa rnams ni yul gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a word, an inferential mark, and conceptual cognitions have the same object.

original: 'on te lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if it is the subject of a hidden object, how can it be non-apprehensible?

original: lkog tu gyur pa la 'jug kyang rang bzhin dngos su med pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa la 'jug kyang rang bzhin dngos su med pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that even though it engages a hidden object, it is only the nature of a non-existent thing,

original: rang gi ngo bo la reg na ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la reg na ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, “If it touches its own nature.”

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang mngon sum gnyi ga la lkog tu gyur pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang mngon sum gnyi ga la lkog tu gyur pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between them, because both memory and direct perception engage imperceptible objects.

original: 'on te sgra yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na la 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te sgra yang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na la 'jug pa yin la /
translated: But if sound engages only its own character,

original: de dang yul mtshungs pa dbang po'i rnam par shes pa yang de nyid la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin pa des na thal ba 'dir ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de dang yul mtshungs pa dbang po'i rnam par shes pa yang de nyid la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin pa des na thal ba 'dir ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: and the sense consciousness that has the same object as that engages that very object, then how could this consequence arise?

original: sgra'i shes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i shes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement “The consciousness of sound . . . ”

original: rnam 'grel 'di nyid kyis bshad pa gnyis gsungs pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba ni ci ste thun mong yin yang /
analyzed: rnam 'grel 'di nyid kyis bshad pa gnyis gsungs pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba ni ci ste thun mong yin yang /
translated: The two explanations of this commentary are “Why is that?” and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin na ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin na ni /
translated: If it is conceptual,🔽then it is not a direct perception.

original: gang du mngon sum la 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa @176b med pa de dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang du mngon sum la 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa @176b med pa de dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is “But if it is . . . ”

original: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “If it is . . . ”

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni don gyi rjes su byed pa mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni don gyi rjes su byed pa mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid yin na'o //
translated: The phrase at that time refers to the characteristic of direct perception, which is the conformity with the object.

original: de lta na yang ji ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ji ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how can it be non-conceptual?

original: sgra'i rnam pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i rnam pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase the form of the word itself refers to this.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase if that were so refers to the following.

original: mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa yin par gyur na'o //
analyzed: mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa yin par gyur na'o //
translated: If direct perception were conceptual,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the phrase it would not be refers to the following.🔽If it were not conceptual,

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par ma gyur na'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par ma gyur na'o //
translated: the phrase it would not be refers to the following.

original: nges so zhes nas 'jig rten zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: nges so zhes nas 'jig rten zhes 'brel to //
translated: The phrase the world would not is connected to this.

original: nges pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase definite expression refers to the following.

original: tshogs pas zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang dbang po tshogs pa las so //
analyzed: tshogs pas zhes bya ba ni bag chags dang dbang po tshogs pa las so //
translated: The phrase from the collection refers to the collection of latent impressions and the sense faculties.

original: shes pa ni skye bar 'gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum skye bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni skye bar 'gyur pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum skye bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase consciousness would arise refers to the arising of conceptual direct perception.

original: tshad ma nyid ston pa 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ston pa 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase it would be a valid cognition shows this.

original: tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang don gyi rjes su byed pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang don gyi rjes su byed pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: “Different” refers to a cognition that conforms to a conceptualization and an object.

original: rgyu tha dad pa nyid ston pa ni sgra dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa nyid ston pa ni sgra dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Different causes” are indicated by “sound and . . .”

original: ci ste shes pa gnyis gal te gcig tu ma gyur na tha snyad nyid med par ni 'gyur ro zhe na tha snyad ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci ste shes pa gnyis gal te gcig tu ma gyur na tha snyad nyid med par ni 'gyur ro zhe na tha snyad ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: If the two cognitions are not one, then there would be no conventional usage.

original: 'o na ji ltar tha snyad byed snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar tha snyad byed snyam na /
translated: How, then, is there conventional usage?

original: tshogs pa tsam gyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshogs pa tsam gyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Merely a collection” is stated.

original: rnam par rtog pa med par yang tha snyad ston pa ni gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med par yang tha snyad ston pa ni gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The indication of conventional usage without conceptualization is “another . . .”

original: de'i tshe yang mthong bzhin pa la zhen pa yod pa yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang mthong bzhin pa la zhen pa yod pa yin no zhes rnam par rtog pa gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Another conceptualization” is stated because even then there is attachment to what is being seen.🔽Thus, first, having shown that even without conceptualization there is conventional usage,

original: de ltar na re zhig 'jug pa'i yul de la rnam par rtog pa med kyang tha snyad yod par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig 'jug pa'i yul de la rnam par rtog pa med kyang tha snyad yod par bstan nas /
translated: now, in order to show that even without a real object there is conventional usage, he says,

original: da ni rnam par rtog pa yod kyang tha snyad med do zhes gsungs pa ni sgra sbyor bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni rnam par rtog pa yod kyang tha snyad med do zhes gsungs pa ni sgra sbyor bar bya ba'o //
translated: Now, the statement “although there is conceptualization, there is no conventional usage” is the application of the term.

original: don bya ba sbyor ba'i rang bzhin nyid dbang po'i rnam par shes pa 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: don bya ba sbyor ba'i rang bzhin nyid dbang po'i rnam par shes pa 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that the nature of the application to the object is the sense consciousness,

original: don bya ba yang zhes bya ba'o //🔽rjes su dpag pa med par thal ba zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: don bya ba yang zhes bya ba'o // rjes su dpag pa med par thal ba zhes bya bas ni /
translated: then the statement “the object is also” is made.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yang mngon sum 'jug pas na de nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yang mngon sum 'jug pas na de nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement “it follows that there is no inference” is made because direct perception is engaged with regard to the past and the future, and they are established by that.

original: bshad pa ni gzhan du yang blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bshad pa ni gzhan du yang blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The explanation should be seen elsewhere.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement “in the same way” is made.

original: dper na de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni des de zhes bya ba'i cha med pa yod kyang 'byung ba dbang po las skyes pa yin pa de bzhin du blo gzhan yang dbang po las skyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dpe'i don to //
analyzed: dper na de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni des de zhes bya ba'i cha med pa yod kyang 'byung ba dbang po las skyes pa yin pa de bzhin du blo gzhan yang dbang po las skyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dpe'i don to //
translated: The statement “it is just that” means that just as the part “by that” exists without a part, and arises from the sense faculty, in the same way, the other cognition would arise from the sense faculty. This is the meaning of the example.

original: yang ji ltar na 'di'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'jug pa mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po nges pa nyid @177a * //
analyzed: yang ji ltar na 'di'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'jug pa mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po nges pa nyid @177a * //
translated: Moreover, how is it that the ascertainment of an entity that is present in front, such as “this is blue,” etc.,

original: mi 'thad snyam na 'di la zhes smos so //
analyzed: mi 'thad snyam na 'di la zhes smos so //
translated: is not tenable?  The response to that is “in this regard.”

original: nges par ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pas ma bzung ba'o //
analyzed: nges par ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pas ma bzung ba'o //
translated: “Not ascertained” means not apprehended by a conceptual cognition.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs so zhes bya ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pas so //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs so zhes bya ba'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pas so //
translated: “Form” means the conceptual cognition that has the aspect of “this is form.”

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo la'o //
translated: “In that” refers to the cognition of form.

original: ci ste nyams su myong ba nyid med ces bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo la'o //
analyzed: ci ste nyams su myong ba nyid med ces bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo la'o //
translated: “If there is no experience” means in the cognition of form.

original: rig pa nyams su myong ba med kyang khyed kyi 'dod pa don gyis go ba la sogs pas ngo bo'i tha snyad srid pa yin na /
analyzed: rig pa nyams su myong ba med kyang khyed kyi 'dod pa don gyis go ba la sogs pas ngo bo'i tha snyad srid pa yin na /
translated: “Even though there is no experience of awareness, the convention of an entity is possible through the meaning of your assertion, understanding, etc.”

original: rnam par rtog pa med par gyur pas gsal ba'i rnam par nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin la tha snyad mi srid par ji ltar 'gyur zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med par gyur pas gsal ba'i rnam par nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin la tha snyad mi srid par ji ltar 'gyur zhes 'brel to //
translated: “How is it that the convention is not possible in the nature that is experienced as clear, since it is devoid of conceptualization?”  This is the connection.

original: de ltar blo nyams su myong ba med par khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar blo nyams su myong ba med par khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having accepted that there is no experience of cognition, you have stated that.

original: de ni gzugs kyi blo la yang nyams su myong ba yod pa nyid do zhes bsgrub pa brjod pa ni de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni gzugs kyi blo la yang nyams su myong ba yod pa nyid do zhes bsgrub pa brjod pa ni de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the proof that there is indeed experience of cognition in the case of form is “that.”

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni gzugs mthong dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni gzugs mthong dus na'o //
translated: “At that time” means when form is seen.

original: bdag gi gzugs mthong ba'i zhes bya ba'i rnam pa can rnams par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum de'o //
analyzed: bdag gi gzugs mthong ba'i zhes bya ba'i rnam pa can rnams par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum de'o //
translated: It is the direct perception that has the aspect of “I see form,” which is conceptual.

original: gzugs mthong ba nyid yin nam zhes bya ba ni gzugs mthong ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba nyid yin nam zhes bya ba ni gzugs mthong ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “Is it seeing form?” means it is the nature of seeing form.

original: brtag par bya ba bdag nyid ces bya ba ni bdag gis gzugs mthong ba zhes bya ba'i rnam par brtag par bya ba bdag nyid rtog pa ni /
analyzed: brtag par bya ba bdag nyid ces bya ba ni bdag gis gzugs mthong ba zhes bya ba'i rnam par brtag par bya ba bdag nyid rtog pa ni /
translated: “The object of conceptualization” means the object of conceptualization that has the nature of “I see form.”

original: de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa gnyis zhes bya ba gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rang gi ngo bo'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa gnyis zhes bya ba gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rang gi ngo bo'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: “At that time, the two conceptualizations” are the conceptualization of form and the conceptualization of one’s own nature.

original: ci ste dang po gzugs rnam par rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: ci ste dang po gzugs rnam par rtog pa yin la /
translated: If it is said that the first is the conceptualization of form,

original: phyis ni bdag nyid rnam par rtog pa yin /
analyzed: phyis ni bdag nyid rnam par rtog pa yin /
translated: Later, it is the self that is imagined.

original: gcig la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gcig la zhes gsungs so //
translated: “ In one” is stated.

original: dus gcig tu rnam par rtog pa 'byung pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: dus gcig tu rnam par rtog pa 'byung pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the imagination of the unreal occurs only at one time,

original: mthong ba yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: mthong ba yang zhes smos so //
translated: “ Seeing” is stated.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo'o //
translated: “ That itself” is the cognition of form.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can dang rang gi ngo bo myong ba'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can dang rang gi ngo bo myong ba'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: It has the nature of experiencing form, etc. and the nature of experiencing its own essence.

original: de'i tshe rim pa yang rim pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni blo lta yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe rim pa yang rim pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni blo lta yin pa'i phyir /
translated: At that time, “order and disorder” is stated because the mind is like a lamp.

original: dus gcig tu gnyi ga yang 'gyur //
analyzed: dus gcig tu gnyi ga yang 'gyur //
translated: At one time, both would occur.

original: dogs pa na rim pa ma yin pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dogs pa na rim pa ma yin pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is doubted, there would be disorder.

original: gzhan dag bsam pa mi rtogs pas smra bas ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag bsam pa mi rtogs pas smra bas ni /
translated: Others say that since the speaker does not understand the thought,

original: de yang zhes bya ba ste rim pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ste rim pa med pa'o //
translated: “ That also” is stated, meaning disorder.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni thug pa med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni thug pa med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, “infinite regress” is stated.

original: gal te blo gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa yang bzlas par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te blo gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa yang bzlas par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is said that “one mind” is repeated, etc.

original: gang gis rim ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gang gis rim ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If you say that it is not so,

original: gcig la rim pa ji ltar mi ring zhe na /
analyzed: gcig la rim pa ji ltar mi ring zhe na /
translated: then how is it not so?

original: gzugs la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not so with respect to form.

original: 'on te gcig la mngon par zhe na pa na gzhan la @177b mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur mod de lta bas na yang blo gcig nyid kho na res 'ga' ni de la mngon par zhen par byed la /
analyzed: 'on te gcig la mngon par zhe na pa na gzhan la @177b mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur mod de lta bas na yang blo gcig nyid kho na res 'ga' ni de la mngon par zhen par byed la /
translated: If one is attached to one thing, one is not attached to another. Therefore, even if the mind is one, sometimes it is attached to that, and sometimes it is attached to another.🔽If you say that it is not attached to that,

original: res 'ga' gzhan yin no zhe na mngon par zhen pa ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' gzhan yin no zhe na mngon par zhen pa ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is not attached to that.🔽If it is attached to that,🔽then it is not attached to that.🔽If it is attached to that, then it is not attached to that.🔽If it is not attached to that, then it is not attached to that.🔽If it is attached to that, then it is attached to that.🔽If it is not attached to that, then it is not attached to that.🔽If it is attached to that, then it is attached to that.🔽If it is not attached to that, then it is not attached to that.🔽If it is attached to that, then it is attached to that.🔽If it is not attached to that, then it is not attached to that.🔽If it is attached to that, then it is attached to that.🔽If it is not attached to that, then it is not attached to that.🔽If it is attached to that, then it is attached to that.🔽If it is not attached to that, then it is not attached to that.🔽If it is attached to that, then it is attached to that.🔽If it is not attached to that, then it is not attached to that.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen par byed pa la'o //
translated: If it is attached to that, then it is attached to that.🔽If it is not attached to that, then it is not attached to that.🔽If it is attached to that, then it is attached to that.🔽If it is not attached to that, then it is not attached to that.🔽If it is attached to that, then it is attached to that.🔽If it is not attached to that, then it is not attached to that.🔽If it is attached to that, then it is attached to that.🔽If it is not attached to that, then it is not attached to that.🔽If it is attached to that, then it is attached to that.🔽If it is not attached to that, then it is not attached to that.

original: rnam par tog pa gnyis pa la rnam 'grel nyid 'god pa ni des ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par tog pa gnyis pa la rnam 'grel nyid 'god pa ni des ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is attached to that, then it is attached to that.

original: dus mtshungs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyams su myong ba la /
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyams su myong ba la /
translated: If it is not attached to

original: gzugs kyi rnam shes nyams su myong ba dang / 'di ni gzugs kyi rnam shes myong ba'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa can yod pa na gcig par rtog pa gnyis su thal lo //🔽rnam par rtog pa gnyis su 'gyur mod snyam na nyams su myong ba'i gnod pa bzhag nas sun 'byin pa gzhan nyid brjod pa ni des na de la yang zhes bya ba ni 'di ni gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta🔽bu'i rnam pa can la'o //🔽gzhan la du zhes bya ba ni 'di ni gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa can du'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam shes nyams su myong ba dang / 'di ni gzugs kyi rnam shes myong ba'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa can yod pa na gcig par rtog pa gnyis su thal lo // rnam par rtog pa gnyis su 'gyur mod snyam na nyams su myong ba'i gnod pa bzhag nas sun 'byin pa gzhan nyid brjod pa ni des na de la yang zhes bya ba ni 'di ni gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i rnam pa can la'o // gzhan la du zhes bya ba ni 'di ni gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa can du'o //
translated: If there were an experience of the consciousness of form, and if there were an experience of the consciousness of form in the aspect “This is the consciousness of form,” then it would follow that there would be two consciousnesses.🔽If you think that there would be two consciousnesses, then, setting aside the refutation by experience, he states another refutation:🔽“In that case, there would be two consciousnesses” means in the aspect “This is the consciousness of form” and so on.🔽“In another” means in the consciousness that has the aspect “This is the consciousness of form” and so on.🔽

original: gzhan phyis 'byung ba nyid brjod pa ni /🔽mngon sum mam zhes bya ba'o //🔽de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ni blo phyis ma skyes pa'i tshe yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan phyis 'byung ba nyid brjod pa ni /🔽mngon sum mam zhes bya ba'o //🔽de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ni blo phyis ma skyes pa'i tshe yang ngo //

form, and the experience of the consciousness of form

original: rig pa ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs rig pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs rig pa'o //
translated: “Consciousness” is the consciousness of form.

original: 'di ni grangs can gyi lugs yin te de dag gi ni rig pa rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni grangs can gyi lugs yin te de dag gi ni rig pa rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the Sāṃkhya position, because they accept that consciousness is permanent.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the response is “Well then…”

original: gzugs 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi rig pa blo phyi mas mi gzung ba'i 'on kyang rig pa tsam zhig mthun par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyi rig pa blo phyi mas mi gzung ba'i 'on kyang rig pa tsam zhig mthun par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that although the consciousness that has the nature of apprehending form is not apprehended by a later mind, it is similar in that it is just consciousness.

original: gal te gzugs nyams su myong bar bgyi bas ma bzung mod /
analyzed: gal te gzugs nyams su myong bar bgyi bas ma bzung mod /
translated: If you say that it is not apprehended because it is the experiencer of form,🔽then the cognition of form would be apprehended.

original: de lta na yang gzugs kyi blo ni gzung bar 'gyur ro zhe na blo gzhan yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta na yang gzugs kyi blo ni gzung bar 'gyur ro zhe na blo gzhan yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: The response to that is “Another cognition…”

original: gang gis gzugs 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ma bzung bar blo gzung bar 'gyur ba gzugs 'dzi pa las gzugs kyis blo gzhan yang yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis gzugs 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ma bzung bar blo gzung bar 'gyur ba gzugs 'dzi pa las gzugs kyis blo gzhan yang yod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no other cognition of form that apprehends form that is not apprehended by the consciousness that has the nature of apprehending form.

original: ci ste blo'i rang bzhin rtogs pa sems pa yod pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas phyir ma 'dzin pa'i dus na yang yod pa yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste blo'i rang bzhin rtogs pa sems pa yod pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas phyir ma 'dzin pa'i dus na yang yod pa yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: But if you think that the nature of cognition is characterized by the existence of thought, then it exists even when it does not grasp an object.

original: lan brjod pa ni 'o na na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan brjod pa ni 'o na na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “If that is so . . .”

original: de'i tshe ni phyi ma 'dzi pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni phyi ma 'dzi pa'i dus na'o //
translated: “At that time” is when it does not grasp an object.

original: gang du nye bar mkho ba yin zhes bya ba ni rtog pa'i rang bzhin gzung yang gzugs 'dzin pa ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du nye bar mkho ba yin zhes bya ba ni rtog pa'i rang bzhin gzung yang gzugs 'dzin pa ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Where is it useful?” is because the nature of thought is grasped, but form is not grasped.

original: gang yang nye bar mkho ba med do //🔽gzugs 'dzin pa'i rang @178a * //
analyzed: gang yang nye bar mkho ba med do // gzugs 'dzin pa'i rang @178a * //
translated: It is not useful anywhere.

original: bzhin ma bzung mod /
analyzed: bzhin ma bzung mod /
translated: The nature of the apprehension of form is not grasped.

original: ci skyon snyam na des na zhes smos so //
analyzed: ci skyon snyam na des na zhes smos so //
translated: What is the problem with that? “Therefore . . .”

original: 'di yin no zhes da ltar bar bstan pa mi 'thad de gzung bzhin pa nyid la de ltar bsnyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yin no zhes da ltar bar bstan pa mi 'thad de gzung bzhin pa nyid la de ltar bsnyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable to indicate it as present, because it is designated in that way with respect to what is being grasped.

original: gzugs 'dzin pa de ni 'das pa'i rang bzhin kho nar mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa des na byung bar gyur to zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na de ltar ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin pa de ni 'das pa'i rang bzhin kho nar mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa des na byung bar gyur to zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na de ltar ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: If the apprehension of form is the direct perception of the past alone, then it would be called “that which has occurred.”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “If it were like that” is the opponent’s opinion.

original: de lta na yang 'das pa nyid kyis ni byung bar gyur ro zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'das pa nyid kyis ni byung bar gyur ro zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: “Even so, it would be called ‘that which has occurred’ because it is past.

original: da ltar ba nyid kyis ni mngon sum gyis gzung ba nyid du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bsams pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba nyid kyis ni mngon sum gyis gzung ba nyid du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bsams pa'o //
translated: It would be called ‘apprehended by direct perception’ because it is present.” This is the opponent’s thought.

original: lan ni de ltar yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de ltar yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “If it were like that.”

original: blo phyi ma'i dus na ci ltar gzugs 'dzin pa gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du sngar yang yin te des na 'das pa nyid kyang sngar yod do zhes bya ba 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: blo phyi ma'i dus na ci ltar gzugs 'dzin pa gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du sngar yang yin te des na 'das pa nyid kyang sngar yod do zhes bya ba 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the apprehension of form were the nature of both at the time of the later cognition, it would also be like that earlier. Therefore, the past also existed earlier. This is the meaning of “even so.”

original: kun gyi tshe 'das pa yin gyi rgyus gzugs 'dzin pa de ni kun tshe ste /
analyzed: kun gyi tshe 'das pa yin gyi rgyus gzugs 'dzin pa de ni kun tshe ste /
translated: The apprehension of form by the cause exists at all times.

original: dus tha dad du da ltar ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dus tha dad du da ltar ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not present at different times.

original: de ltar yin dang gzugs 'dzin pa yod do zhes bya ba ma 'thad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang gzugs 'dzin pa yod do zhes bya ba ma 'thad par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, it would not be tenable to say that the present form is apprehended.

original: 'das pa ni da ltar ba nyid du bstan pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa ni da ltar ba nyid du bstan pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable to teach that the past is present.

original: 'on te sngar gzugs 'dzin pa da ltar byung ba yin la zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te sngar gzugs 'dzin pa da ltar byung ba yin la zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: But if it is said that the present form is apprehended earlier,🔽it would not be one.

original: gcig ces bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni da ltar dang 'das pa dag phan chun spangs te 'gal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig ces bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni da ltar dang 'das pa dag phan chun spangs te 'gal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the past and present were mutually exclusive,

original: 'on te 'das pa dang de ltar gcig yin na gnyi ga yang da ltar ba dang 'das pa nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'das pa dang de ltar gcig yin na gnyi ga yang da ltar ba dang 'das pa nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: but if they were one, both would be apprehended as present and past.

original: rim gyis gnyi ga yang yin zhes rim gyis 'dzin na zhes smos so //
analyzed: rim gyis gnyi ga yang yin zhes rim gyis 'dzin na zhes smos so //
translated: If it is said that both are apprehended gradually,

original: ji ltar mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i dngos po de kho na ltar rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i dngos po de kho na ltar rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
translated: it is established just as it is apprehended by direct perception.

original: de lta ma yin nam 'dres pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin nam 'dres pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be mixed.

original: mngon sum gyis sngon po'i rang bzhin du gzung ba yang sngon po ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis sngon po'i rang bzhin du gzung ba yang sngon po ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and the direct perception that apprehends the nature of blue would also be non-blue.

original: de bzhin du gal te mngon sum la rim par snang na 'di rim pa can kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te mngon sum la rim par snang na 'di rim pa can kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, if direct perception appears gradually, it would be gradual alone.

original: rim gyis gzung ba ni rim pa med par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rim gyis gzung ba ni rim pa med par mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that what is apprehended gradually is not gradual.

original: rim pa can yang ji ltar gcig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: rim pa can yang ji ltar gcig tu 'gyur /
translated: And how could what is gradual be one?

original: gcig la rim pa ci ltar mi 'thad snyam na gcig spangs nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig la rim pa ci ltar mi 'thad snyam na gcig spangs nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that it is not tenable that what is one is gradual, then it is said, “Having abandoned one. . . .”🔽If it is impossible to apprehend gradually what is ascertained, then it would be remembered.

original: gal te nges pa la rim gyis 'dzin pa mi srid na 'o na dran par 'gyur ro zhe na dran pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te nges pa la rim gyis 'dzin pa mi srid na 'o na dran par 'gyur ro zhe na dran pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, “Memory also. . . .”

original: gzugs 'dzin pa'i rtog pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin pa'i rtog pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Any conception that apprehends form

original: mngon sum gyi rang bzhin nam dran pa'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rang bzhin nam dran pa'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: whether it has the nature of direct perception, the nature of memory,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rang @178b bzhin yin yang rung ste med pa kho nar thal lo //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rang @178b bzhin yin yang rung ste med pa kho nar thal lo //
translated: or the nature of inference, it would follow that it would be nonexistent.

original: rnam 'grel gyi phyed dang po bshad nas phyag phyi ma 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel gyi phyed dang po bshad nas phyag phyi ma 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having explained the first half of the commentary on the Pramānﬁ avārtika, he explains the second half:

original: myong ba 'di'i rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa med mod /
analyzed: myong ba 'di'i rang gi ngo bos rtogs pa med mod /
translated: If one thinks that there is no direct perception of the nature of this experience,🔽what is the harm?

original: chad pa ci yod snyam na de lta na 'di su'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chad pa ci yod snyam na de lta na 'di su'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In that case, whose is it?

original: gzhan gyi rtog la rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de dang rang gi rang bzhin 'dzin pa 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtog la rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de dang rang gi rang bzhin 'dzin pa 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: That which is the nature of the inference of another’s thought would be similar to the nature of one’s own thought.

original: 'di ni rang gi blo yin no zhes rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi blo yin no zhes rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One would not think that this is one’s own thought.

original: gzhan gyi rtog pa gang yin pa dang bdag gi blo gang yin pa nyid gang yang 'das pa dran pa rang bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtog pa gang yin pa dang bdag gi blo gang yin pa nyid gang yang 'das pa dran pa rang bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of that which is another’s thought and that which is one’s own thought are not different in the memory of the past.

original: 'di ji ltar shes par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes par bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How is this to be known?

original: 'di'i don ci yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di'i don ci yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: 'dod pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa med par smra bar rig pa can la sogs pa ni ji ltar gzhan gyi blo blo gzhan gyis yongs su gcod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'dod pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa med par smra bar rig pa can la sogs pa ni ji ltar gzhan gyi blo blo gzhan gyis yongs su gcod pa de bzhin du /
translated: “It is just desire” means that the Naiyāyikas and others who advocate the nonexistence of reflexive awareness assert that just as one mind comprehends another mind,

original: rang gi blo yang yongs su gcod par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi blo yang yongs su gcod par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: so too one mind comprehends itself.

original: des na ji ltar de la 'di thal cang thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ji ltar de la 'di thal cang thal bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it be that this consequence is not entailed for them?

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa gsal ba'i don du smras pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa gsal ba'i don du smras pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second conception is stated in terms of the meaning of clarity: “Or else, if the comprehension of another mind and the comprehension of one’s own mind are the same . . .”

original: gzhan gyi blo gang yin pa de yongs su gcod pa dang / rang gi blo yongs su mtshungs pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi blo gang yin pa de yongs su gcod pa dang / rang gi blo yongs su mtshungs pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the comprehension of another mind and the comprehension of one’s own mind are the same,

original: de la gzhan gyis smras pa nyid de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyis smras pa nyid de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is not the case that “that is not spoken by another.”

original: gzhan gyi blo yongs su gcod pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi blo yongs su gcod pa dang rang gi blo yongs su gcod pa ni mtshungs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi blo yongs su gcod pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi blo yongs su gcod pa dang rang gi blo yongs su gcod pa ni mtshungs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Because there is no comprehension of another mind” means that the comprehension of another mind and the comprehension of one’s own mind are not the same.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gzhan gyi blo ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gzhan gyi blo ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other's cognition is clarified by the words, that very cognition.

original: ji ltar yongs su gcod ces pa ni rang gi blo'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su gcod ces pa ni rang gi blo'o //
translated: How is it ascertained? refers to one's own cognition.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Otherwise,

original: gal te mngon sum byas pa yang 'das pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i'o //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum byas pa yang 'das pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i'o //
translated: if the object of direct perception were past,

original: de yang ni rjes su dpag pa'o ;
analyzed: de yang ni rjes su dpag pa'o ;
translated: then that would be inference.

original: / mtshungs pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi blo yongs su gcod pa dang / dang gi blo yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: / mtshungs pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi blo yongs su gcod pa dang / dang gi blo yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: In the same way refers to the ascertainment of the other's cognition and the ascertainment of one's own cognition.

original: gzhal ba'i tshad mas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhal ba'i tshad mas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By the valid cognition of inference

original: don gyis go ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don gyis go ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: refers to presumption and so on.

original: yang ji ltar na rjes su dpag pa nyid du khyad par med na gzhan gyi blo bzhin du rang gi blo yang gzhan 'brel ba nyid mi rtog snyam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //🔽gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi blo'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang ji ltar na rjes su dpag pa nyid du khyad par med na gzhan gyi blo bzhin du rang gi blo yang gzhan 'brel ba nyid mi rtog snyam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba'o // gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi blo'i rang bzhin no //
translated: How then is it that, if there is no difference in being an inference, one's own cognition, like the other's cognition, does not conceive the connection? This is the other.🔽The other refers to the nature of one's own cognition.

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi blo'i rang bzhin nyid du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi blo'i rang bzhin nyid du'o //
translated: In another way refers to the nature of the other's cognition.

original: mngon su byed pa'i rang bzhin du 'dzin pa yin na ni rjes su dpag pa'i dran pa la /
analyzed: mngon su byed pa'i rang bzhin du 'dzin pa yin na ni rjes su dpag pa'i dran pa la /
translated: If it is held to be the nature of manifestation, then it is the memory of inference.🔽

original: rang gi blo'i rang bzhin du nges pa 'di srid par 'gyur ro //🔽ji ltar @179a * //
analyzed: rang gi blo'i rang bzhin du nges pa 'di srid par 'gyur ro // ji ltar @179a * //
translated: If it is the nature of manifestation, then this ascertainment of the nature of one’s own mind would be possible in the memory of inference.

original: srid snyam na 'dzin pa snga ma'i rjes 'jug phyir te rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid snyam na 'dzin pa snga ma'i rjes 'jug phyir te rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is it possible? Because it is subsequent to the prior apprehension, because it follows it.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis de'i rang bzhin nam yang ma rtogs na de'i tshe ji ltar rjes su dpag pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis de'i rang bzhin nam yang ma rtogs na de'i tshe ji ltar rjes su dpag pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: If perception never cognized its nature, then how could inference cognize it?

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang 'brel pa nyid du mngon sum med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang 'brel pa nyid du mngon sum med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just so means that because perception does not relate to another, it is not self-cognition.

original: rang gi phyogs la skyon spongs pa ni rang rig pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs la skyon spongs pa ni rang rig pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The defense of one’s own position is that if it is self-cognition,

original: de dang gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa ma yin pas byas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang gzhan gyis byas pa zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa ma yin pas byas pa'o //
translated: it is produced by itself and by another.

original: de lta ma yin na ni zhes pa rang gi lus dang 'brel pa nyid du rjes su dpag na ni gzhan yin no zhes bya ba rang gi blo'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni zhes pa rang gi lus dang 'brel pa nyid du rjes su dpag na ni gzhan yin no zhes bya ba rang gi blo'o //
translated: If it were not so, then if one infers that it is related to one’s own body, it is other. This is my own thought.

original: 'di la lan ni bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽'byung bar gyur pa'i rnam 'grel gyi don brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // 'byung bar gyur pa'i rnam 'grel gyi don brjod pa ni /
translated: If it were otherwise, then it would be inferred that it is related to one’s own body, and it would be said that it is different. This is my own opinion.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is as follows.🔽The meaning of the statement “If it is the self that is the object of the notion ‘I’ ” is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.

original: rtsod pa 'di la re zhig rang nyid kyi skyon brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di la re zhig rang nyid kyi skyon brjod pa ni /
translated: The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi blo zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rnam pa can gyi blo 'dzin pa nyid gzugs 'dzin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi blo zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi rnam pa can gyi blo 'dzin pa nyid gzugs 'dzin pa yin gyi /
translated: The response to this is as follows.

original: gzugs 'dzin pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no /🔽gzugs kyi blo la yang de ltar 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no / gzugs kyi blo la yang de ltar 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.

original: blo ni de ltar 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blo ni de ltar 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.

original: gzugs kyi blo'i blo dus phyi ma 'byung ba dag yin pa de 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi blo'i blo dus phyi ma 'byung ba dag yin pa de 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as follows.🔽The response to this is as

original: blo gzhan khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo gzhan khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you do not accept any other cognition.

original: dper na gzugs kyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa rig pa nyid gzugs rig pa yin pa de bzhin du gal te gzugs kyi blo'i rnam pa can rig pa srid na ni /
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa rig pa nyid gzugs rig pa yin pa de bzhin du gal te gzugs kyi blo'i rnam pa can rig pa srid na ni /
translated: For example, just as the cognition that has the aspect of form is the cognition of form, in the same way, if it were possible for the cognition that has the aspect of the cognition of form to be the cognition of that,

original: de'i tshe rig pa zhig na 'on kyang blo'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa rig pa ni srid pa ma yin te tha dad pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / rang rig pa ni khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rig pa zhig na 'on kyang blo'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa rig pa ni srid pa ma yin te tha dad pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / rang rig pa ni khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then at that time, there would be a cognition, but it is not possible for the cognition that has the aspect of the cognition to be the cognition of that, because it is impossible for them to be different, and because we do not accept reflexive awareness.🔽The cognition of the cognition of form

original: blo'i blo yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blo'i blo yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is also like that.

original: gzugs kyi blo'i blo gang yin pa de yang 'dzin pa de de'i 'dzin par byed pa yang gzhan yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi blo'i blo gang yin pa de yang 'dzin pa de de'i 'dzin par byed pa yang gzhan yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cognition of the cognition of form is also like that. If the apprehension of that is the apprehension of that, then the meaning is that the apprehension of that is the apprehension of that.🔽If that were so,

original: de ltar 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni thug pa med par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni thug pa med par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: there would be an infinite regress.

original: thams cad ma bzung ba nyid du ba ni gcig ma grub na thams cad mi 'grub po zhes dgongs pa'o ;
analyzed: thams cad ma bzung ba nyid du ba ni gcig ma grub na thams cad mi 'grub po zhes dgongs pa'o ;
translated: The meaning is that if one is not established, all are not established.

original: / gzugs kyi blo'i blo gang yin pa de ma bzung ba nyid pa yin na ste /
analyzed: / gzugs kyi blo'i blo gang yin pa de ma bzung ba nyid pa yin na ste /
translated: If the cognition of the cognition of form is not apprehended,

original: 'dzin byed kyi blo phyi ma med na'o //
analyzed: 'dzin byed kyi blo phyi ma med na'o //
translated: if the subsequent cognition that apprehends it does not exist.

original: de zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo'i blo la zhugs pa'i gzung ba gzugs kyi blo'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo'i blo la zhugs pa'i gzung ba gzugs kyi blo'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: “If it has entered” means that the object that has entered the cognition of the cognition of form is the characteristic of the cognition of the cognition of form.

original: de lta min na gzugs kyi blo ma rtogs na gzugs kyi blo'i blo gang yin pa de ma @179b bzung ba nyid yin na ste /
analyzed: de lta min na gzugs kyi blo ma rtogs na gzugs kyi blo'i blo gang yin pa de ma @179b bzung ba nyid yin na ste /
translated: Otherwise, if the cognition of form is not realized, if the cognition of the cognition of form is not apprehended,

original: 'dzin byed kyi blo phyi ma med na'o //
analyzed: 'dzin byed kyi blo phyi ma med na'o //
translated: if the subsequent cognition that apprehends it does not exist.

original: de zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: “If it has entered” means the characteristic of the cognition of the cognition of form.

original: de lta min na gzugs kyi blo ma rtogs na /
analyzed: de lta min na gzugs kyi blo ma rtogs na /
translated: Otherwise, if the cognition of form is not realized,

original: gzugs kyi blo ma zhugs pa'i gzugs kyang mi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi blo ma zhugs pa'i gzugs kyang mi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the form that has not entered the cognition of form is not realized. This is the meaning.

original: da ni rnam 'grel la brjod pa'i gnod byed brjod pa ni blo'i blos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni rnam 'grel la brjod pa'i gnod byed brjod pa ni blo'i blos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, the objection stated in the Pramānﬁ avārtika is stated:

original: ci ste blo dang po'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo gcig tu de'i de ma thag tu ni blo'i //
analyzed: ci ste blo dang po'i zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi blo gcig tu de'i de ma thag tu ni blo'i //
translated: If it is said that the first cognition is the object of the second cognition,

original: de bzhin du yang gzugs kyi blo de nas yang de'i blo'i blo yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gzugs kyi blo de nas yang de'i blo'i blo yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Likewise, the cognition of form is the cognition of the cognition of that.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /🔽rgyun mi 'chad par snang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni / rgyun mi 'chad par snang mi 'gyur //
translated: It will be explained.🔽It will be explained in the following verse:

original: zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: “The cognition of the object does not appear as a continuum.”

original: gcig tu ni rigs gcig par ro //
analyzed: gcig tu ni rigs gcig par ro //
translated: In one place means in one class.

original: mngon sum du gcig nyid ces bya ba ni mngon sum gyi ngo bor gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de dang ldan par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du gcig nyid ces bya ba ni mngon sum gyi ngo bor gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de dang ldan par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In one direct perception means that it is not understood to possess the oneness that is the nature of direct perception.

original: rigs gcig pa'i blo mngon sum gyi rang bzhin gcig tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs gcig pa'i blo mngon sum gyi rang bzhin gcig tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cognition of one class does not become the one nature of direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir zhes rnam par chad par zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes rnam par chad par zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why? Because it is interrupted.

original: blo de la rigs mthun pa'i rigs blo snga ma dang / phyi ma rnams rnam par chad par snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: blo de la rigs mthun pa'i rigs blo snga ma dang / phyi ma rnams rnam par chad par snang ba yin gyi /
translated: In that cognition, the previous and subsequent cognitions of the same class appear as interrupted.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i ngo bor ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i ngo bor ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not appear as the nature of a continuum.

original: gcig snang ba na gnyis pa snang ba med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig snang ba na gnyis pa snang ba med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if one appears, it follows that the second does not appear.

original: de ltar yin dang gang gi tshe blo snga ma gcig snang ba de'i rjes thogs la blo gzhan snang ba de'i tshe blo snga ma mi snang ba'i phyir de la ltos nas blo'i blo dran par 'gyur ro zhes sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang gang gi tshe blo snga ma gcig snang ba de'i rjes thogs la blo gzhan snang ba de'i tshe blo snga ma mi snang ba'i phyir de la ltos nas blo'i blo dran par 'gyur ro zhes sngar brjod zin to //
translated: As such, when the former cognition appears, and at the time when the other cognition appears, the former cognition does not appear, then in dependence on that, the cognition of the cognition would be recollection.🔽This has already been stated.

original: kyang sgra ni de ltar na yang zhes bya ba'i don la yin te de lta na yang 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyang sgra ni de ltar na yang zhes bya ba'i don la yin te de lta na yang 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “also” means “in that case,” and the meaning is that even so, there is no contradiction.

original: shes pa gang gis brdar bya mi nus pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa gang gis brdar bya mi nus pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is unable to be indicated by any cognition is called “that.”

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i 'dzin pa gang yin pa'i gzung pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i 'dzin pa gang yin pa'i gzung pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is the apprehended object of nonconceptual apprehension is called “that.”

original: de ltar bur gyur pa'i gzung bar bya ba rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa gang la yod pa zhes de la yang 'bru mang pos bsdu pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bur gyur pa'i gzung bar bya ba rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa gang la yod pa zhes de la yang 'bru mang pos bsdu pa'o //
translated: The compound “that which has the nature of the apprehended object” means that which has the nature of the apprehended object.

original: gzhan dang yang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig pa'i don gyi gsum pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dang yang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig pa'i don gyi gsum pa yin la /
translated: “Also” means the third case, the dative.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i gsum pa'o //
translated: “By its own nature” is the third case, the dative.

original: de bzhin du yin par pas blangs na ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du yin par pas blangs na ni /
translated: If it were so,

original: de'i tshi gzugs la sogs pa yang byed pa po 'dzin byed gzhan gyis sgra'i chos gzhan dang lhan cig sbyor bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshi gzugs la sogs pa yang byed pa po 'dzin byed gzhan gyis sgra'i chos gzhan dang lhan cig sbyor bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: then form, etc. would not be able to be connected with another sound, which is the instrument, because they are different.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “By their own nature” and so on.

original: 'o na snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, “Because they do not appear,”

original: rang gi ngo bos snang ba ma yin pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos snang ba ma yin pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, “They do not appear by their own nature.”
If they do not appear,

original: snang ba la ni rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa nyid med par de sbyor bar ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: snang ba la ni rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa nyid med par de sbyor bar ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could they be connected without being cognized by their own nature?

original: de dang don gcig na zhes bya ba ni sgra de dang don gcig pa de rtogs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dang don gcig na zhes bya ba ni sgra de dang don gcig pa de rtogs pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: “That which has the same object” means that which has the same object as that sound.

original: de'i don zhes bya ba ni spyod pa pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i don zhes bya ba ni spyod pa pa'i'o //
translated: “Its object” is that of the experiencer.

original: de lta yin na ni 'di ba lang ngo snyam pa'i rnam pa dang // bcas pa sgra'i rnam pa dang / 'dres pa'i shes pa ni khyad par te rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni 'di ba lang ngo snyam pa'i rnam pa dang // bcas pa sgra'i rnam pa dang / 'dres pa'i shes pa ni khyad par te rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: If that were so, then the cognition that is mixed with the form of the word, along with the form “This is a cow,” would not be a cognition that apprehends a specific particular.

original: khyad par sngar dang sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par sngar dang sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not connected with the specific particular that was previously perceived.

original: rgyu tha dad pa nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The reason for the difference is stated: “because of the difference in the cause.”🔽The power of the other latent impressions that are called “habitual” is due to the word that was experienced at the time of the convention, at the time of the convention.

original: brda'i dus de brda pa'i tshe nyams su myong ba'i sgra gang yin pa des goms pa zhes bya ba'i bag chags gzhan pa gang yin pa de'i stobs nyid la ste /🔽padma'i dbang gis skye ba'ang yin no //
analyzed: brda'i dus de brda pa'i tshe nyams su myong ba'i sgra gang yin pa des goms pa zhes bya ba'i bag chags gzhan pa gang yin pa de'i stobs nyid la ste / padma'i dbang gis skye ba'ang yin no //
translated: The power of the latent impressions is due to the word that was experienced at the time of the convention, at the time of the convention.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.

original: nyid kyi sgra'i rnam par gcad par bya ba brjod pa ni mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //🔽spyi'i rnam pa gnyis kyang zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra ba rnams la yang ba lang zhes nang gi pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nyid kyi sgra'i rnam par gcad par bya ba brjod pa ni mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //🔽spyi'i rnam pa gnyis kyang zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra ba rnams la yang ba lang zhes nang gi pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate the eye and so on.🔽The words “and so on” are stated to indicate

original: de mig la sogs pa las mi 'byung ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de mig la sogs pa las mi 'byung ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why does it not arise from the eye, etc.?

original: bshad pa mig la sogs pa yod kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa mig la sogs pa yod kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response: “Even though the eye, etc. exist,” etc.

original: de dang rje su mthun pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de dang bral ba'i sems gang la yod pa'i skyes bu la sgra dang spyi'i rnam pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang rje su mthun pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de dang bral ba'i sems gang la yod pa'i skyes bu la sgra dang spyi'i rnam pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The person who is devoid of the latent impressions that are in conformity with that, i.e., with the form of the cow, does not have that form of the cow.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rgyu rjes su 'brel pa la snang bas don gang yin pa de dang lhan cig 'di ba lang zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis zhig mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rgyu rjes su 'brel pa la snang bas don gang yin pa de dang lhan cig 'di ba lang zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis zhig mthun pa'o //
translated: The object that appears in the continuity of the cause of the eye, etc., is the same as that with which this form of the cow is in conformity.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi gzung ba dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi gzung ba dang ngo //
translated: “ That” refers to the object that is grasped by direct perception.

original: de 'dzin pa'i shes pa mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid dang / mig la sogs pa'i rgyun gcig la rag las pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de 'di'o snyam pas des gzung ba ma yin par mngon sum la snang ba'i geg la sogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa'i shes pa mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid dang / mig la sogs pa'i rgyun gcig la rag las pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de 'di'o snyam pas des gzung ba ma yin par mngon sum la snang ba'i geg la sogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The consciousness that grasps that is the characteristic of direct perception. That which is dependent on the continuity of the eye, etc., is the consciousness that thinks, “This is it.” It is not the case that the object that appears to direct perception, such as a mirage, is not grasped by it.

original: gzhan gyi gzung ba de dang yang gzhi mthun pa can nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gzung ba de dang yang gzhi mthun pa can nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that there is a common locus of that which is grasped by others.

original: da ni gzhi mthun pa nyid mi srid do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: da ni gzhi mthun pa nyid mi srid do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to state that a common locus is impossible, he says:

original: rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ste gsal ba dang mi gsal pa'i rnams pa gnyis nyams su myong ba de las ma gtogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba ste gsal ba dang mi gsal pa'i rnams pa gnyis nyams su myong ba de las ma gtogs pa'i'o //
translated: “two aspects” refers to the experience of two aspects, clear and unclear, apart from that.

original: khyad par med pa nyid bstan pa'i don du gzhan gyi brjod pa ni rang bzhin gnyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa nyid bstan pa'i don du gzhan gyi brjod pa ni rang bzhin gnyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no difference, the opponent says, “two natures.”

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam par gzhi mthun pa med pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don dam par gzhi mthun pa med pa nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, beginning with “in this way,” he demonstrates that ultimately there is no common locus.

original: shes pa 'di gnyis po 'ba' zhig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: shes pa 'di gnyis po 'ba' zhig ces bya ba la /
translated: “These two cognitions” refers to

original: de zhes bya ba ni shes pa gcig yin la 'di zhes bya ba ni shes pa @180b gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni shes pa gcig yin la 'di zhes bya ba ni shes pa @180b gnyis pa yin no //
translated: “that” is one cognition, and “this” is the second cognition.

original: gnyis su snang ba gzhan la zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba gzhan la zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: “In other dualistic appearances” refers to such things as a pot and a cloth.

original: bag chags zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: bag chags zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “Habitual tendencies” is the reply.

original: bag chags sad pa yang gzhan la ci ste med snyam na don bya ba'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bag chags sad pa yang gzhan la ci ste med snyam na don bya ba'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why should not the awakening of the latent impressions be in another?🔽The answer is: “The object-referent is the cause of the arising of the cognition.”

original: shes pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan smra ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan smra ba'o //
translated: The other party says: “The two cognitions.”

original: lan ni bag chags zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni bag chags zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: “The latent impressions.”

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / lhan gyi skyen rgyu gcig mngon sum gang la yod pa de'i dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / lhan gyi skyen rgyu gcig mngon sum gang la yod pa de'i dngos po nyid do //
translated: The nature of that which has conceptualization and non-conceptualization together as its cause is direct perception.🔽How can there be non-existence without realization? By what distinction will there be realization?

original: rtogs pa med par med pa ni khyad par gang gis rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan gyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa med par med pa ni khyad par gang gis rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan gyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, anticipating the opponent's answer, it is said: Why?

original: bdag nyid thams cad dam rnam pa 'ga' yang skyi las khyad par tha dad pa med pa gang yin pa de'i phyir gal te khyad par rnam pa rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa'i rigs pa yin na /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad dam rnam pa 'ga' yang skyi las khyad par tha dad pa med pa gang yin pa de'i phyir gal te khyad par rnam pa rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa'i rigs pa yin na /
translated: Because there is no difference in kind or in any way from the latent impressions, if the distinction is the reason for the conceptual cognition,

original: de'i tshe shes pa kun gcig tu 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa kun gcig tu 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time all cognitions would become one.

original: shes pa thams cad spyi dang khyad par gyi rnam pa can du rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad spyi dang khyad par gyi rnam pa can du rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that all cognitions are understood to have the form of universals and particulars.

original: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni spyi las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni spyi las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different from that means because it is not different from the universal.

original: khyad par dang bcas pa'i spyi sgra'i shes pa la mi snang ba yin no zhe na 'di la brjod pa ni de nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par dang bcas pa'i spyi sgra'i shes pa la mi snang ba yin no zhe na 'di la brjod pa ni de nyid ces bya'o //
translated: If you say that the cognition of a word that has a particular does not appear, the response to that is that very same.

original: khyad par de dang lhan cig rje su zhugs pa ma yin te 'dres pa ma yin pa ni'o //
analyzed: khyad par de dang lhan cig rje su zhugs pa ma yin te 'dres pa ma yin pa ni'o //
translated: It is not engaged with that particular, not mixed with it.

original: phyis ni mngon sum gyi 'dzin pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: phyis ni mngon sum gyi 'dzin pa'i dus na'o //
translated: Later is at the time of the apprehension of direct perception.

original: 'di la pa brjod pa ni 'di nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la pa brjod pa ni 'di nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: The response to that is this very same.

original: sngar 'ba' zhig rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngar 'ba' zhig rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which was previously understood alone.

original: de'i tshe ni 'dres par gyur pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni 'dres par gyur pa'i dus na'o //
translated: At that time is at the time of being mixed.

original: sngar 'ba' zhig rtogs pa de rjes su 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar 'ba' zhig rtogs pa de rjes su 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That which was previously understood alone is not engaged with.

original: de phyis rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de phyis rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not engaged with later?

original: de ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is stated.

original: khyad par dang mi 'dri ba'i rang bzhin gang gi rang gi shes pa sgra las byung ba la spyi snang bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin de nyid kyi spyi de de kho na ste /🔽rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang mi 'dri ba'i rang bzhin gang gi rang gi shes pa sgra las byung ba la spyi snang bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin de nyid kyi spyi de de kho na ste / rang bzhin yin no //
translated: In particular, the nature of that which is not asked about is that which appears as a universal to the cognition that arises from sound. That very universal is its reality.

original: dper na autpala sngon po'i rang bzhin gang gi rang gi shes pa la snang ba de nyid de'i de kho na yin te /
analyzed: dper na autpala sngon po'i rang bzhin gang gi rang gi shes pa la snang ba de nyid de'i de kho na yin te /
translated: For example, the nature of a blue lotus is that which appears to one’s cognition. That very [nature] is its reality.

original: ser po'i rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ser po'i rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is not the nature of yellow.

original: khyad par dang ma 'dres pa 'ba' zhig pa'i rang bzhin de mngon sum gyi dus na med na ni spyi nyid par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyad par dang ma 'dres pa 'ba' zhig pa'i rang bzhin de mngon sum gyi dus na med na ni spyi nyid par 'gyur te /
translated: If that nature which is unique and unmixed does not exist at the time of perception, then it would be a universal.

original: sngon po med na autpala bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po med na autpala bzhin no //
translated: For example, if blue does not exist, then a lotus does not exist.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni /
translated: This is shown by the following:

original: gal te spyi de sgra las byung ba shes pas mthong ba'i rang bzhin deng /
analyzed: gal te spyi de sgra las byung ba shes pas mthong ba'i rang bzhin deng /
translated: If that universal is seen by the cognition that arises from sound,

original: mngon sum @181a * //
analyzed: mngon sum @181a * //
translated: and if it appears to perception,

original: la snang na de'i tshe ji ltar rjes su 'jug par rtogs te /
analyzed: la snang na de'i tshe ji ltar rjes su 'jug par rtogs te /
translated: then how could it be understood to be a subsequent universal?

original: 'ba' zhig snang ba'i phyir ma rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig snang ba'i phyir ma rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: Because it appears alone, it is not understood at all.

original: gal te sngar mthong ba'i rang bzhin 'ba' zhig pa der snang ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te sngar mthong ba'i rang bzhin 'ba' zhig pa der snang ba ma yin gyi /
translated: If it is not the case that the nature of the object previously seen appears,

original: 'on te 'dres pa nyid du snang ba yin pa de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: 'on te 'dres pa nyid du snang ba yin pa de'i tshe yang /
translated: but rather a mixture appears, then how is there a subsequent cognition?

original: ji ltar rjes su 'jug pa rtogs te sngar mthong ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su 'jug pa rtogs te sngar mthong ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Because the nature of the object previously seen has ceased,

original: zhig pas ni /🔽'dren pa gzhan kho na zhig snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhig pas ni / 'dren pa gzhan kho na zhig snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: another object appears.

original: gal te snang ba med na de ni gcig ma yin la du ma yang ma yin te /🔽gcig dang du ma nyid la du ma yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te snang ba med na de ni gcig ma yin la du ma yang ma yin te / gcig dang du ma nyid la du ma yang ma yin te /
translated: If it does not appear, it is neither one nor many.

original: gcig dang du ma nyid ni snang ba la sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma nyid ni snang ba la sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One and many are imagined in relation to appearance.

original: spyi yang mngon sum gyi dus na snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi yang mngon sum gyi dus na snang ba ma yin te /
translated: The universal does not appear at the time of perception,

original: des na ji ltar 'gyur zhes dgong pa'o //
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'gyur zhes dgong pa'o //
translated: so how could it be?

original: des na rgyu mig la sogs pa med pas skra las byung ba'i shes pa la gcig tu snang ba med pa'i khyad par yang du ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na rgyu mig la sogs pa med pas skra las byung ba'i shes pa la gcig tu snang ba med pa'i khyad par yang du ma nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the cause does not exist, the cognition arising from hair appears as one, but the difference is that it is many.

original: 'on te khyad par khong du chud par khas len te /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par khong du chud par khas len te /
translated: But if you accept that the difference is understood,🔽then the universal is not the object of perception.

original: mig la sogs pas khyad par skyes pa ga la yod pa'i rig pa ste rig de las so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pas khyad par skyes pa ga la yod pa'i rig pa ste rig de las so //
translated: How can there be a cognition that is produced by the eye, etc.?

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med pa dag gi rgyu gcig kho na yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med pa dag gi rgyu gcig kho na yin te /
translated: It is the cause of both the conceptual and the non-conceptual.
