original: des na de dang rgyu mtshungs ba na gzhan dag kyang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'os pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: des na de dang rgyu mtshungs ba na gzhan dag kyang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'os pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: Therefore, since it is similar to the cause, the other two are also suitable to be conceptual.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: The conceptual is said to be the conceptualization of the object-universal.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i ngo bo gang dag yin pa'i tshogs pa de dag gi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa nyid kyi ngo bo 'gyur pa'i rtogs ba gang yin pa de gnyis la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i ngo bo gang dag yin pa'i tshogs pa de dag gi stobs kyis bskyed pa'i dbang po'i rnam par shes pa nyid kyi ngo bo 'gyur pa'i rtogs ba gang yin pa de gnyis la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: The conceptualization that is produced by the power of the collection of those which are mutually exclusive natures is the conceptualization that is the transformation of the nature of the sense consciousness itself.

original: rang gi ngo bo ste rang bzhin gyi tshogs pa gang yin pa de las 'byung ba skyes pa de la brten pa la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ste rang bzhin gyi tshogs pa gang yin pa de las 'byung ba skyes pa de la brten pa la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: That which arises from the collection of its own natures, its own essences, is said to be based on that.

original: gcig ni rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig ni rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One is by nature, is the meaning.

original: tshogs pa tha dad pa brjod pa ni sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshogs pa tha dad pa brjod pa ni sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The expression “different collections” means “different connections.”

original: de la ni zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnam par shes pa la'o //🔽rgyu med pa nyid brjod pa ni //
analyzed: de la ni zhes bya ba ni dbang po rnam par shes pa la'o // rgyu med pa nyid brjod pa ni //
translated: “ In that” means “in the sense-perception.”🔽The expression “without a cause” means

original: rgyu med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “without a cause.”

original: phyir rol sgra dang spyi la sogs pa dang 'brel par khas blang nas rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid sgrub pa don du brjod pa ni de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir rol sgra dang spyi la sogs pa dang 'brel par khas blang nas rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid sgrub pa don du brjod pa ni de yang mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression “that also is not true” is the statement of the proof of the absence of conceptual differentiation, having accepted the connection with external sound, universals, etc.

original: gang zhig dang 'brel pa de ni der snang ba kho na yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig dang 'brel pa de ni der snang ba kho na yin na /
translated: If that is connected with something, it appears as that.

original: des na ci ste tshad ma'i yul du @181b 'gyur ba ma yan snyam na /
analyzed: des na ci ste tshad ma'i yul du @181b 'gyur ba ma yan snyam na /
translated: Why then is it not the object of a valid cognition?

original: de lta yin na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes gsungs so //
translated: If that were so, it would be a valid cognition.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //🔽phyogs 'di la yang re zhig sgra dang 'dres pa ni med do zhes brjod pa ni //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o // phyogs 'di la yang re zhig sgra dang 'dres pa ni med do zhes brjod pa ni //
translated: “ But” introduces an objection.

original: de yang mi bden te sgra mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang mi bden te sgra mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In this position, the expression “that also is not true” is the statement that there is no connection with sound, etc.🔽“ It does not apprehend sound” is the statement of the proof of the absence of conceptual differentiation.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni snam bu la sogs pa la sgra yod na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni snam bu la sogs pa la sgra yod na'o //
translated: If it were not so, i.e., if sound were not present in cloth, etc.,

original: the tshom za bar mthong ba nyid du sgrub pa ni don te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: the tshom za bar mthong ba nyid du sgrub pa ni don te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the meaning of the proof would be seen to be doubtful.

original: snam bu'i mtshan nyid kyi don te mngon sum gyis grub kyang rjod par byed pa'i bye brag snam bu la sogs pa'i sgra mi dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snam bu'i mtshan nyid kyi don te mngon sum gyis grub kyang rjod par byed pa'i bye brag snam bu la sogs pa'i sgra mi dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the definition of cloth, etc., is established by perception, but the particular expression, the word cloth, etc., is not recalled.

original: gal te snam bu la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir sgra la sogs pa mngon sum la mi snang mod mtshungs ba'i rnam par nyid ni 'gyur ro snyam pa ni mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid du na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te snam bu la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir sgra la sogs pa mngon sum la mi snang mod mtshungs ba'i rnam par nyid ni 'gyur ro snyam pa ni mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid du na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one thinks that sound, etc., do not appear in perception because they do not exist in cloth, etc., but that they are similar in aspect, then there is the statement, “If they were similar in aspect.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ” The reply is, “No.”

original: gang gi tshe dang po kho nar ba lang mthong ba de'i tshe mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid du nges pa yang med do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dang po kho nar ba lang mthong ba de'i tshe mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid du nges pa yang med do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: When one sees a cow for the first time, there is no ascertainment of similarity in aspect.

original: 'di ba lang ngo snyam pa la sogs pa'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni skyed par byed pa yin no zhes 'brel te ma ltos par ni zhes bya ba ni brda dran pa la zhes 'brel to /
analyzed: 'di ba lang ngo snyam pa la sogs pa'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni skyed par byed pa yin no zhes 'brel te ma ltos par ni zhes bya ba ni brda dran pa la zhes 'brel to /
translated: The phrase “without depending on” is connected to the phrase “the memory of a linguistic symbol.”

original: lhan cig byed pa gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa ni gang gi tshe zhis bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa ni gang gi tshe zhis bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate that there are other cooperating conditions, the root text states, “When . . . ”

original: rgyu des na brda ma bzung ba dang sngon mthong ba dang bral ba la ni 'di ba lang ngo snyam pa'i shes pa mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu des na brda ma bzung ba dang sngon mthong ba dang bral ba la ni 'di ba lang ngo snyam pa'i shes pa mi 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: For that reason, when a linguistic symbol is not apprehended and one is separated from a prior perception, the thought “This is a cow” does not occur.

original: brda 'dzin pa dang sngon mthong ba lhan cig byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda 'dzin pa dang sngon mthong ba lhan cig byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the apprehension of a linguistic symbol and a prior perception do not occur together.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni sngon mthong ba dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni sngon mthong ba dang ngo //
translated: The phrase “that and . . . ” refers to a prior perception.

original: re zhig sngar nyams su myong ba yod pa yin no zhes bsgrubs nas dran pa yang yod do zhes ston pa ni so sor ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig sngar nyams su myong ba yod pa yin no zhes bsgrubs nas dran pa yang yod do zhes ston pa ni so sor ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having established that a prior experience exists, the root text states, “There is also memory” in order to demonstrate that memory exists.

original: sngon gyi sems su myong ba dang dran pa dag srid par brjod nas phyogs kyi chos nyid yod par sgrub pa'i don du /
analyzed: sngon gyi sems su myong ba dang dran pa dag srid par brjod nas phyogs kyi chos nyid yod par sgrub pa'i don du /
translated: Having stated that the experience and memory in the prior cognition are possible, in order to prove the existence of the property of the position,

original: da ltar ba'i rtags mthong ba ston pa ni so sor nges pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i rtags mthong ba ston pa ni so sor nges pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he shows the perception of the present reason, saying, “of the particular.”

original: mthong ba kho nar sad byed du 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: mthong ba kho nar sad byed du 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is only the perception that is the awakener,

original: so sor nges pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, “of the particular.”

original: rgyu des mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i don de mthong ba na'o //
analyzed: rgyu des mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i don de mthong ba na'o //
translated: When the object apprehended by perception is seen by that cause,

original: de dran pa na zhes bya ba ni rjod par byed pa dran pa'i bya pa la'o //
analyzed: de dran pa na zhes bya ba ni rjod par byed pa dran pa'i bya pa la'o //
translated: “when it is remembered” means when the activity of memory is expressed.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: “If, on the other hand” and so on is the opponent’s position.

original: 'ga' zhig mngon sum gyi khyab pa gdon mi za bar rtogs dgos te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig mngon sum gyi khyab pa gdon mi za bar rtogs dgos te /
translated: One must ascertain without doubt the pervasion of some perception,

original: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pa thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pa thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: otherwise, there would be an infinite regress of inference.

original: cha shas zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: cha shas zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is “The parts.”🔽How are the parts themselves?

original: cha shas rnam pa nyid ji ltar ci yin zhe na /🔽cha @182a * //
analyzed: cha shas rnam pa nyid ji ltar ci yin zhe na /🔽cha @182a * //
translated: The parts are the aspects.

original: shas rnams kyi mtshungs pa yang zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shas rnams kyi mtshungs pa yang zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The same” in the phrase “the same as the one in question” means “similar to the one in question.”

original: yan lag cha shas kyi bye brag rnams so //
analyzed: yan lag cha shas kyi bye brag rnams so //
translated: “Parts” are the specific parts.

original: ji ltar zhe na ji srid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na ji srid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “As long as” means “until.”

original: dbang po'i byed pas sbyor ba ni zhes bya ni ba lang zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pas sbyor ba ni zhes bya ni ba lang zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The application of the operation of the sense faculty” is like the word “cow.”

original: de ni mngon sum kho na'o //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum kho na'o //
translated: This is direct perception.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “If that is so” is the reply.

original: phyogs 'di na ni me'o zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis sa phyogs dang me sbyor bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po'i byed pa dang bral na 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs 'di na ni me'o zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis sa phyogs dang me sbyor bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po'i byed pa dang bral na 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: In this case, the application of the operation of the sense faculty is not absent in the form “fire is in this place.”

original: gal te dbang po'i byed pa dang ma bral bar mngon sum gyis sbyor ba yin na rjes su dpag pa ji ltar mngon sum nyid mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i byed pa dang ma bral bar mngon sum gyis sbyor ba yin na rjes su dpag pa ji ltar mngon sum nyid mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the application of the operation of the sense faculty is not absent in direct perception, then how can inference not be direct perception?

original: 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It would be direct perception. This is the meaning.

original: sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang me sbyor ba na'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang me sbyor ba na'o //
translated: “Application” is the application of fire to a place.

original: phyogs tsam la ni zhes bya ba ni phyogs tsam gyi yul la mngon sum skye ba yin la /
analyzed: phyogs tsam la ni zhes bya ba ni phyogs tsam gyi yul la mngon sum skye ba yin la /
translated: “Only a part” is the arising of perception in only a part of the place.

original: phyogs dang me sbyor ba ni rjes su dpag pa las yin no //
analyzed: phyogs dang me sbyor ba ni rjes su dpag pa las yin no //
translated: The application of fire is from inference.

original: yang ji ltar me sbyor ba nyid mngon sum ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar me sbyor ba nyid mngon sum ma yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is the application of fire not perception?

original: me la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: me la zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “In regard to fire.”

original: gang gi phyir me'i yul la dbang po'i shes pa med pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir me'i yul la dbang po'i shes pa med pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no sense perception in the place of fire, therefore,

original: ji ltar sbyor ba mngon sum du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyor ba mngon sum du 'gyur /
translated: how can the application be perception?

original: gal te mngon sum gyis me ma bzung ba de lta na yang de sbyor ba ni mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis me ma bzung ba de lta na yang de sbyor ba ni mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even if fire is not grasped by perception, in that case, the application would be perception.

original: gang gi phyir ma bzung ba ni sbyor ba ma yin no //🔽rjes su dpag pa kho na las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma bzung ba ni sbyor ba ma yin no // rjes su dpag pa kho na las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because that which is not grasped is not an application.

original: mngon sum las ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum las ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Only from inference” is not from perception.

original: mngon sum gyis ma bzung ba zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ma bzung ba zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Not grasped by perception” is fire, etc.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs dang me rtogs pa ni me la sogs pa ste mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs dang me rtogs pa ni me la sogs pa ste mngon sum gyis so //
translated: “That” refers to the place and “fire” refers to the fire, etc. that are directly perceived.🔽“That” refers to the place that is endowed with fire, etc.

original: de dang pas ni phyogs dang ldan par rtogs so zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de dang pas ni phyogs dang ldan par rtogs so zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: This is a contradiction of your own words.

original: gang la rtogs pa tsam nyid pa de la rtogs pa'i khyad par ji ltar yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang la rtogs pa tsam nyid pa de la rtogs pa'i khyad par ji ltar yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How can there be a difference in the cognition of something that is merely a cognition?

original: de ltar na re zhig grub pa'i mtha' pas mngon sum gyis ni sbyor ba mi srid do zhes bstan pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig grub pa'i mtha' pas mngon sum gyis ni sbyor ba mi srid do zhes bstan pa na /
translated: Thus, when the opponent has been taught that it is impossible for perception to establish the syllogism,

original: gzhan dag rjes su dpag pas mi srid do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag rjes su dpag pas mi srid do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: others say that it is impossible for inference to establish it.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Inference” and so on.

original: ri la sogs pa'i phyogs la ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa'i phyogs la ni rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Inference does not apply to a place such as a mountain.

original: gal to phyogs su dpag pas ma rtogs kyang med dang sbyor ro snyam na ma bzung ba ni zhes smras so //
analyzed: gal to phyogs su dpag pas ma rtogs kyang med dang sbyor ro snyam na ma bzung ba ni zhes smras so //
translated: If you think that even though it is not understood by inference, it is connected with nonexistence, then “That which is not apprehended” and so on.

original: 'o na phyogs kyang rjes su dpag pas rtogs so snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na phyogs kyang rjes su dpag pas rtogs so snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the direction is understood by inference,

original: mngon sum don ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum don ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: [we reply:] the object of direct perception.

original: sa phyogs rjes su dpag par bya bar @182b khas len na ni mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa phyogs rjes su dpag par bya bar @182b khas len na ni mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that the direction is to be inferred, then it is not direct perception.

original: 'on te tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag pa tshol ba'i phyir na mngon sum gyi yul gang yin pa de nyid rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no snyam na tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag pa nyams par ni mi 'dod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag pa tshol ba'i phyir na mngon sum gyi yul gang yin pa de nyid rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no snyam na tshad ma'i rnam par gzhag pa nyams par ni mi 'dod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if you think that the object of direct perception is to be inferred because you are seeking the establishment of a valid cognition, then you do not accept that the establishment of a valid cognition is impaired.

original: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' bas brjod pa ni don dam du ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' bas brjod pa ni don dam du ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the Vaibhāṣika school states: ultimately.

original: 'o na phyogs dang me ji ltar snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na phyogs dang me ji ltar snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the direction and the fire are like that,

original: rnam pa de lta'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: [we reply:] that kind of.

original: gnyi ga'i zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rtags nges pa'i'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rtags nges pa'i'o //
translated: Both means of direct perception and inference.

original: mngon sum ni ril sogs pa tsam 'dzin pa yin la rjes su dpag pa ni rtags nyid de rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang shes par byed pa'i rgyu'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ni ril sogs pa tsam 'dzin pa yin la rjes su dpag pa ni rtags nyid de rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang shes par byed pa'i rgyu'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Perception is the apprehension of mere pot, etc., and inference is the very reason, because it is the cause of inference and because it is the occasion of the cause of knowledge.

original: nges pa yang shugs kyis 'thob ste /
analyzed: nges pa yang shugs kyis 'thob ste /
translated: Certainty is also obtained by implication.

original: des mngon sum dang rtags nges pa'i rjes su byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des mngon sum dang rtags nges pa'i rjes su byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That means that it occurs after the ascertainment of perception and reason.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam par brjod pa ni /
translated: Conceptualization is verbalization.

original: 'di ni 'di la'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di la'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is this in this.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: And that is conceptualization.

original: 'di'i rgyu mtshan brjod pa'i don du phyogs snga ma 'god pa brjod pa ni rjes su dpag pa yang ji ltar sbyor bar byed pa'i rang bzhin du skye ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu mtshan brjod pa'i don du phyogs snga ma 'god pa brjod pa ni rjes su dpag pa yang ji ltar sbyor bar byed pa'i rang bzhin du skye ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to state the reason for that, the prior position is stated: How is inference produced as the nature of the one who applies?

original: lan brjod pa ni mngon sum gyis de ltar gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan brjod pa ni mngon sum gyis de ltar gzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is stated: Because it is apprehended as such by perception.

original: chad pa la sogs pa gzhan du gnyi ga'i rang bzhin mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chad pa la sogs pa gzhan du gnyi ga'i rang bzhin mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because in other cases, such as when one is punished, one sees the nature of both.

original: gal te dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dran pa las kyang 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dran pa las kyang 'gyur ba ni /
translated: If the sense consciousness arises from memory,

original: de'i tshe dus gzhan du zhes bya ba don med pa'i dus su yang dbang po'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dus gzhan du zhes bya ba don med pa'i dus su yang dbang po'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the sense consciousness would arise at a time when it is not useful, i.e., at a time when the object is no longer present.

original: 'on te dus gzhan du ni dran pa yang med pa kho na yin pa des na ji ltar dbang po'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: 'on te dus gzhan du ni dran pa yang med pa kho na yin pa des na ji ltar dbang po'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: But if memory does not exist at a time when the object is present, then how can the sense consciousness arise from memory?

original: rgyu med par phyir ro zhe na /🔽'ba' zhig la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu med par phyir ro zhe na / 'ba' zhig la zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it would be without a cause.🔽The root text states, “It is not the case that it arises from memory alone.”

original: de'i tshe srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don med pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don med pa'i dus na'o //
translated: The phrase “because it is possible” means that it is possible at a time when it is not useful.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa dran pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa can gzhan srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs par bsdebs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa dran pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa can gzhan srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs par bsdebs so //
translated: The root text states, “It is possible that another conceptual thought, which is characterized by memory, could be the cause of a sense consciousness.”

original: de kho na de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du'o //
analyzed: de kho na de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du'o //
translated: “That reality” is the cause of nonconceptual cognition.

original: gnyis zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: “Two” refers to conceptual and nonconceptual.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang bral bas so //
translated: “Not otherwise” means not without memory.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni lhan cig pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni lhan cig pa nyid du'o //
translated: “In that way” means simultaneously.

original: mngon sum skyed pa na dran pa dbang po la lhan cig pa nyid du mthong ba kho na'o zhe na dran pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum skyed pa na dran pa dbang po la lhan cig pa nyid du mthong ba kho na'o zhe na dran pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that memory is seen to be simultaneous with the sense faculty when direct perception arises, then the response is “Memory is not . . . ”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan @183a * //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan @183a * //
translated: “If” refers to others.

original: gyi'o ; / mig la sogs pa'i shes pa dran pa nges pa'i rang bzhin du byed pa yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gyi'o ; / mig la sogs pa'i shes pa dran pa nges pa'i rang bzhin du byed pa yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning is that the eye consciousness, etc., are made to have the nature of ascertaining memory.

original: lan ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “That also . . . ”

original: rang bzhin de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i rang bzhin lhag chad med par ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i rang bzhin lhag chad med par ro //
translated: “That nature” refers to the nature apprehended by direct perception, without addition or omission.

original: tha dad med phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon sum snga ma'i yul de'o //
analyzed: tha dad med phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon sum snga ma'i yul de'o //
translated: “Because there is no difference” means that the object of the former perception is that.

original: de dngos med na zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de dngos med na zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: “If it does not exist” means that it is ascertained.

original: 'on te de la zhes bya ba ni nges pa la'o //
analyzed: 'on te de la zhes bya ba ni nges pa la'o //
translated: “But if it does exist” means that it is ascertained.

original: de zhes bya ba des pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba des pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: “That” means the cognition of the object.

original: dbang po'i shes pa las rang bzhin gzhan du'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa las rang bzhin gzhan du'o //
translated: “Other than the nature of the sense cognition” means that it is different from the nature of the sense cognition.

original: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi mthong ba nyid la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi mthong ba nyid la 'jug pa'o //
translated: “In that itself” means that it engages in the seeing of perception.

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'dis 'jug pa'i rnam rtog med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'dis 'jug pa'i rnam rtog med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: “This” means that it becomes free from conceptualization that engages in this aspect.

original: yid kyi mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tha dad do //
analyzed: yid kyi mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tha dad do //
translated: “It would be mental perception” means that it is different.

original: don bya dang sogs pa'i sgras ni rigs la sogs pa dang 'brel ba gnag yin pa dang / de nyid kyi snga ma dang phyi mar te gnyis po der mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don bya dang sogs pa'i sgras ni rigs la sogs pa dang 'brel ba gnag yin pa dang / de nyid kyi snga ma dang phyi mar te gnyis po der mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “The object to be acted upon” and so on means that it is related to the class and so on, and that it is not cognized in those two, the former and latter.

original: gal te don dang 'brel ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog par mi byed mod /
analyzed: gal te don dang 'brel ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog par mi byed mod /
translated: If it does not conceptualize the relation to the object and so on,

original: de lta na yang 'di ni rnam par rtog pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di ni rnam par rtog pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is argued that this is still conceptualization,

original: rnam par rtog par mi byed pa nyid ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog par mi byed pa nyid ni zhes smos so //
translated: [the root text] states, “It is not conceptualization.”

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i rnam pa can mngon sum gyi yul ni de ltar zhes bya ba rnam pa gsal ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i rnam pa can mngon sum gyi yul ni de ltar zhes bya ba rnam pa gsal ba nyid du'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the object of direct perception, which has the aspect of clarity. “ In that way” refers to the clarity of the aspect.

original: de med na zhes bya ba ni dran pa med na'o //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba ni dran pa med na'o //
translated: “ If it does not exist” means if memory does not exist.

original: de'i rang bzhin du shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Knowledge of its nature” refers to

original: de'i rnam pa gsal bar 'dzin pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa gsal bar 'dzin pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: knowledge that apprehends the clarity of its aspect.

original: yod kyang zhes bya ba ni yod pa min yang 'di'o zhes bya bar snang ba des ni khyad par gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yod kyang zhes bya ba ni yod pa min yang 'di'o zhes bya bar snang ba des ni khyad par gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Even if it exists” means even if it does not exist. “ It appears as this” means that it appears as this. “ Because there is no other distinguishing feature” means

original: tha dad par rtogs pa'i khyad par gzhan rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par rtogs pa'i khyad par gzhan rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that there is no apprehension of any other distinguishing feature that is a separate realization.

original: 'jug pa la zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa la zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba ste /
translated: “ In engagement” is an anticipation of an objection.

original: 'di zhes bya bar snang ba zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya bar snang ba zhes 'brel to //
translated: “ It appears as this” is connected to that.

original: lan ni de med kyang zhes bya ba ste zhes bya ba ni snang ba med kyang ngo //
analyzed: lan ni de med kyang zhes bya ba ste zhes bya ba ni snang ba med kyang ngo //
translated: The answer is: “Even though that is not present. ” “ That” means the object of direct perception.

original: 'brel pa grub pa ste sgra dang 'dres pa nges par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa grub pa ste sgra dang 'dres pa nges par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The connection is established, in order to ascertain the meaning mixed with the word.

original: de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi yul gyi don to //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi yul gyi don to //
translated: “ That” means the object of the object of direct perception.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sgra dang 'dres pa nyid du ma grub na /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sgra dang 'dres pa nyid du ma grub na /
translated: “ Thus” means that if the existence of the mixture with the word is not established,

original: de'i tshe mngon gyi yul gyi don de rtogs pa la dran pa mi mkho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe mngon gyi yul gyi don de rtogs pa la dran pa mi mkho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time memory would not be necessary for the understanding of the object of the object of direct perception.

original: 'jug pa la mkho ba yin no zhes smras zin to zhe na dang po'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'jug pa la mkho ba yin no zhes smras zin to zhe na dang po'i zhes smos so //
translated: It has already been said that it is necessary for engagement.

original: 'jug par byed pa yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Even for engagement” means

original: 'jug pa la yang byed pa yod ba ma yin no @183b zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jug pa la yang byed pa yod ba ma yin no @183b zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that there is no activity even for engagement.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pas dgos pa med na de'i tshe 'di ci'i don du 'jug ce na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pas dgos pa med na de'i tshe 'di ci'i don du 'jug ce na /
translated: If there is no purpose for conceptualization, then for what purpose does it engage?

original: 'di ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: “ This” is stated.

original: des zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i blos so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i blos so //
translated: “ By that” means by the cognition of the eye and so on.

original: spyi gzung ba na yang ba lang ji bu zhig ces khyad par 'dzin pa la ltos par rtogs pa ni 'jig rten na mthong ba yin no //🔽de la ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la'o //
analyzed: spyi gzung ba na yang ba lang ji bu zhig ces khyad par 'dzin pa la ltos par rtogs pa ni 'jig rten na mthong ba yin no // de la ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la'o //
translated: This is seen in the world.

original: mdun gnas pa'i gzugs tsam la mi 'jug bar rtogs te shes pa yin no //
analyzed: mdun gnas pa'i gzugs tsam la mi 'jug bar rtogs te shes pa yin no //
translated: The sense consciousnesses do not engage in the mere form that is present in front of them.

original: mdun na gnas pa tsam la mi 'jug pa mthong gi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa tsam la mi 'jug pa mthong gi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They do not engage in the mere form that is present in front of them. They do not engage in anything else.

original: gal te de lta yin mod de lta na yang byed pa gzhan la 'jug go snyam na /🔽gzhan du zhes gsungs so / dran pa'i 'og rol gyi dus su'am dran pa las sngar mngon sum skyes kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin mod de lta na yang byed pa gzhan la 'jug go snyam na / gzhan du zhes gsungs so / dran pa'i 'og rol gyi dus su'am dran pa las sngar mngon sum skyes kyang rung ste /
translated: Even if that is so, it is still possible that the conceptual consciousness engages in something else.🔽The word “else” is stated.

original: rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Even if the conceptual consciousness arises after memory or prior to memory, it is still non-conceptual.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yul zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yul zhes gsungs te /
translated: The word “object” is stated.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med pa'i yul gang yin pa de tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med pa'i yul gang yin pa de tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The object of the conceptual consciousness is different from the object of the non-conceptual consciousness.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa la brten nas skyes pa gang yin pa de kho na mngon sum yin na /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa la brten nas skyes pa gang yin pa de kho na mngon sum yin na /
translated: If what is produced in dependence on the eye, etc. is direct perception,

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe yid la sogs pa mngon sum du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe yid la sogs pa mngon sum du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time, mind, etc. would not be direct perception,

original: mig la sogs pa la mi brten pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la mi brten pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: because they do not depend on the eye, etc.

original: gang zhig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig ces gsungs so //
translated: “What?”

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni goms pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni goms pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “From another” means from repetition, etc.

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or, etc.

original: yid la sogs pa yang mngon sum gyi sgras brjod par bya ba nyid du bye brag tu bshad pa gzhan gyi sgo nas ston to //
analyzed: yid la sogs pa yang mngon sum gyi sgras brjod par bya ba nyid du bye brag tu bshad pa gzhan gyi sgo nas ston to //
translated: Mind, etc. are also taught to be expressed by the word “direct perception” by way of another explanation.

original: ci'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas bsnyad par mi 'thad snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbang po'i sgo nas bsnyad par mi 'thad snyam na /
translated: Why is it not tenable to call them by the name of the sense faculty?

original: dbang po'am zhes smras so //
analyzed: dbang po'am zhes smras so //
translated: “From the sense faculty” is said.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa yang dbang po las skyes pas na /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa yang dbang po las skyes pas na /
translated: Also, the consciousness of two moons, etc. is produced from the sense faculty.

original: mngon sum du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it follows that it is direct perception. This is the meaning.

original: gal te yul gyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa thams cad kyang mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yul gyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa thams cad kyang mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: If you think that the apprehension of the nature of the object is not perception,

original: des na des kyang ji ltar bsnyad snyam na /
analyzed: des na des kyang ji ltar bsnyad snyam na /
translated: then how can it be described?

original: yul gyi zhes smras so //
analyzed: yul gyi zhes smras so //
translated: The response is “the object . . .”

original: gal te dbang po la brten pa nyid mngon sum nyid las 'khrul pa yin mod /
analyzed: gal te dbang po la brten pa nyid mngon sum nyid las 'khrul pa yin mod /
translated: If you think that the mere dependence on the sense faculty is the reason for being perception,

original: de lta na yang des tha snyad byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang des tha snyad byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then even though it is mistaken, it would be a conventional expression.

original: 'khrul ba med pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'khrul ba med pa'i rgyu mtshan zhes smos so //
translated: The response is “the reason for being nonmistaken . . .”

original: 'di la ni 'khrul pa yod pa des na tha snyad du bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di la ni 'khrul pa yod pa des na tha snyad du bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that because it is mistaken, it is not a conventional expression.

original: grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa ni yul gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa ni yul gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the conclusion is “the object . . .”

original: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni de @184a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni de @184a * //
translated: The response to the opponent’s doubt is “that . . .”

original: ni zhes bya ba'o / yul ni rnam par 'jog par nus pa'i rgyu yin na zla ba gcig ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'o / yul ni rnam par 'jog par nus pa'i rgyu yin na zla ba gcig ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The reason is that the object is the cause that is able to posit the object, but the moon does not do that.

original: des na yul du ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: des na yul du ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, how can it be the object?

original: 'grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa ni 'o na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa ni 'o na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the conclusion is “in that case . . .”

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis su shes pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis su shes pa skyed par byed do //
translated: “That” refers to the cognition of two moons.

original: nyams kyang ci ste dbang po ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: nyams kyang ci ste dbang po ma yin snyam na /
translated: If you think that the sense faculty is not a cause because it is impaired,

original: dbang po ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the root text states, “The sense faculty is not impaired.”

original: de ltar re zhig dbang po skyed pa dang yul gyis bskyed pa thams cad mngon sum yin par grub pa'i mtha' mtshungs pas byas na gzhan dag gi phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig dbang po skyed pa dang yul gyis bskyed pa thams cad mngon sum yin par grub pa'i mtha' mtshungs pas byas na gzhan dag gi phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, since the conclusion is the same, that is, that all cognitions produced by the sense faculties and objects are perception, the root text states, “If that is so, then . . .”

original: rgyu nyid du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid du mtshungs pa yin na de kho nar mig la sogs pas tha snyad byed kyi yul gyi ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu nyid du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid du mtshungs pa yin na de kho nar mig la sogs pas tha snyad byed kyi yul gyi ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the sense faculty and the object are similar in being causes of perceptual cognition, then the sense faculty, not the object, is the basis for the term “perception.”

original: rtog pa mngon du zhes smos so //🔽sbyar bar bya ba yang de'i chos zhes bya ba ni /🔽sbyar bar bya ba ni go bar byed pa nyid de'i chos te /
analyzed: rtog pa mngon du zhes smos so // sbyar bar bya ba yang de'i chos zhes bya ba ni / sbyar bar bya ba ni go bar byed pa nyid de'i chos te /
translated: The root text responds, “Conceptual thought is not . . . ”🔽The phrase “the object’s property” in the root text means🔽that the object is the property of the cognition that is the subject.

original: khyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: The object is the property of the cognition that is the subject.

original: go bar byed pa nyid ston pa ni gang dbang po la brten pa de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: go bar byed pa nyid ston pa ni gang dbang po la brten pa de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “That which is based on a sense-faculty” is the definition of “perceptual.”

original: gal te dbang po la brten pa nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te dbang po la brten pa nyid yin zhing /
translated: If something is based on a sense-faculty,

original: mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: it is not a perceptual judgment.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs ba'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs ba'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the cognition of a double moon.

original: des na ji ltar go bar byed pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar go bar byed pa yin snyam na /
translated: How then can it be a perceptual judgment?🔽The author replies: “It is not impaired.”

original: nyams pas zhes gsungs te dbang pos so //
analyzed: nyams pas zhes gsungs te dbang pos so //
translated: “Impaired” means damaged by a sense-faculty.

original: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni yul gyis bskyed kyang mngon sum ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid do /
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni yul gyis bskyed kyang mngon sum ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid do /
translated: “Erroneous” means that although it is produced by an object, it does not have the characteristic of being a perceptual judgment.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa skyed par byed pa ste zla ba gcig pa'o //🔽lan brjod pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa skyed par byed pa ste zla ba gcig pa'o // lan brjod pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “That” refers to the production of the cognition of a double moon, which is the single moon.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni zla ba gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni zla ba gcig pa'o //
translated: The author replies: “That” refers to the single moon.

original: de'i tshe dbang po ma nyams pa'i mngon sum zla ba gcig po ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe dbang po ma nyams pa'i mngon sum zla ba gcig po ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: At that time, how can the single moon be a perceptual judgment that is not impaired by a sense-faculty?

original: dbang po yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the sense-faculty is also like that,

original: dbang po nyid ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: dbang po nyid ni zhes smos so //
translated: the author says, “The sense-faculty itself is not impaired.”

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni nas ma yin pa'i myu gur yang ngo //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni nas ma yin pa'i myu gur yang ngo //
translated: “There” means in the sprout that is not a rice seed.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: “Or” means “if you think.”

original: zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa la ni yul gyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa la ni yul gyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The thought is that the cognition of two moons does not have the nature of an object.🔽“Because it apprehends an object” means that it apprehends the nature of an object that has the nature of a name and a sign.

original: yul 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan ma'i rang bzhin gyi yul gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni slob dpon chos kyi grags pas so //
analyzed: yul 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan ma'i rang bzhin gyi yul gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni slob dpon chos kyi grags pas so //
translated: This is explained by the master Dharmakīrti.

original: ma nges pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni don gyi mthu las skyes pa yang de'i rnam pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni don gyi mthu las skyes pa yang de'i rnam pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because it is not ascertained” means that even if it arises from the power of an object, it does not conform to its aspect.

original: de nyid brjod na zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod na zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa'o //
translated: That is stated: “The cognition of two moons.”

original: rigs @184b pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni don gyi mthu las skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rigs @184b pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni don gyi mthu las skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: “By this reasoning” means by the definition of arising from the power of an object.

original: de ni don gyi mthu las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni don gyi mthu las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not arising from the power of an object.

original: 'o na slob dpon gyi gzhung ji ltar gzhung gzugs snyam na de'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na slob dpon gyi gzhung ji ltar gzhung gzugs snyam na de'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Well then, how is the master's text to be construed? Therefore, he says:🔽Here,

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni don gyi mthu las na /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni don gyi mthu las na /
translated: because of the power of the object,

original: yang dag skye ba yin phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag skye ba yin phyir ro //
translated: there is correct arising.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir ro ji ltar na dbang po la don gyi tha snyad du brjod ce na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir ro ji ltar na dbang po la don gyi tha snyad du brjod ce na /
translated: Here, how is the sense faculty described as the object?

original: bshad pa don du mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa don du mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the manifest adherence to the object.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po la don du mngon par zhen pa yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po la don du mngon par zhen pa yin /
translated: Why is the sense faculty manifestly adhered to as the object?

original: don gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the domain of the object.

original: de skad brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de skad brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is what is said.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa de ni gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges par byed pa'i mig gi stobs kyis kye ba na sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin kho na'i rjes su byed par 'gyur gyi sgra'i rnam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa de ni gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges par byed pa'i mig gi stobs kyis kye ba na sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin kho na'i rjes su byed par 'gyur gyi sgra'i rnam par ni ma yin no //
translated: That sense consciousness is determined to apprehend form by the power of the eye, and it only conforms to the nature of blue, etc., not to the aspect of sound.

original: de lta na yang sgra'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang sgra'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even so, because it is free from the aspect of sound.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don du 'on te gzhan gyi stobs kyis gzugs kyi ngo bo rjes su byed pa'i shes pa ni sgra'i rnam pa can du'ang 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don du 'on te gzhan gyi stobs kyis gzugs kyi ngo bo rjes su byed pa'i shes pa ni sgra'i rnam pa can du'ang 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of the statement “it is not a conceptual cognition” is this: Or else, a cognition that conforms to the nature of form by the power of another would also have the aspect of sound.

original: gzugs nyid sgra'i bdag nyid can bsu nas gang gis de snang ba na de dag kyang snang bar 'gyur ba don la sgra'i yod pa'am de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: gzugs nyid sgra'i bdag nyid can bsu nas gang gis de snang ba na de dag kyang snang bar 'gyur ba don la sgra'i yod pa'am de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no zhes gsungs te //
translated: When form itself, which is not sound, appears as if it were sound, then those [aspects] would also appear. But sound does not exist in the object or have that nature.

original: de ltar bshad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bshad par bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: khyab par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni go bar byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni go bar byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The pervader is the nature of the cognizer.

original: log pa'i phyis zhes bya ba ni yul la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di la go bar byed pa nyid sngog pa yod pa yin te des na'o //
analyzed: log pa'i phyis zhes bya ba ni yul la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'di la go bar byed pa nyid sngog pa yod pa yin te des na'o //
translated: The phrase “after the cessation” means that in the expression “based on the object,” the nature of the cognizer is concealed.

original: de'i bdag nyid brjod pa ni rtog pa sngon du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid brjod pa ni rtog pa sngon du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression “its nature is stated” refers to the phrase “imagination precedes.”

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni sbyar ba nyid do / bden pa de gang yin zhe na skyes bu zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni sbyar ba nyid do / bden pa de gang yin zhe na skyes bu zhes smos so //
translated: What is that truth? It is the person, as stated.

original: skyes bu tshad ma yin pa nyid du nges par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyes bu tshad ma yin pa nyid du nges par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is not possible to ascertain the person as a valid cognition, is the meaning.

original: rtags nyid yin pa la khyab byar brjod pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags nyid yin pa la khyab byar brjod pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: “The sign itself is called the pervaded” means that it is not ultimately.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is stated: “by whom.”

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yul ni snga ma dang / phyi mar gyur pa yin la de yang de kho nar rnam pa de ltar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yul ni snga ma dang / phyi mar gyur pa yin la de yang de kho nar rnam pa de ltar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The object of conceptual cognition is past and future, and that does not exist in reality in that way,

original: dngos po'i tshogs ni skad cig mar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i tshogs ni skad cig mar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the collection of things is momentary.

original: des na yul med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: des na yul med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, because there is no object,

original: yul la ston pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: yul la ston pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: how could there be the convention of “indicating the object”?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum gyi zhes smos so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum gyi zhes smos so //
translated: It is stated: “of conceptual perception.”

original: 'jig rten na de ltar @185a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten na de ltar @185a * //
translated: In the world, it is not like that.

original: na grags pa med do zhe na 'di ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: na grags pa med do zhe na 'di ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it is said, “It is not renowned in the world,” he says, “This is not so.”

original: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The establishment of the treatise is as follows.

original: gal te 'jig rten na de ltar rtogs mod /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten na de ltar rtogs mod /
translated: If it is said, “Although it is not renowned in the world in that way,

original: de lta na yang tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: it is still a valid cognition,”

original: gnod pa med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, “It is not impaired by valid cognition.”

original: mngon du byed pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa nyid shes pa yin pa des na /
analyzed: mngon du byed pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa nyid shes pa yin pa des na /
translated: Since it is a consciousness that engages by way of manifesting,

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa yin snyam na /
translated: how is it an inference?

original: mngon du byed pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “The manifestation of the object.”

original: snga ma dang phyi ma dang sngom pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo shes pa ni mngon du byed pa ma yin no //🔽mngon du byed pa'i de nyid la yul la brten pa zhes shig dbang po la brten pa'i tha snyad kyis ci bya snyam na de na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma dang sngom pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo shes pa ni mngon du byed pa ma yin no // mngon du byed pa'i de nyid la yul la brten pa zhes shig dbang po la brten pa'i tha snyad kyis ci bya snyam na de na zhes gsungs so //
translated: The recognition of the nature of the prior and subsequent moments is not a manifestation.🔽If it is thought, “What is the point of the convention of ‘based on the sense faculty’ in relation to that very manifestation?” he says, “It is said to be based on the sense faculty.”

original: de ltar tha snyad bya ba la ni zhes bya ba ni yul la brten pa zhes bya ba 'dis brjod pa'i bya ba'i yul la'o //
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad bya ba la ni zhes bya ba ni yul la brten pa zhes bya ba 'dis brjod pa'i bya ba'i yul la'o //
translated: “In that way” refers to the object of the action expressed by “based on the object.”

original: yul brten pa zla ba gcig gis shes pa yang mngon sum du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul brten pa zla ba gcig gis shes pa yang mngon sum du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the object-possessor would be directly perceived in one month.

original: de lta na yul la brten no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yul la brten no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is in dependence on the object,

original: mngon sum kho nar brjod la rag mod /
analyzed: mngon sum kho nar brjod la rag mod /
translated: it is certainly directly perceived.

original: nyes pa ci yod snyam na mngon sum la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ci yod snyam na mngon sum la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is thought that there is no fault, it is said that it is also directly perceived.

original: zla ba gnyis pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma nyid ma yin na mngon du lta ga la zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma nyid ma yin na mngon du lta ga la zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: If the consciousness of the second month is not valid cognition, how could it be directly perceived?

original: gal te dbang po la brten pas kyang mngon du byed pa tsam du mtshon gyi mngon sum nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te dbang po la brten pas kyang mngon du byed pa tsam du mtshon gyi mngon sum nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is said that it is merely made manifest by depending on the sense faculty, but it is not directly perceived,

original: des na dbang po la brten pa nyid nye bar mkho ba ji ltar yin snyam na /
analyzed: des na dbang po la brten pa nyid nye bar mkho ba ji ltar yin snyam na /
translated: then how is it necessary to depend on the sense faculty?

original: mngon du byed pa las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa las zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is from the act of making manifest.

original: mngon du byed pa nyid mtshon pa na mnyam pa'i dbang po la brten pa nyid kyis mngon sum nyid du mtshon pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: mngon du byed pa nyid mtshon pa na mnyam pa'i dbang po la brten pa nyid kyis mngon sum nyid du mtshon pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: When making manifest is indicated, it is indicated that it is directly perceived by depending on the sense faculty.

original: 'di skad ces zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos so //
analyzed: 'di skad ces zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos so //
translated: This is what is being said: the master Dignaga.

original: de dang 'gal pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med pa dang 'gal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med pa dang 'gal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it contradicts that, because it contradicts the absence of conceptualization.

original: de kho na ltar zhes bya ba phan tshun spang pa'i rang bzhin nyid du'o //
analyzed: de kho na ltar zhes bya ba phan tshun spang pa'i rang bzhin nyid du'o //
translated: Just as that, as mutually exclusive natures.

original: spyi 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid rang dbang du bsgrub pa'i don du rnam par rtog par byed pa ni tshogs las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid rang dbang du bsgrub pa'i don du rnam par rtog par byed pa ni tshogs las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to prove that the grasping of universals is conceptual, he says, from the collection, etc.

original: de las tha dad par zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de las tha dad par zhes bya bas ni /
translated: Because of the difference from that,

original: spyi'i rten gyis gsal ba las ma gtogs par tshogs pa gzhan snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i rten gyis gsal ba las ma gtogs par tshogs pa gzhan snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the collection, which is different from the individual things, is not perceived apart from the individual things.

original: 'dis ni mi dmigs pa nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi dmigs pa nye bar bkod do //
translated: This is the statement of the non-apprehension.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni gsal pa rnams las tha dad pa'i tshogs pa'i spi zhes bya ba'i ming can no //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni gsal pa rnams las tha dad pa'i tshogs pa'i spi zhes bya ba'i ming can no //
translated: Another, the universal called the collection, which is different from the individual things.

original: gal te snang bar 'dod du zin kyang gzhan te snang ba med de tshogs pa ni @185b ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te snang bar 'dod du zin kyang gzhan te snang ba med de tshogs pa ni @185b ma yin te /
translated: Even if you do maintain that they appear, they are not other, because the collection does not exist.

original: rang dbang du rtogs pa ni tshogs pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang dbang du rtogs pa ni tshogs pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not tenable that the collection is perceived as independent,

original: de ni 'brel ba can gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'brel ba can gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of the related.🔽Even if it were,

original: de yin ba nyid na yang zhes bya ba ni rang dbang du snang ba yang gal te gsal ba la ltos te spyi'i rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe yang de dag nyid ces bya ba spyi'i rten du gyur pa'i gsal ba rnams nyid do //
analyzed: de yin ba nyid na yang zhes bya ba ni rang dbang du snang ba yang gal te gsal ba la ltos te spyi'i rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe yang de dag nyid ces bya ba spyi'i rten du gyur pa'i gsal ba rnams nyid do //
translated: if the appearance as independent were the nature of the universal in dependence on the particulars, then just those particulars that are the basis of the universal would be the universal.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa dgongs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa dgongs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second conception is presented by “If you say that the collection of particulars is the object of conception.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: ” The response to that is “That is also not tenable.

original: rang bzhin gzhan brtags de yang ngo / rtog pa'i yul gyi tshogs pa nyid mngon sum gyi yul yin no zhe na brtags pa'i zhes smos so //🔽gzhan las zhes pa la ltos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan brtags de yang ngo / rtog pa'i yul gyi tshogs pa nyid mngon sum gyi yul yin no zhe na brtags pa'i zhes smos so //🔽gzhan las zhes pa la ltos te /
translated: ” The collection of particulars that is the object of conception is also not the object of direct perception.🔽If you say that the collection of particulars that is the object of conception is the object of direct perception, then the response to that is “That is also not tenable.🔽” The collection of particulars that is the object of conception is also not the object of direct perception.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i nus pa ma skyes pa'i rdul gang yin pa de dag la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i nus pa ma skyes pa'i rdul gang yin pa de dag la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Those particles which are the cause, but have not yet arisen, are called “non-arisen.”

original: phra mo ma yin pa rags pa ni de mthong ba dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: phra mo ma yin pa rags pa ni de mthong ba dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those which are not subtle, but gross, are so called for those who see them.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni des na gzhan yod pa na'o / thams cad kyis bskyed mod //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni des na gzhan yod pa na'o / thams cad kyis bskyed mod //
translated: “ Therefore” means: therefore, when the other exists, all produce it.

original: des cir 'gyur snyam na shes pa de ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des cir 'gyur snyam na shes pa de ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: What is the result of that? He says: “That cognition.”

original: tshun zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o ;🔽/ grub pa'i mtha' ni sgra la sogs pas zhes bya ba'o / rang gi rgyu la sogs pa gang yin pa rang gi rnam pa gtod pa'i nus pa med pa de'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshun zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o ; / grub pa'i mtha' ni sgra la sogs pas zhes bya ba'o / rang gi rgyu la sogs pa gang yin pa rang gi rnam pa gtod pa'i nus pa med pa de'i phyir te /
translated: “ Mutually” means: in doubt.

original: de las mi snang ba yin na'o //
analyzed: de las mi snang ba yin na'o //
translated: The conclusion is: “Sound, etc.” That which is the cause, etc., is without the capacity to project its own aspect, therefore, it is not seen from that.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'khrul pa nyid du bsgrubs pa mngon sum nyid dang 'gal /
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'khrul pa nyid du bsgrubs pa mngon sum nyid dang 'gal /
translated: “ But if” and so on proves the error itself, which is contrary to perception.

original: gzhan rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du yang sgrub pa ni lhag par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du yang sgrub pa ni lhag par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The proof of the other as having imagination is “excessive.”

original: 'on te der zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la'o //
analyzed: 'on te der zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la'o //
translated: Or, “there” refers to perception.

original: rtog pa la ltos te snang ba shar ba med pa gang yin pa de dag la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: rtog pa la ltos te snang ba shar ba med pa gang yin pa de dag la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: Those who are not dependent on conceptualization and for whom appearances arise are said to be like that.

original: de ltar gyur na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni mngon sum la brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ni mngon sum la brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: If that were the case, then what is conceptual would not be described as perception.

original: 'dzin pa yis ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yis ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
translated: “By grasping” refers to perception.

original: de zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin nyid sel te 'dir ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin nyid sel te 'dir ro //
translated: “That” refers to the very nature of conceptualization.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon sum ni mngon du byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽mngon du byed pa nyid lhag par zhen par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum ni mngon du byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro // mngon du byed pa nyid lhag par zhen par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Because perception has the nature of manifestation.🔽If manifestation itself is what is intended, then conceptualization would be perception.

original: mngon du byed pa nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Manifestation itself” is what is said.

original: de nyid du ni zhes bya ba ni lhag par zhe na ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: de nyid du ni zhes bya ba ni lhag par zhe na ba nyid du'o //
translated: “In that very way” means in the intended sense.

original: de las bzlog pa ni mngon du byed pa las bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mngon du byed pa las bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The opposite of that is the opposite of manifestation.

original: bshad ces bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis so //
analyzed: bshad ces bya ba ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis so //
translated: “It is explained” by Master Vasubandhu.

original: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga pa'o //
translated: These are the five collections of consciousness.

original: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //🔽'di ni zhes bya ba ni skye mched @186a * //
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do // 'di ni zhes bya ba ni skye mched @186a * //
translated: The intrinsic identity of substance is the intrinsic identity of the atom.

original: kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the intrinsic identity of the sense-sphere, etc.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir na yul can nyid yin par 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir na yul can nyid yin par 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since this is the reason, there is no contradiction in the fact that it is the subject.

original: da ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhen /
analyzed: da ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhen /
translated: Now, if it is argued that it would be conceptual,

original: gang yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Whatever . . . ”

original: 'o na gang zhig rnam par gcod pa'i don du rtog pa dang bral ba nyid brjod pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par brjod pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhig rnam par gcod pa'i don du rtog pa dang bral ba nyid brjod pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas par brjod pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “What is the meaning of exclusion that is expressed without conceptual thought, which is expressed conceptually? ”

original: gzhan la grags pa la brten nas zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan la grags pa la brten nas zhes smos so //
translated: He says, “Based on what is renowned to others . . . ”

original: gzhan la rigs pa can la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la rigs pa can la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Others are the logicians, etc.

original: rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di sngar mthong ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'i rnam pa can ma 'di ni sngon po snyam pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyis so ;
analyzed: rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di sngar mthong ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'i rnam pa can ma 'di ni sngon po snyam pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyis so ;
translated: This is the conception of memory, which has the form “This is what I saw before.”

original: / de zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i rtog pa nyid do //
analyzed: / de zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pa'i rtog pa nyid do //
translated: “ That” refers to the conception that has that form.

original: bzlog par dka'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: bzlog par dka'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: “ Difficult to stop” means that it is associated with discursive thought.

original: gcig gi tshe kho nar zhes bya ba gcig nyid kyis du ma mthong do snyam na /
analyzed: gcig gi tshe kho nar zhes bya ba gcig nyid kyis du ma mthong do snyam na /
translated: If you think that one consciousness sees many things at one time,

original: shes pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says “consciousness.”

original: de ltar na nge zhig gcig gi tshe rdul phra rab du ma 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa nyid du ba sgrubs nas rnam par mi rtog pa nyid grub pa'i don du rdul phra rab rnams la yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig nyid kho na
analyzed: de ltar na nge zhig gcig gi tshe rdul phra rab du ma 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa nyid du ba sgrubs nas rnam par mi rtog pa nyid grub pa'i don du rdul phra rab rnams la yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig nyid kho na
translated: Thus, since many atoms are not apprehended at one time, he proves that it is discursive thought. In order to prove that it is non-discursive thought, he says that the atoms are one substantial entity that has parts.

original: des dogs so zhes sngon pa ni yang na ni zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: des dogs so zhes sngon pa ni yang na ni zhes bya ba'o /
translated: “ That” refers to the atoms.🔽“

original: 'di la brjod pa ni dngos po du ma shes pa gcig gis mi 'dzin pa ga las yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni dngos po du ma shes pa gcig gis mi 'dzin pa ga las yin zhing /
translated: Why is it that many things are not apprehended by a single cognition?

original: de'i yan lag gcig pa yang ga las yin /
analyzed: de'i yan lag gcig pa yang ga las yin /
translated: And why is it that they are not parts of a single thing?

original: cig car 'dzin pa'i phyir yan lag can nyid yin te /🔽de lta ma yin na yid gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: cig car 'dzin pa'i phyir yan lag can nyid yin te / de lta ma yin na yid gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are apprehended simultaneously, they are a single thing.

original: du ma la byed pa ji ltar ltar 'jug snyam na /
analyzed: du ma la byed pa ji ltar ltar 'jug snyam na /
translated: Otherwise, since the mind is one, how could it engage with many?

original: til zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: til zhes gsungs so //
translated: The answer is: “sesame.”

original: yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni //
translated: “Mental activity” means

original: sngar gyi yid la byed pa tsam nyid la yid nyid du grags kyi /
analyzed: sngar gyi yid la byed pa tsam nyid la yid nyid du grags kyi /
translated: the mind itself, which is known as the mind because it is merely the mental activity that occurred previously.

original: yid gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yid gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other mind.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa du ma bskyed pa nyid bzlog par mi nus te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa du ma bskyed pa nyid bzlog par mi nus te /
translated: Moreover, it is impossible to stop the production of many cognitions,

original: gcig gis kyang shes pa du ma bskyed pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gis kyang shes pa du ma bskyed pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no contradiction in a single thing producing many cognitions.

original: mgyogs pa ni zhes bya ba cig car 'dzin pa snang ba bskyed pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mgyogs pa ni zhes bya ba cig car 'dzin pa snang ba bskyed pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Speed” means that the production of the appearance of simultaneous apprehension is impossible.

original: ci'i phyir med ce na bshad zin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir med ce na bshad zin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why is it impossible? Because it has already been explained.

original: gnod byed gzhan ngag kyang brjod pa ni mgyogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnod byed gzhan ngag kyang brjod pa ni mgyogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other, the one who is harmed, is also called the speaker, because of speed.

original: 'on te gcig la rim pa mthong bas thams cad la rtogs pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni //
analyzed: 'on te gcig la rim pa mthong bas thams cad la rtogs pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni //
translated: But if one infers the existence of all on the basis of the observation of order in one, then the following is said in anticipation of that doubt:

original: de ltar na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If that is so, then . . .”

original: gcig la zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa 'khrul pa'i phyir thams cad @186b 'khrul pa kho nar thal lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ni ha cang thal ba'o //
analyzed: gcig la zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa 'khrul pa'i phyir thams cad @186b 'khrul pa kho nar thal lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ni ha cang thal ba'o //
translated: Because of the error of the cognition of two moons in one, it follows that all are error alone.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni //
translated: “Thus” means

original: mgyogs pa las rim ma yin par gzung bar rlom pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: mgyogs pa las rim ma yin par gzung bar rlom pa nyid du'o //
translated: the assumption of the apprehension of order from speed.

original: 'di la yang zhes skabs su bab pa'i til dang 'bras la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes skabs su bab pa'i til dang 'bras la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “In this case” means in the present case of sesame seed, rice, and so on.

original: de zhes bya ba ni mgyogs pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mgyogs pa'o //
translated: “That” means speed.

original: cig car zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: cig car zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: “Simultaneously” is the doubt.

original: de nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “That itself” is the answer.

original: 'di ni cig car 'dzin par rlom pa yin gyi cig car 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: 'di ni cig car 'dzin par rlom pa yin gyi cig car 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di'o //
translated: This is the assumption of the simultaneous apprehension, but it is not the simultaneous apprehension.

original: de ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa myur bar ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa myur bar ma grub pa'o //
translated: “Not established” means not established as quickly as the apprehension.

original: gal te blo rim pa dang ldan pa dang / skad cig ma yin pa de lta na yang don ni rim gyis snang pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te blo rim pa dang ldan pa dang / skad cig ma yin pa de lta na yang don ni rim gyis snang pa yin te /
translated: Even if the mind is gradual and momentary, the object appears gradually.

original: don ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object is momentary.

original: nges na thams cad la cig car 'dzin par rlom pa ji ltar yin snyam na /
analyzed: nges na thams cad la cig car 'dzin par rlom pa ji ltar yin snyam na /
translated: If that is so, how is it that one imagines that everything is apprehended all at once?

original: gsal bya snang ba ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsal bya snang ba ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “The appearance of the object of illumination.”

original: gal te don skad cig ma yin pa de lta na yang dus ji srid blo gnas pa de srid kho nar de ltar snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te don skad cig ma yin pa de lta na yang dus ji srid blo gnas pa de srid kho nar de ltar snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even if the object is momentary, it appears in that way for as long as the mind remains. That is the meaning.

original: de kho na ltar ni cig car kho na'o //
analyzed: de kho na ltar ni cig car kho na'o //
translated: In reality, it is all at once.

original: gal te shes pa cig car kho na skye na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa cig car kho na skye na /
translated: If consciousness arises all at once,

original: 'o na de'i tshe thams cad du cig cang kho na snang bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe thams cad du cig cang kho na snang bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then at that time everything would appear all at once.

original: gang du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang du zhes gsungs so //
