original: ci'i phyir zhe na snga ma dang phyi ma tha dad par ma bzung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na snga ma dang phyi ma tha dad par ma bzung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Why? Because the former and latter are not apprehended as different.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the response is “How?”

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni dran par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni dran par bya ba la'o //
translated: “In another” refers to what is to be remembered.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni bzung bzhin pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni bzung bzhin pa nyid du'o //
translated: “In a different way” refers to just as it is apprehended.

original: 'on te dran par bya ba ni rang bzhin du mi snang ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dran par bya ba ni rang bzhin du mi snang ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: But if what is to be remembered does not appear as its nature,

original: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then “that” is the response.

original: 'dzin pa yin mod de las cir 'gyur snyam na des na zhes bya ba'o //🔽gzung bar bya ba nyid du snang na rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi bsre ba ma yin mod /
analyzed: 'dzin pa yin mod de las cir 'gyur snyam na des na zhes bya ba'o // gzung bar bya ba nyid du snang na rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi bsre ba ma yin mod /
translated: If it is an apprehender, what is the point? “By that” is the response.🔽If it appears as the nature of the object to be apprehended, it is not mixed because it has the nature of conceptualization.

original: du ma 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni bsre ba yin par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /🔽'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: du ma 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni bsre ba yin par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni / 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if it has the nature of apprehending many, it is mixed.🔽The response to that is “If that is so.”

original: lan ni de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The response is “In that case.”

original: 'on te du ma gcig gis 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te du ma gcig gis 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But if many are apprehended by one, how is that?

original: mig gi zhes bya ba ste sngon po dang ser po thams cad kyi rtogs pa gang yin pa de'i rtogs pa'i phyir te mthong pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: mig gi zhes bya ba ste sngon po dang ser po thams cad kyi rtogs pa gang yin pa de'i rtogs pa'i phyir te mthong pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The cognition of all blue and yellow, etc., is the cognition of that, because of seeing that.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod snyam du dogs na 'dod pa ni ma yin no zhes gong 'og bsnol te blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod snyam du dogs na 'dod pa ni ma yin no zhes gong 'og bsnol te blta bar bya'o //
translated: If you think that this is so, it is not so, as will be shown below.

original: ma 'brel ba ni 'brel ba med pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'brel ba ni 'brel ba med pa ste /
translated: Unrelated means unrelated.

original: de'i rtogs pa gang yin pa nyid dri ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rtogs pa gang yin pa nyid dri ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of that is itself a stain.

original: des nye bar mtshon pa'i skyes bu blun po gsang yin pa de dag gis brtags pas ni chog go zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des nye bar mtshon pa'i skyes bu blun po gsang yin pa de dag gis brtags pas ni chog go zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The fools who imagine that are to be pitied.

original: sngon por rnam par rtog pa'i dus na /
analyzed: sngon por rnam par rtog pa'i dus na /
translated: When there is a conceptual thought of blue,

original: ser po'i rnam par rtog pa yang yod pa yin no zhe na /🔽rnam par rtog pa du ma ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ser po'i rnam par rtog pa yang yod pa yin no zhe na / rnam par rtog pa du ma ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: at that time there is also a conceptual thought of yellow.🔽The answer is: “Many conceptual thoughts do not arise simultaneously in one person.”

original: gzhan dag tshogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsams nas smra ba ni sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag tshogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsams nas smra ba ni sna tshogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Others, thinking of the conceptual thought of a collection, say: “Various” means many.

original: gcig la yang zhes bya ba ni sngon po la yang ngo //
analyzed: gcig la yang zhes bya ba ni sngon po la yang ngo //
translated: “In one” means in blue.

original: des na gang gi tshe re zhig gcig nyid rnam par rtog pa de'i tshe gzhan mthong ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na gang gi tshe re zhig gcig nyid rnam par rtog pa de'i tshe gzhan mthong ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa kho na'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, when one is imagined, at that time, the other is seen without imagination.

original: de ltan yang zhes bya ba ni cig car shes pa mi skye ba bzlog pa na'o //
analyzed: de ltan yang zhes bya ba ni cig car shes pa mi skye ba bzlog pa na'o //
translated: “ Even so” means when the non-arising of cognition is refuted.

original: 'di skad ces bya ba ni 'chad bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba ni 'chad bzhin pa'o //
translated: “ This” refers to what is being explained.

original: ston pa yang ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: ston pa yang ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: “ The teacher” is another.

original: khyed kyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pas so //
analyzed: khyed kyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pas so //
translated: “ You” refers to the Buddhist.

original: rnam dbye zhes bya ba ni blo ni sna tshogs pa'i rnam ba can yin yang gcig kho na yin la phyi rol ni du mar 'gyur ro zhes bya @192b pa de lta bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam dbye zhes bya ba ni blo ni sna tshogs pa'i rnam ba can yin yang gcig kho na yin la phyi rol ni du mar 'gyur ro zhes bya @192b pa de lta bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “ Case endings” refers to the nature of such statements as “although cognition has a variety of aspects, it is only one, but the external is manifold.”

original: slar la blo nyid la lhag par tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni gang la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: slar la blo nyid la lhag par tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni gang la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to show that cognition itself is not different, it is said, “where.”

original: de'i tshe blo gnas pa'i ngo bo la sna tshogs pa nyid du ci ste 'gyur ba 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe blo gnas pa'i ngo bo la sna tshogs pa nyid du ci ste 'gyur ba 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, how could the nature of the mind become various? It would have to become so.

original: 'di skad ces bya ba ni 'chad bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba ni 'chad bzhin pa'o //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: ji lta ji lta zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid dam du ma nyid du'o //
analyzed: ji lta ji lta zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid dam du ma nyid du'o //
translated: In what way? As either one or many.

original: rnam par 'brel zhes bya ba ni stong par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'brel zhes bya ba ni stong par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: It would be related, meaning it would become empty.

original: dngos stobs ni tshad ma'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: dngos stobs ni tshad ma'i stobs kyis so //
translated: The power of fact is the power of valid cognition.

original: ji ltar na gcig gam du ma nyid du mi 'thad snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gcig gam du ma nyid du mi 'thad snyam na /
translated: How is it not tenable as either one or many?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: blo gcig la sna tshogs te du ma re zhig ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: blo gcig la sna tshogs te du ma re zhig ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could there be a variety, many, in a single mind?

original: gcig la du ma nyid mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig la du ma nyid mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It would not be a variety in a single one.

original: 'o na du ma la 'gyur ro snyam na blo de la yang zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'o na du ma la 'gyur ro snyam na blo de la yang zhes smos te /
translated: Now if it is thought that it would be in many, it is said that even in that mind,

original: blo du ma la yang sna tshogs pa nyid mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo du ma la yang sna tshogs pa nyid mi 'gyur ro //
translated: even in many minds, there would not be a variety.

original: blo'i rtul phra rab rnams phan tshun tshul lugs mi shes pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: blo'i rtul phra rab rnams phan tshun tshul lugs mi shes pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because the subtle parts of the mind do not know each other's mode of being.

original: sna tshogs su snang ba med par thal lo //
analyzed: sna tshogs su snang ba med par thal lo //
translated: It follows that the variety of appearances would not exist.

original: 'o na sna tshogs su snang ba 'di ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sna tshogs su snang ba 'di ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “How is this variety of appearances?”

original: gal te don rnams zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te don rnams zhes gsungs so //
translated: [The root text] states, “The objects . . .”

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma dang bral yang snang ba zhes pa ltar ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni gcig dang du ma dang bral yang snang ba zhes pa ltar ro //
translated: Here, “this” refers to the variety of appearances, which is free from being one or many.

original: re zhig sna tshogs su snang ba ni nyams su myong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: re zhig sna tshogs su snang ba ni nyams su myong ba kho na'o //
translated: The variety of appearances is simply experienced.

original: 'di ni sna tshogs par snang ba ma yin no zhes ni brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sna tshogs par snang ba ma yin no zhes ni brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to say, “This is not the variety of appearances.”

original: gal te 'di gcig dang du ma nyid du mi 'thad pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'di gcig dang du ma nyid du mi 'thad pa de'i tshe /
translated: If it is not tenable for the variety of appearances to be either one or many,

original: gcig dang du ma nyid de med mod /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma nyid de med mod /
translated: then it is not the case that one or many do not exist.

original: kho bo cag la ni chad pa ci yang med do //
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni chad pa ci yang med do //
translated: But we do not have the fault of nihilism.

original: sna tshogs su snang ba ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba yang med do zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sna tshogs su snang ba ni gcig dang du ma dang bral ba yang med do zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to say that the variety of appearances is not free from being one or many.

original: de lta ma yin pa gzhan gyis gcig dang du ma med pa nyid du 'grub //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa gzhan gyis gcig dang du ma med pa nyid du 'grub //
translated: If it were possible, then one or many would be established as nonexistent by another method.

original: de'i yan lag can gyi sun 'byin pa 'jug pa ni blo sna tshogs su snang ba'i bdag nyid gcig dang du ma dang bral bar khas blangs kyang nyes pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni gzhung gi tshogs kyi don to /
analyzed: de'i yan lag can gyi sun 'byin pa 'jug pa ni blo sna tshogs su snang ba'i bdag nyid gcig dang du ma dang bral bar khas blangs kyang nyes pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni gzhung gi tshogs kyi don to /
translated: The meaning of the treatise is that there is no fault in accepting that the nature of the various appearances of cognition is free from unity and multiplicity, and that the refutation of the opponent's position is a part of that.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni blo bla yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni blo bla yang ngo //
translated: Here, also refers to the cognition.🔽 If it is the teacher of the various aspects, then even so, a cognition different from that would be singular.

original: gal te rnam pa sna tshogs pa la ston pa yin pa de lta na yang de las tha dad pa'i blo ni gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes dogs na dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'i blo ni dmigs pas gnod pa'i phyir🔽ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa sna tshogs pa la ston pa yin pa de lta na yang de las tha dad pa'i blo ni gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes dogs na dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'i blo ni dmigs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of an entity is that a cognition different from the aspect is not observed.

original: dngos yang zhes bya ba ni blo'i mtshan nyid can na chad pa ci yod ces bya ba ni chad pa 'ga' yang med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos yang zhes bya ba ni blo'i mtshan nyid can na chad pa ci yod ces bya ba ni chad pa 'ga' yang med pa'o //
translated: The word also refers to the cognition. What is the fault of the characteristic of the cognition? There is no fault at all.

original: 'dir ni 'dis ni yan lag can 'gog pa'i skabs @193a * //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'dis ni yan lag can 'gog pa'i skabs @193a * //
translated: Here, this is the context of refuting the whole.

original: yin la yan lag can de sel ba na yang gal te blo yang du ma nyid du khas len na /
analyzed: yin la yan lag can de sel ba na yang gal te blo yang du ma nyid du khas len na /
translated: If you accept that the possessor of parts is a plurality,🔽then the possessor of parts is not a unity.

original: de'i tshe de la chad pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe de la chad pa ci zhig yod /
translated: If you accept that the cognition is manifold, then what is the point of your argument?

original: gdon mi za bar blo gcig gi phyogs khas blangs nas yan lag can bslad bar bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar blo gcig gi phyogs khas blangs nas yan lag can bslad bar bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: You cannot accept the position of a single cognition and then argue that the whole is different from the parts.

original: bstan bcos gnas nas rtsod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstan bcos gnas nas rtsod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point is that this is not a debate held in the context of the treatises.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni rdul phra rab du ma'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni rdul phra rab du ma'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Another refutation is that if the cognition of many subtle particles is not possible, then it follows that the cognition of many is not possible.

original: blo'i rdul phra rab de dag ni du mar rtogs par bzod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blo'i rdul phra rab de dag ni du mar rtogs par bzod pa ma yin te /
translated: The subtle particles of cognition cannot be cognized as many,

original: phan tshun tshul lugs mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun tshul lugs mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not mutually cognize each other.

original: 'o na gzhan 'ga' zhig gis du ma nyid rtogs pa yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: 'o na gzhan 'ga' zhig gis du ma nyid rtogs pa yin no zhe na ;
translated: But if someone else cognizes the many,

original: rtog pa bo gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa bo gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then there is another cognizer.

original: 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni rang rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni rang rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the establishment of the treatise called “The Refutation of Objections.”

original: mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs su snang ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs su snang ba'o //
translated: Because it is seen.

original: 'di la gzhan brjod pa ni 'o na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan brjod pa ni 'o na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the opponent’s response is, “If that is so, then . . .”

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa med pa rig pa mi srid do zhes bya ba yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa med pa rig pa mi srid do zhes bya ba yang ngo //
translated: “ This” refers to the fact that if there is no autocognition, cognition is impossible.

original: gzhan yang rang rig pa yin na ni shes pa gzhan rig pa la dgos pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang rang rig pa yin na ni shes pa gzhan rig pa la dgos pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, if there is autocognition, there is no need for the cognition of other.

original: des na gzhan rig pas rig bya gal te rdul phra rab rnams rang rig pa nyid kyis phan tshun tshul lugs mi shes pa yin /
analyzed: des na gzhan rig pas rig bya gal te rdul phra rab rnams rang rig pa nyid kyis phan tshun tshul lugs mi shes pa yin /
translated: Therefore, if the cognition of other is the object of cognition, if the atoms cognize themselves, they do not cognize each other.

original: rtog pa po gzhan yang med pa yin pa des na /
analyzed: rtog pa po gzhan yang med pa yin pa des na /
translated: And there is no other cognizer.🔽Therefore, by what is the plurality cognized?

original: gang gis mang po nyid rtogs pa yin zhes gzhan dag smra ba ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis mang po nyid rtogs pa yin zhes gzhan dag smra ba ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent’s response is, “If that is so, then . . .”

original: 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: “ Nothing” is the conclusion.

original: de la tha dad pa ni rdul phra rab las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de la tha dad pa ni rdul phra rab las tha dad pa'o //
translated: “ Different” means different from the atoms.

original: 'dis ni du ma'i phyogs la yang du ma nyid du snang ba mi 'thad do zhes bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni du ma'i phyogs la yang du ma nyid du snang ba mi 'thad do zhes bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: This proves that it is not tenable that many things appear as many.

original: gnyi ga'i yang mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i yang mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The conclusion of both is “Therefore, . . .”

original: du ma nyid la sna tshogs pa med pa 'di shin tu gsal te shin tu yang gsal lo //
analyzed: du ma nyid la sna tshogs pa med pa 'di shin tu gsal te shin tu yang gsal lo //
translated: The absence of variety in multiplicity is very clear, very evident.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gcig nyid dam //🔽du ma nyid du dngos po 'thad pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir na //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gcig nyid dam // du ma nyid du dngos po 'thad pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir na //
translated: Because in this way, either as one or🔽as many, entities are not tenable.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: For this reason, the Bhagavān said, “Consciousness is without entityness . . . ”

original: ci ste zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: “If . . . ” introduces a doubt.

original: sgyu ma dang zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: “Like an illusion” is a philosophical tenet.

original: dper na sgyur ma la sogs pa rnams med kyang snang ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: dper na sgyur ma la sogs pa rnams med kyang snang ba de bzhin du //
translated: Just as illusions and so on appear even though they do not exist,

original: bum pa'am snam bu la sogs pa yang yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa'am snam bu la sogs pa yang yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: so too vases, cloth, and so on are.🔽This is the thought.

original: gzhan gyis de dag kyang zhes smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis de dag kyang zhes smras te /
translated: Another says, “Those are also . . . ”

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa dag kyang ngo //
translated: and also illusions, etc.

original: lan ni don bya ba @193b zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni don bya ba @193b zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: “because of the performance of a function.”

original: gal te snang ba nyid la yod par brjod pa ma yin nam des na don byed pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snang ba nyid la yod par brjod pa ma yin nam des na don byed pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: If it is not said that what appears exists, then what is the use of the performance of a function?

original: snang ba bsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba bsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: “because of the imagination of what appears.”

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “And” means

original: don byed pa gzhan la yang ngo //
analyzed: don byed pa gzhan la yang ngo //
translated: and also the performance of a function.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid de don byed pa yin na'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid de don byed pa yin na'o //
translated: “That itself” means that the very nature of what appears is the performance of a function.

original: 'di la lan snang ba thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan snang ba thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The answer to this is: “because of the appearance of everything.”

original: 'ga' zhig ni bzlog pas yin zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni bzlog pas yin zhes bya ba ni //
translated: “Some” means

original: tha dad pa las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa las bzlog pa ste /
translated: the opposite of different.

original: tha mi dad pa nyid don bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa nyid don bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Not different” means the performance of a function.

original: de la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i don bya ba chu 'dzin pa la sogs pas ni tha dad pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: de la bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i don bya ba chu 'dzin pa la sogs pas ni tha dad pa kho na yin la /
translated: In this regard, the performance of a function of a pot, cloth, etc., in holding water, etc., is definitely different.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i don byed pa ni tha dad pa med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i don byed pa ni tha dad pa med pa kho na yin te /
translated: But the performance of a function of pleasure, etc., is definitely not different.

original: de dag gi yod pa ni nyams su myong ba tsam gyi rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi yod pa ni nyams su myong ba tsam gyi rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their existence is posited merely as experience.

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni snang ba tsam nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba'o //🔽gang zhig don byed pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni /🔽tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la'o //🔽tha dad pa'i phyogs la ni don byed pa sgrub pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni snang ba tsam nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba'o // gang zhig don byed pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni / tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la'o // tha dad pa'i phyogs la ni don byed pa sgrub pa nyid du'o //
translated: This is explained in the line “merely as appearance.”🔽“If it is the nature of an object to perform a function” is from the point of view of nondifference.

original: don byed pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni //🔽tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la don byed pa nyid rang gi ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: don byed pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni // tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la don byed pa nyid rang gi ngo bo yin la /
translated: “If it is the nature of an object to perform a function” is from the point of view of difference.🔽“It is the nature of an object to perform a function” is from the point of view of nondifference.

original: tha dad pa'i phyogs la ni don byed pa'i rang gi ngo bos so //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyogs la ni don byed pa'i rang gi ngo bos so //
translated: “It is the nature of an object to perform a function” is from the point of view of difference.

original: gal te 'di don byed pa'i rang bzhin yin mod //
analyzed: gal te 'di don byed pa'i rang bzhin yin mod //
translated: “Granted that it is the nature of an object to perform a function,

original: de lta bu med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: but it does not exist in that way.”

original: don byed pa'i rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don byed pa'i rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “It is the nature of an object to perform a function” is from the point of view of difference.

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'am bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'am bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Some” refers to such things as pots and such things as pleasure.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i rgyu des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i rgyu des na /
translated: “For that reason” is the reason why it is so.

original: don byed pa ni snang ba las tha dad pa yod par smra ba'i sde ba rnams kyis khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: don byed pa ni snang ba las tha dad pa yod par smra ba'i sde ba rnams kyis khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: The Sautrāntikas accept that the object that performs a function is different from the appearance.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig gi don byed pa ni /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig gi don byed pa ni /
translated: If the object that performs a function🔽is not different from the appearance, how can it be nonexistent?🔽The root text states, “The nature of blue, etc.”🔽The nature of blue, etc., is the appearance of blue, etc.

original: snang ba las tha dad pa kho nar yod pa ma yin nam des thams cad med par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: snang ba las tha dad pa kho nar yod pa ma yin nam des thams cad med par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: The statement “The object that performs a function” is made to prove that the object exists as something other than the appearance.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The root text states, “The object that is called ‘this’ is not different from the person, etc.”🔽This is because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no self.🔽The opponent’s response is stated in the line “Because it is tormented by the other.”🔽The response to that is stated in the line “It is not.”🔽The root text states, “The nature of blue, etc.”

original: sngon po la sogs pas snang ba'i rang bzhin las so //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pas snang ba'i rang bzhin las so //
translated: The nature of blue, etc., is the appearance of blue, etc.

original: gzhan yod par sgrub pa'i don du don byed pa ston pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yod par sgrub pa'i don du don byed pa ston pa ni gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The statement “The object that performs a function” is made to prove that the object exists as something other than the appearance.

original: 'di ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'i //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'i //
translated: The object that is called “this” is not different from the person, etc.🔽This is because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no self.🔽The opponent’s response is stated in the line “Because it is tormented by the other.”🔽The response to that is stated in the line “It is not.”🔽The root text states, “The nature of blue, etc.”🔽The nature of blue, etc., is the appearance of blue, etc.🔽The statement “The object that performs a function” is made to prove that the object exists as something other than the appearance.

original: don rnams skyes bu la sogs pa las tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don rnams skyes bu la sogs pa las tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The object that is called “this” is not different from the person, etc.

original: bdag med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no self.

original: gzhan gyis gdung ba zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gdung ba zhes smras so //
translated: The opponent’s response is stated in the line “Because it is tormented by the other.”

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is stated in the line “It is not.”🔽The root text states, “The nature of blue, etc.”🔽The nature of blue, etc., is the appearance of blue, etc.

original: de nyid brjod ba ni goms pa'i zhes bya ba'o //🔽thams cad ces bya ba ni gdung ba @194a * //
analyzed: de nyid brjod ba ni goms pa'i zhes bya ba'o //🔽thams cad ces bya ba ni gdung ba @194a * //
translated: The statement “The object that performs a function” is made to prove that the object exists as something other than the appearance.🔽The object that is called “this” is not different from the person, etc.🔽This is because it would follow, absurd

original: bzlog pa dang tshim pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa dang tshim pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is satisfaction.

original: ldog pa brjod pa ni goms pa med na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa brjod pa ni goms pa med na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the opposite is “If there is no cultivation.

original: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba ni goms pa'i stobs kyis thams cad skye ba na'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba ni goms pa'i stobs kyis thams cad skye ba na'o //
translated: ” If that is so, then everything arises by the power of cultivation.

original: yang ji ltar na ma rig pa'i stobs kyis skyes pa nyid med pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na ma rig pa'i stobs kyis skyes pa nyid med pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But how can that which arises by the power of ignorance be non-existent?

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba ste goms pa'i stobs kyis skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba ste goms pa'i stobs kyis skyes pa'o //
translated: “ That” refers to what arises by the power of cultivation.

original: gal te de ltar rnam par brtags par bya ba de ltar na yang snang ba yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rnam par brtags par bya ba de ltar na yang snang ba yod pa ma yin na /
translated: “ If that is so, then if the appearance does not exist,

original: des na med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can it be non-existent?”

original: snang btsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang btsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Mere appearance”

original: don la ni zhes bya ba ni shes bya ba ni shes pa la yang zhes bya bar bla'o //
analyzed: don la ni zhes bya ba ni shes bya ba ni shes pa la yang zhes bya bar bla'o //
translated: “ In reality” means that the object of knowledge is also like the cognition.

original: de bdag nyid gcig la bkag pa nyid kyi phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad pa ni ci ste rags par snang ba ni zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: de bdag nyid gcig la bkag pa nyid kyi phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad pa ni ci ste rags par snang ba ni zhes bya ba'o /
translated: The explanation of “because of the negation of identity” and so on is “If the appearance of the gross. . . . ”

original: de dag ni mang po kho na yin gyi rags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mang po kho na yin gyi rags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are many, but they are not gross.🔽Why?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rags pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rags pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is called “grossness.”

original: de dag las zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab mang po rnams las so //
analyzed: de dag las zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab mang po rnams las so //
translated: “From them” means from many atoms.

original: rna pa gzhan gyis kyang rags pa nyid sun 'byin pa'i don du brjod pa ni ;
analyzed: rna pa gzhan gyis kyang rags pa nyid sun 'byin pa'i don du brjod pa ni ;
translated: Another person says that grossness is refuted in order to

original: rags pa'i tha snyad ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rags pa'i tha snyad ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression “gross” is used.

original: ling ling po gcig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ling ling po gcig ces bya ba ni /
translated: “One lump” means

original: bar chad dang bral ba'i sems gcig gi phan tshun tha dad par snang ba gang yin pa de la ni'o //
analyzed: bar chad dang bral ba'i sems gcig gi phan tshun tha dad par snang ba gang yin pa de la ni'o //
translated: that which appears as mutually distinct to a single mind free from distraction.

original: 'on te bar mi snang ba des na rags pa nyid snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bar mi snang ba des na rags pa nyid snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that grossness appears because the space in between is not seen,🔽then it is said, “But if that is so . . .

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Well then, what is it?”

original: phan tshun rang bzhin gyis spangs nas gnas pa de dag ni gdon mi za bar bar snang ba dang bcas par khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: phan tshun rang bzhin gyis spangs nas gnas pa de dag ni gdon mi za bar bar snang ba dang bcas par khas blangs dgos so //
translated: Those that exist as mutually exclusive by nature must certainly be accepted as having space in between.

original: de lta na ma yin na phan tshun dben pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na ma yin na phan tshun dben pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, then it would not be tenable that they are mutually exclusive.

original: de'i phyir gal te bar chad dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis snang ba min na ni de lta na rang gi ngo bos snang bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //🔽brgya la phyi'i don du smra ba dag yan lag dang yan lag can yang sun phyung ba na 'di skad brjod par 'gyur zhes yongs su brtag pa'i mtha' bzung nas nye bar 'god pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te bar chad dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis snang ba min na ni de lta na rang gi ngo bos snang bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no // brgya la phyi'i don du smra ba dag yan lag dang yan lag can yang sun phyung ba na 'di skad brjod par 'gyur zhes yongs su brtag pa'i mtha' bzung nas nye bar 'god pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, if it is not manifest due to having an interrupted nature, then it would be manifest by its own nature, but not otherwise.

original: rdul phra rab rnams nges te zhig pa na rdul phra rab de dag ldan pa las so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams nges te zhig pa na rdul phra rab de dag ldan pa las so //
translated: Now, if the proponents of external objects were to object to the refutation of the whole and the parts, the following would be stated by way of a hypothetical concession: “What if the atoms were to disintegrate, and then the parts of the atoms were to combine?”

original: de zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe /
translated: “Then” refers to that time.

original: yan lag can gyi dus na'o //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi dus na'o //
translated: “The whole” refers to the time of the whole.

original: rdul phra rab bam yan lag ni zhes 'di'i sgras brjod pa'am //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bam yan lag ni zhes 'di'i sgras brjod pa'am //
translated: “The atom or the part” is expressed by this word.

original: 'di'i sgras kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'di'i sgras kyang rung ste /
translated: Or this word is also suitable.

original: 'di dag la don ni tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag la don ni tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of these is not different.

original: 'di ltar 'gyur mod ci skyon zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gyur mod ci skyon zhe na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: des na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “then that is so.”

original: ldan pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ldan pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Possession” means

original: rang gi ldan pa dang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshul 'dis snal @194b mal sogs pa'i 'du ba can gyi rgyu nyid du khyas blangs pa gang yin pa de mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ldan pa dang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshul 'dis snal @194b mal sogs pa'i 'du ba can gyi rgyu nyid du khyas blangs pa gang yin pa de mi 'gyur ro //
translated: that which is possessed by itself. By this method, whatever is accepted as the cause of the composite, such as a cloth, is not so.

original: gal te de'i tshe rdul phra rab rnams med mod /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe rdul phra rab rnams med mod /
translated: If at that time the atoms do not exist,

original: de lta yang 'du ba can gyi rgyur 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yang 'du ba can gyi rgyur 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then even so, they would be the cause of the composite.

original: 'brel ba ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'brel ba ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “The connection . . . ”

original: yan lag can gyi 'du ba ni 'brel ba dang bcas pa'i rgyu rnams la 'du ba can gyi rgyu zhes brjod pa yin la 'du ba 'brel ba yang gnyis la gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //🔽yan lag can gyi dus na ni rdul phra rab srid pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yan lag can gyi 'du ba ni 'brel ba dang bcas pa'i rgyu rnams la 'du ba can gyi rgyu zhes brjod pa yin la 'du ba 'brel ba yang gnyis la gnas par 'gyur ba yin no // yan lag can gyi dus na ni rdul phra rab srid pa ma yin la /
translated: The connection of the whole is called the cause of the composite, which is the cause of the connected. The connection of the composite exists in two things.🔽At the time of the whole, the atom does not exist.

original: rdul phra rab kyi dus na yang yan lag can srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi dus na yang yan lag can srid pa ma yin no //
translated: At the time of the atom, the whole does not exist.

original: des na gang gis 'du ba can gyi rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba rgyud dang 'bras bu dag 'du bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na gang gis 'du ba can gyi rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba rgyud dang 'bras bu dag 'du bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, how could there be a connection between the cause and the effect, by which the latter would be the effect of the former?

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni 'di la'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni 'di la'o //
translated: Another objection is stated:

original: bdun pa'i don ni rdul phra rab kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bdun pa'i don ni rdul phra rab kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the seventh line is that the atom is the characteristic of the partless.

original: de zhes bya ba ni yan lag can no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni yan lag can no //
translated: The word “that” refers to the whole.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni logs la sogs pa yang gzung bar thal lo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni logs la sogs pa yang gzung bar thal lo //
translated: The word “etc.” implies that the pot, etc. are also included.

original: pha rol gya cha yang mthong mod ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: pha rol gya cha yang mthong mod ci skyon snyam na /
translated: “But the other side is also seen. What is the problem with that?”

original: pha rol gyi cha gzung na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi cha gzung na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other side is grasped.

original: pha rol yang zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i pha rol gyi sgra'i chas par du chos pa'i bum pa yang mthong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol yang zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i pha rol gyi sgra'i chas par du chos pa'i bum pa yang mthong par 'gyur ro //
translated: “The other side” is the side of the object grasped. The pot, which is the basis of the word, is also seen.

original: de lta yin dang chod pa'i de yang yan lag can yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir //
analyzed: de lta yin dang chod pa'i de yang yan lag can yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir //
translated: If that were so, then the other side of the pot would also be a whole because it is a reason.

original: pha rol gyi cha mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol gyi cha mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The other side would be seen.

original: des na skyes bu thabs don thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na skyes bu thabs don thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, a person would see everything, both the means and the object.

original: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni cha med pa nyid kyis pha rol gyis cha mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni cha med pa nyid kyis pha rol gyis cha mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because it does not exist” means that because of being partless, the other part is not possible.

original: lan ni gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “The other . . .”

original: de skad dris pa la gzhan gyi lan brjod pa ni de zhes bya ba ste gzhan gyis mthong ba ni pha rol gyi cha ni gzhan nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de skad dris pa la gzhan gyi lan brjod pa ni de zhes bya ba ste gzhan gyis mthong ba ni pha rol gyi cha ni gzhan nyid do zhe na /
translated: In response to that question, the response of the other is “that . . .” The other’s seeing is that the other part is different.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni 'o na ci zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni 'o na ci zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here the response is “Well then . . .”

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i cha dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i cha dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the earlier and later parts.

original: de ltar gal te tha dad par khas len na /
analyzed: de ltar gal te tha dad par khas len na /
translated: Thus, if one accepts that they are different,

original: de'i tshe skabs kyis smra ba nyams so zhes brjod pa la /
analyzed: de'i tshe skabs kyis smra ba nyams so zhes brjod pa la /
translated: then at that time the response is that the opportunity for speaking is lost.

original: gzhan dag tha mi dad par khas blangs nas brjod pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag tha mi dad par khas blangs nas brjod pa ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Others, accepting that they are not different, respond with “That . . .”

original: gal te pha rol gyi cha dang tshu rol gyi cha dang gzhan ma yin pa de ltan chu rol gyi 'dzin pa'i dus na /
analyzed: gal te pha rol gyi cha dang tshu rol gyi cha dang gzhan ma yin pa de ltan chu rol gyi 'dzin pa'i dus na /
translated: If the other part and this part are not different, then at the time of apprehending this part,

original: pha rol gyi cha ni mi 'dzin pa nyid de 'on kyang rnam grangs kyis 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pha rol gyi cha ni mi 'dzin pa nyid de 'on kyang rnam grangs kyis 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It does not apprehend the other part, but it does apprehend it by way of implication.

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “No.”

original: gzhan 'di nyid yin no zhes 'di'i mthong ba 'di nyid kyis phyis mthong ba nyid yin no zhes rtogs par yang mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan 'di nyid yin no zhes 'di'i mthong ba 'di nyid kyis phyis mthong ba nyid yin no zhes rtogs par yang mi nus so //
translated: It is not possible to understand that this is the very same seeing that saw it before.

original: gzhan du mthong ba @195a * //
analyzed: gzhan du mthong ba @195a * //
translated: The seeing of the other is shown:

original: nyid ston pa ni mthong ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyid ston pa ni mthong ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The seeing and the touching are not the same.”

original: gang bdag gis mthong ba de nyid la reg go zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang bdag gis mthong ba de nyid la reg go zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible to understand that what was seen by the self is the very same thing that is touched.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: “No” is the denial.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma bltas pa dang reg pa dag gcig pa la tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma bltas pa dang reg pa dag gcig pa la tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible for the former seeing and the later touching to be the same.

original: ci ste yang bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis gcig nyid du rtogs pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis gcig nyid du rtogs pa yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you think that there is a cognition of sameness in the way that has been explained,

original: phan tshun bu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phan tshun bu zhes gsungs so //
translated: the answer is “No.”

original: mthong ba ni reg pa'i rang bzhin yongs su spangs pa dang reg pa ni mthong ba'i rang bzhin yongs su spangs pa dang reg ba ni mthong ba'i rang bzhin spangs nas rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba ni reg pa'i rang bzhin yongs su spangs pa dang reg pa ni mthong ba'i rang bzhin yongs su spangs pa dang reg ba ni mthong ba'i rang bzhin spangs nas rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Seeing is the complete abandonment of the nature of contact, and contact is the complete abandonment of the nature of seeing. Contact is the realization that abandons the nature of seeing.

original: des na 'di gnyis gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'di gnyis gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How can these two be one?

original: dogs pa bsu ba ni mthong ba dang reg pa dag gi phan tshun gyi rnam par dbye ba ni 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: dogs pa bsu ba ni mthong ba dang reg pa dag gi phan tshun gyi rnam par dbye ba ni 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Anticipating an objection, the text says, “The mutual distinction of seeing and contact is apprehended.

original: shes pas byas pa yin no zhe na /🔽lan ni 'o na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pas byas pa yin no zhe na / lan ni 'o na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is produced by consciousness.”

original: thams cad rnam par dbye ba ni 'dzin pas byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad rnam par dbye ba ni 'dzin pas byas pa yin gyi /
translated: The response is, “Well then, the mutual distinction of all is produced by apprehension.

original: gzung bar bya ba ni gcig kho na'o zhes brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba ni gcig kho na'o zhes brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It should be said that the object of apprehension is only one.”

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni de yang zhes bya ba ste yan lag can yang ngo //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa ni de yang zhes bya ba ste yan lag can yang ngo //
translated: The other refutation is stated: “That is also the case for the possessor of parts.”

original: de las tha dad pa'i snang ba las tha dad par ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i snang ba las tha dad par ro //
translated: It is different from the appearance that is different from it.

original: 'o na ci zhig lus she na snang ba tsam zhes bya ba'o //🔽'dir rtsod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig lus she na snang ba tsam zhes bya ba'o // 'dir rtsod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What remains? The mere appearance.

original: ci gal te shes pa'i rig pa ni pa de lta na yang gzhan yang rig par 'gyur te des tha dad par snang ba ci ltar mi 'thad snyam na rang rig pa yin na ni zhes bya ba ste rang rig pa yin par 'gyur na ni gzhan rig🔽pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci gal te shes pa'i rig pa ni pa de lta na yang gzhan yang rig par 'gyur te des tha dad par snang ba ci ltar mi 'thad snyam na rang rig pa yin na ni zhes bya ba ste rang rig pa yin par 'gyur na ni gzhan rig pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the argument is this: If, as you say, consciousness is aware of itself, then it would also be aware of something else. How could it be untenable that it appears as different? If it were reflexive awareness, then it would not be aware of something else.

original: rang dang gzhan rig pa dag ni phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan rig pa dag ni phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba'i phyir ro /
translated: Because being aware of itself and being aware of something else are mutually exclusive.

original: des zhes bya ba ni phan tshun rig pas na'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni phan tshun rig pas na'o //
translated: “By that” means by mutual awareness.

original: rtsod pa de la yang rtsod pa zhes pa ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa de la yang rtsod pa zhes pa ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder of the argument is this:

original: so sor zhes bya ba ni sngon pos ser po ser pos kyang sngon po zhes rtogs par khas blangs pa na'o //
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba ni sngon pos ser po ser pos kyang sngon po zhes rtogs par khas blangs pa na'o //
translated: “Individually” means if it is accepted that blue is cognized by yellow and yellow is cognized by blue.

original: ji ltar rgyud gzhan gyis rig pa na 'di gnyis yin no zhes mi rtogs pa ste de kho na bzhin tshad ma zhes bya ba rtogs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyud gzhan gyis rig pa na 'di gnyis yin no zhes mi rtogs pa ste de kho na bzhin tshad ma zhes bya ba rtogs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as when one cognizes another mind-stream, one does not cognize, “These two are different,” in the same way, one would not cognize, “This is a valid cognition.”

original: 'di ltar sngon pos ni ser po nyid rig gi rang gi bdag nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon pos ni ser po nyid rig gi rang gi bdag nyid ma yin la /
translated: Thus blue cognizes yellow, but it does not cognize itself.

original: ser pos kyang sngon po 'ba' zhig rig gi rang gi rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ser pos kyang sngon po 'ba' zhig rig gi rang gi rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: Yellow cognizes blue, but it does not cognize itself.

original: de lta na yang 'di ni gnyis yin no zhes ji ltar rtogs /🔽rgyud gcig la gnas pa'i shes pas sngon po nyams su myong la gzhan gyis ni ser po rtogs pa ni 'di gnyis @195b yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di ni gnyis yin no zhes ji ltar rtogs / rgyud gcig la gnas pa'i shes pas sngon po nyams su myong la gzhan gyis ni ser po rtogs pa ni 'di gnyis @195b yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even so, how could one cognize, “These two are different”?

original: rtogs par srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par srid pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that resides in one mind-stream experiences blue, and another cognition understands yellow. It is not possible to cognize, “These two are different.”

original: de bzhin du byed pa pos rang rig pa ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du byed pa pos rang rig pa ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: In the same way, if the agent does not cognize itself,

original: bdag gis sngon po 'di yongs su bcad de rig go zhes rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis sngon po 'di yongs su bcad de rig go zhes rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one would not cognize, “I have completely ascertained and cognized this blue.”

original: gang gi tshe sngon pos ser po rig pa de'i tshe 'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngon pos ser po rig pa de'i tshe 'am /
translated: When blue cognizes yellow,

original: ser pos sngon po rig pa de'i tshe ni bdag nyid rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ser pos sngon po rig pa de'i tshe ni bdag nyid rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: When yellow cognizes blue, it does not cognize itself.

original: des na ci ltar gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i shes pas sngo po rtogs pas na /
analyzed: des na ci ltar gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i shes pas sngo po rtogs pas na /
translated: Therefore, just as the cognition that exists in another’s continuum does not cognize blue,

original: 'di bdag gis rigs pa yin no zhes mi 'gyur pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di bdag gis rigs pa yin no zhes mi 'gyur pa de bzhin du /
translated: and it is not the case that “I cognize blue,”

original: rang nyid rtogs pa la yang mi 'gyur te bdag nyid rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid rtogs pa la yang mi 'gyur te bdag nyid rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in the same way, it is not the case that it cognizes itself, because it does not cognize itself.🔽In order to explain the verses, he first explains another point:

original: tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par dgrol ba'i don du re zhig phyogs gzhan bshad pa ni gal te de dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par dgrol ba'i don du re zhig phyogs gzhan bshad pa ni gal te de dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: If you say that it is not tenable that cognition is not cognized,

original: 'on te gang yis rang gi rang bzhin rig ba de nyid kyis gzhan yang yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gang yis rang gi rang bzhin rig ba de nyid kyis gzhan yang yin no //
translated: and that cognition is cognized by itself,🔽then how could it be tenable that it is both?🔽It is not tenable that it is both.

original: des na gnyis so ji ltar thal zhe na rang gi ngo bor rig ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na gnyis so ji ltar thal zhe na rang gi ngo bor rig ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not tenable that it is both, then how could it be tenable that it is neither?🔽It is not tenable that it is neither.🔽If it is not tenable that it is neither, then how could it be tenable that it is both?🔽It is not tenable that it is both.🔽If it is not tenable that it is both, then how could it be tenable that it is one?🔽It is not tenable that it is one.🔽If it is not tenable that it is one, then how could it be tenable that it is many?🔽It is not tenable that it is many.🔽If it is not tenable that it is many, then how could it be tenable that it is not many?🔽It is not tenable that it is not many.🔽If it is not tenable that it is not many, then how could it be tenable that it is not not many?

original: 'ju pa ma yin pa ni bdag gir mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'ju pa ma yin pa ni bdag gir mi byed pa ste /
translated: It is not tenable that it is not not many.🔽If it is not tenable that it is not not many, then how could it be tenable that it is not one?

original: 'di bdag nyid la ston pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di bdag nyid la ston pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not tenable that it is not one.🔽If it is not tenable that it is not one, then how could it be tenable that it is not not one?🔽It is not tenable that it is not not one.🔽If it is not tenable that it is not not one, then how could it be tenable that it is not many?🔽It is not tenable that it is not many.🔽If it is not tenable that it is not many, then how could it be tenable that it is not not many?🔽It is not tenable that it is not not many.

original: rang dang gzhan rig pa dag ni phan tshun nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //🔽da ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don brjod pa ni 'don te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan rig pa dag ni phan tshun nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro // da ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don brjod pa ni 'don te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because self-awareness and other-awareness are mutually exclusive.

original: rang rig pa ma yin na ni byed pa po mi snang ba'i phyogs gang gi phyir rang rig pa dang gzhan rig pa tsam ma yang mi 'thad pa de'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa ma yin na ni byed pa po mi snang ba'i phyogs gang gi phyir rang rig pa dang gzhan rig pa tsam ma yang mi 'thad pa de'i phyir na'o //
translated: Now, the meaning of the verse is stated: “If there is no self-awareness, the position of the non-appearance of the agent is not tenable, because mere self-awareness and other-awareness are not tenable.”

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In that case” means

original: rang rig pa khas len pa na'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa khas len pa na'o //
translated: if self-awareness is accepted.

original: phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir rgyud gzhan rtogs pa bzhin du gnyi ga yang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir rgyud gzhan rtogs pa bzhin du gnyi ga yang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are mutually different, both would not be cognized, like the cognition of another continuum.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs su snang ba med pa nyid du thal ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs su snang ba med pa nyid du thal ba'o //
translated: Here means the consequence of the non-existence of the appearance of diversity.

original: rang rig pa dang gzhan rig pa khas blangs pa la bdag kyang snga ma'i tshul las ma 'das te /
analyzed: rang rig pa dang gzhan rig pa khas blangs pa la bdag kyang snga ma'i tshul las ma 'das te /
translated: Even if self-awareness and other-awareness are accepted, we do not go beyond the previous method.

original: des na bdag de yang rang rig pa'am gzhan rig par 'gyur zhes pa'i brgal zhing brtags pa 'di nyid las 'phar ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bdag de yang rang rig pa'am gzhan rig par 'gyur zhes pa'i brgal zhing brtags pa 'di nyid las 'phar ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this very investigation—that self would be reflexive awareness or the awareness of something other—is not surpassed.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Moreover,

original: rang gi rang bzhin du ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin du ma zad pa'o //
translated: it is not only its own nature.

original: 'di la lan ni rang bzhin de nyid dam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la lan ni rang bzhin de nyid dam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is “That very nature of it.”

original: brjod par 'do pa 'ga' zhig dngos po de'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: brjod par 'do pa 'ga' zhig dngos po de'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: Some objector thinks that it is by the nature of that thing.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa de las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyis @196a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni skabs su bab pa de las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyis @196a * //
translated: Other means a nature that is different from that which is relevant.

original: so ; / dang po sel ba ni rang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: so ; / dang po sel ba ni rang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first exclusion is “itself.”

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni rang gi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni rang gi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That very thing is clarified by “its own nature.”

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la yang brjod pa gzhan gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la yang brjod pa gzhan gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the second conception, “by another” means by another expression.

original: rang la mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de las gzhan pa kho nar 'gyur ba gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis gzhan rig na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang la mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de las gzhan pa kho nar 'gyur ba gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis gzhan rig na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “if it cognizes another” is: if the nature that faces another were to cognize another.

original: des zhes bya ba ni gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: “By that” means by the nature that faces another.

original: gang gi phyir rang la phyogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni rang gi rang bzhin kho na rig cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang la phyogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni rang gi rang bzhin kho na rig cing /
translated: “Because the nature that faces itself cognizes only its own nature” means that the nature that faces itself cognizes only its own nature.

original: gzhan la phyogs pas kyang rang bzhin gzhan kho na rig pa des na'o //
analyzed: gzhan la phyogs pas kyang rang bzhin gzhan kho na rig pa des na'o //
translated: “And the nature that faces another cognizes only another nature” means that the nature that faces another cognizes only another nature.

original: gang la yod pa zhes bya ba'i bdag go //
analyzed: gang la yod pa zhes bya ba'i bdag go //
translated: “That which has it” refers to the self.

original: lan ni 'di ni zhes bya ba ste mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'di ni zhes bya ba ste mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: “The answer” is “this.”

original: de nyid do zhes bya ba ni dgos pa ste bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid do zhes bya ba ni dgos pa ste bdag nyid do //
translated: “That very thing” is the purpose, that is, the self.

original: rang la mngon du phyogs pa dang / gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin dag la 'di ni gnyis yin no zhes rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rang la mngon du phyogs pa dang / gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin dag la 'di ni gnyis yin no zhes rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni zhes 'brel to //
translated: “The nature that faces itself and the nature that faces another” are the two. “The one who has the understanding” is connected to that.

original: rang dang gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin phan tshun 'gal ba de dag ni rang la mngon par phyogs pa'am /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa'i rang bzhin phan tshun 'gal ba de dag ni rang la mngon par phyogs pa'am /
translated: The nature of things that are directed toward oneself and others are mutually exclusive.

original: gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa gcig gis rig par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa gcig gis rig par mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that one that is directed toward oneself or that is directed toward another is cognized.

original: des na mngon du phyogs pa gzhan gnyis khas blang bar bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mngon du phyogs pa gzhan gnyis khas blang bar bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is necessary to accept that there are two others that are directed toward others.

original: de bzhin du de rig pa'i don du gzhan yin pas na thug pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du de rig pa'i don du gzhan yin pas na thug pa med do //
translated: In the same way, since that is another object of cognition, there is an infinite regress.

original: gang gi phyir de gzhan rig pa la nyes pa yod pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de gzhan rig pa la nyes pa yod pa des na /
translated: Since there is a fault in the cognition of another,

original: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gsum zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gsum zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the three natures are said to be reflexive awareness.

original: rang dang gzhan la mngon du ma phyogs pa gnyis bdag dang gsum mo //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la mngon du ma phyogs pa gnyis bdag dang gsum mo //
translated: The two that are not directed toward oneself or others are the third.

original: de'i phyir gsum po de rnams phan tshun la lugs ma shes pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsum po de rnams phan tshun la lugs ma shes pa'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, since those three mutually cognize each other,

original: de gsum rig par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de gsum rig par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: they are the objects of cognition of those three.

original: gal te rnams pa rnams mi bden pa de lta na yang shes pa ni yod pa kho na ma yin rnam des na stong par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te rnams pa rnams mi bden pa de lta na yang shes pa ni yod pa kho na ma yin rnam des na stong par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If the aspects are not real, then consciousness itself must exist, and so how can it be empty?

original: 'di ltar gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gsungs so //
translated: This is how it is explained.

original: de'i yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i yang ngo //
translated: “ Of that” refers to consciousness.

original: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par dang shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par dang shes pa'o //
translated: “ Both” refers to the aspects and consciousness.

original: de ltar ni spang par bya ba'o //🔽gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba ni dgos pa bsu ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni spang par bya ba'o // gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba ni dgos pa bsu ba ste /
translated: “ In that way” means “in that case.”

original: rnam par dang shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dang shes pa'o //
translated: “ Both” refers to the aspects and consciousness.

original: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ It is not” means “it is not the case.”

original: de nyid dran par byed pa ni rang @196b rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid dran par byed pa ni rang @196b rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ It is remembered” means “it is self-knowing.”

original: rang rig pa ni med de sna tshogs pa ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa ni med de sna tshogs pa ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no self-knowing, because it would follow that it is not a variety.

original: gzhan rig pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan rig pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not other-knowing.

original: rang nyid rig pa ni gzhan rig par 'jug pa ma yin no zhes brjod 'dzin zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid rig pa ni gzhan rig par 'jug pa ma yin no zhes brjod 'dzin zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the case that what knows itself engages in knowing other.

original: re zhig dbu ma pa'i phyogs la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: re zhig dbu ma pa'i phyogs la brjod pa ni /
translated: Now, the Madhyamaka position is stated.

original: gzugs dang zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: gzugs dang zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: “Form” and so on.

original: / dngos po rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'i dngos po rnams tha dad gnas pa 'dir zhes 'brel te //
analyzed: / dngos po rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'i dngos po rnams tha dad gnas pa 'dir zhes 'brel te //
translated: The things that are established as things, which are different, are connected here.

original: rnam par shes par byed pas na /
analyzed: rnam par shes par byed pas na /
translated: Because it causes consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is called consciousness.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gang dag yin pa de dag la phyir rol du gyur pa'i rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gang dag yin pa de dag la phyir rol du gyur pa'i rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The consciousness that has the characteristic of causing consciousness, which is external to those aspects of the grasped and the grasper, does not exist.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa mngon par 'dod pa'i stong pa nyid brjod nas phyi'i don du smra bas 'dod pa'i stong pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa mngon par 'dod pa'i stong pa nyid brjod nas phyi'i don du smra bas 'dod pa'i stong pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: Thus, after stating the emptiness that is accepted by the Yogācāra, the emptiness that is accepted by the proponents of external objects is stated:

original: phung po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The aggregates and so on.”

original: de las gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba rnam par shes par smra ba'i bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba rnam par shes par smra ba'i bstan pa'o //
translated: “Other than that” refers to the teachings of the Vijñānavādins.

original: chos thams cad song ba nyid don dam pa kho na bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan par rigs so zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: chos thams cad song ba nyid don dam pa kho na bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan par rigs so zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: The Blessed One has taught that the ultimate is the very going of all phenomena.

original: ji lta ba'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid ji lta ba'i rkyen gyi ltos pa ste ltos par byed pa gang yin pa des na /
analyzed: ji lta ba'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid ji lta ba'i rkyen gyi ltos pa ste ltos par byed pa gang yin pa des na /
translated: The condition of the way things are is the condition of the way things are, the dependence, the dependence itself.

original: de nyid de ni rig pa ma yin //
analyzed: de nyid de ni rig pa ma yin //
translated: That is not knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin de nyid ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin de nyid ma rig pa ste /
translated: That very nature is ignorance.

original: de kho na ma yin pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis ma shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na ma yin pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis ma shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not known by the aspect of being thatness.

original: de la ni zhes bya ba ni tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyi de'o //
analyzed: de la ni zhes bya ba ni tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyi de'o //
translated: In that regard means in the perspective of those who see only the near side.

original: kho na nyid kyi don gang dag gis btang snyoms nyid du mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das des so //
analyzed: kho na nyid kyi don gang dag gis btang snyoms nyid du mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das des so //
translated: The Blessed One who has set aside the meaning of thatness.

original: 'jig rten thugs zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi ngor ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thugs zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi ngor ro //
translated: In the world means from the perspective of the world.

original: 'di nyid shad pa'i don du sngar bshad pa'i rtsod pa nyid dran par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid shad pa'i don du sngar bshad pa'i rtsod pa nyid dran par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to explain this, he recalls the previous debate: If it is said that the world is not refuted, then the world would refute the world.

original: phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gang yin pa des ston pa mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gang yin pa des ston pa mdzad pa'o //
translated: “External” refers to objects such as consciousness that are external to the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: don rjes su brjod pas zhes bya ba'i phyir rol gyi don rjes su brjod pas rtog pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag 'gag pa gang yin pa de brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don rjes su brjod pas zhes bya ba'i phyir rol gyi don rjes su brjod pas rtog pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag 'gag pa gang yin pa de brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The cessation of the self that has the nature of conceptualization, etc., is expressed because it is desired to be expressed.

original: 'jig rten na grub pa'i phyi rol gyi don gang yin pa de la ni bdag med do zhes bya ba'o //🔽rjes su brjod pa yang mi 'thad de phyi'i don de @197a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten na grub pa'i phyi rol gyi don gang yin pa de la ni bdag med do zhes bya ba'o // rjes su brjod pa yang mi 'thad de phyi'i don de @197a * //
translated: The external objects that are established in the world do not have a self.🔽The expression is not tenable because that external object does not exist.

original: snang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes brtsad pa la ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes brtsad pa la ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response to the objection is “No!”

original: gang gis 'jig rten gyi bsam pas kyang bcom ldan 'das rjes su brjod par mdzad par 'jig rten nyid la phyi'i don byed bzhin du der mngon par zhen pa'i blo ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis 'jig rten gyi bsam pas kyang bcom ldan 'das rjes su brjod par mdzad par 'jig rten nyid la phyi'i don byed bzhin du der mngon par zhen pa'i blo ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could the world conceive that the Lord has a mind that is like the world’s, when he is the one who conforms to the world’s mind?

original: 'jig rten gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The world’s mind is the mind of the world.

original: 'dir yang gzhan gyi blos gzhan ston par mdzad pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang gzhan gyi blos gzhan ston par mdzad pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, it is not reasonable that the Lord would teach by means of the mind of another.

original: bcom ldan 'das la yang 'jig rten gyi blo mnga' ba yin no zhes gzhan gyis rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la yang 'jig rten gyi blo mnga' ba yin no zhes gzhan gyis rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, others think that the Lord has a mind that is like the world’s.

original: de nyid rjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid rjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression “just as” refers to that.

original: 'jig rten gyi blo ni bcom ldan 'das la mi mnga' la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi blo ni bcom ldan 'das la mi mnga' la /
translated: The Lord does not have a mind that is like the world’s.

original: gzhan gyi blos ston par mdzad pa yang mi srid do zhes dgongs nas gsungs pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi blos ston par mdzad pa yang mi srid do zhes dgongs nas gsungs pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not possible that he would teach by means of the mind of another.

original: sngon gyi shugs ni sngon gyi 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi shugs ni sngon gyi 'du byed pa'o //
translated: The force of habit is the force of previous conditioning.

original: 'o na 'jig rten thugs ni zhes bya ba 'di'i don cig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'jig rten thugs ni zhes bya ba 'di'i don cig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the expression “the world’s mind”?

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Therefore” means:

original: 'jig rten gzhug pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhug pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “For the sake of introducing the world” means:

original: ji ltar na chos thams cad stong ba la 'jig rten 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba de'i don du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na chos thams cad stong ba la 'jig rten 'jug par 'gyur zhes bya ba de'i don du'o //
translated: “How can the world be introduced to the emptiness of all things?”

original: bcom ldan 'das ni 'jig rten gyi de kho nar du mar ston pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni 'jig rten gyi de kho nar du mar ston pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The Blessed One is the one who teaches the suchness of the world in many ways.

original: 'dri ba nyid brjod pa ni rnam par dbye bar nus pa'i zhes bya ba'o //🔽sna tshogs kyi shes pa la sngon po la sogs par snang ba gang yin pa de ni shes pa'i khyad par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin gyi gzhan la ston pa gzhan dang bcas pa de lta bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dri ba nyid brjod pa ni rnam par dbye bar nus pa'i zhes bya ba'o // sna tshogs kyi shes pa la sngon po la sogs par snang ba gang yin pa de ni shes pa'i khyad par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin gyi gzhan la ston pa gzhan dang bcas pa de lta bu ni ma yin te /
translated: The question itself is stated: “that which is capable of being differentiated.”

original: gzhan ston pa med pa 'ba' zhig par gyur pa ni mthong bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ston pa med pa 'ba' zhig par gyur pa ni mthong bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The appearance of blue, etc. in the cognition of diversity is the nature of the cognition of the particular cognition, but not the other, i.e., the other that is accompanied by the teaching of the other, because that is not capable of being seen as the sole, i.e., the one that is not accompanied by the teaching of the other.

original: sngon po la sogs pa ser po la sogs pa dang lhan cig par dmigs ba gang yin pa de ni 'ba' zhig blta par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ser po la sogs pa dang lhan cig par dmigs ba gang yin pa de ni 'ba' zhig blta par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that what is perceived together with blue, etc., cannot be perceived alone.

original: gal te ser po la sogs pa bkab kyang sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te ser po la sogs pa bkab kyang sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t blue, etc., seen even when it is covered by yellow, etc.?

original: des na ji ltar 'ba' zhig mi mthong ngo zhes brjod snyam na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'ba' zhig mi mthong ngo zhes brjod snyam na /
translated: So how can it be said that it is not seen alone?

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnams la ni rnam dbye ste so sor 'byed pa ni don la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnams la ni rnam dbye ste so sor 'byed pa ni don la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The distinction, i.e., the differentiation, of blue, etc., is applied to the object.

original: shes pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the distinction of consciousness.

original: sna tshogs pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i sngon po la sogs pa gang yin pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i sngon po la sogs pa gang yin pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which is blue, etc., in the nature of a manifold consciousness.

original: gzhan ston med ces bya ba 'di'i don ni //
analyzed: gzhan ston med ces bya ba 'di'i don ni //
translated: The meaning of “without another indicator” is

original: yan 'gar ru zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yan 'gar ru zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “anywhere.”

original: gzhan ston med ces bya ba 'di'i don ni /
analyzed: gzhan ston med ces bya ba 'di'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of “without another indicator” is

original: yan 'gar du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yan 'gar du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “anywhere.”

original: de la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i don @197b du phyogs sna ma 'god pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i don @197b du phyogs sna ma 'god pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the explanation beginning with “In that case” is this: If it is asked, “Is it not the case that the appearance of form, etc. is simultaneous with the appearance of sound?” the answer is, “In that case.”🔽If it is asked, “Is it not the case that the appearance of form, etc. is simultaneous with the appearance of sound?” the answer is, “In that case.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu 'gyur ro zhe na gal te zhes bya ba ni lan no //🔽'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu 'gyur ro zhe na gal te zhes bya ba ni lan no // 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu pa'o //
