translated: If it is asked, “Is it not the case that the appearance of form, etc. is simultaneous with the appearance of sound?” the answer is, “In that case.”🔽If it is asked, “Is it not the case that the appearance of form, etc. is simultaneous with the appearance of sound?” the answer is, “In that case.”

original: sgra'i snang ba dang 'bral ba gzugs la sogs pa'i snang ba ni sgra'i snang ba dang lhan cig nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽lan ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i snang ba dang 'bral ba gzugs la sogs pa'i snang ba ni sgra'i snang ba dang lhan cig nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // lan ni de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is asked, “Is it not the case that the appearance of form, etc. is simultaneous with the appearance of sound?” the answer is, “In that case.”🔽If it is asked, “Is it not the case that the appearance of form, etc. is simultaneous with the appearance of sound?” the answer is, “In that case.”

original: shes pa zhes bya ba ni sgra dang gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa rnams par byed pa ni ma yin no //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na de'i tshe zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni sgra dang gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa rnams par byed pa ni ma yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na de'i tshe zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it is asked, “Is it not the case that the appearance of form, etc. is simultaneous with the appearance of sound?” the answer is, “In that case.”🔽If it is asked, “Is it not the case that the appearance of form, etc. is simultaneous with the appearance of sound?” the answer is, “In that case.”🔽If it is asked, “Is it not the case that the appearance of form, etc. is simultaneous with the appearance of sound?” the answer is, “In that case.”🔽If it is asked, “Is it not the case that the appearance of form, etc. is simultaneous with the appearance of sound?” the answer is, “In that case.”🔽If it is asked, “Is it not the case that the appearance of form, etc. is simultaneous with the appearance of sound?” the answer is, “In that case.”🔽If it is asked, “Is it not the case that the appearance of form, etc. is simultaneous with the appearance of sound?” the answer is, “In that case.”

original: sgrar snang ba med pa'i dus ni sngar gyi snang ba zhes bya ba sgra dang lhan cig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrar snang ba med pa'i dus ni sngar gyi snang ba zhes bya ba sgra dang lhan cig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is asked, “Is it not the case that the appearance of form, etc. is simultaneous with the appearance of sound?” the answer is, “In that case.”🔽If it is asked, “Is it not the case that the appearance of form

original: gal te snang ba snga ma nyid 'ba' zhig par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te snang ba snga ma nyid 'ba' zhig par 'gyur na /
translated: If the former appearance alone were to be,

original: de'i tshe rnam par 'byed pa 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par 'byed pa 'gyur na /
translated: then it would be differentiated.

original: de ltar ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: But it is not like that, is the idea.

original: sgra ni sgra'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: sgra ni sgra'i snang ba'o //
translated: Sound is the appearance of sound.

original: des na thad cad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sgar snang ba ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba las tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na thad cad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sgar snang ba ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba las tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is all-pervasive. The appearance of sound would be different from the appearance of form, etc.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //
translated: That, i.e., sound.

original: gal te sgrar snang ba yin pa de lta na yang 'di ci ji ltar shes pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: gal te sgrar snang ba yin pa de lta na yang 'di ci ji ltar shes pa yin snyam na /
translated: Even if it is the appearance of sound, how is it known?

original: don ni rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don ni rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the object is not cognized, is the idea.

original: sgra dang lhan cig tu snang ba sngar gyi shes pa'i rnam pa nyid las so //
analyzed: sgra dang lhan cig tu snang ba sngar gyi shes pa'i rnam pa nyid las so //
translated: The appearance together with sound is from the aspect of the former cognition.

original: yan 'gar ba ni sgra dang bral ba'o zhes rnam pa de ltar rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: yan 'gar ba ni sgra dang bral ba'o zhes rnam pa de ltar rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The Vaiśeṣika, i.e., the one who is separate from sound, is differentiated in that way.

original: des na ji ltar gnyis su med pa yin te /
analyzed: des na ji ltar gnyis su med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, how can it be non-dual?

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i shes pa'i snang ba dag tha dad par khyed nyid kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i shes pa'i snang ba dag tha dad par khyed nyid kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: because you yourself accept that the appearances of the former and latter consciousnesses are different.

original: khyed kyi lta ba nyid kyis snga ma dang phyi ma'i shes pa dag dbang tha dad par khas blangs nas grub pa'i mtha' 'di kho bo cag gis brjod par zad kyi /
analyzed: khyed kyi lta ba nyid kyis snga ma dang phyi ma'i shes pa dag dbang tha dad par khas blangs nas grub pa'i mtha' 'di kho bo cag gis brjod par zad kyi /
translated: We have stated this tenet of ours, namely, that the former and latter consciousnesses are different faculties, in accordance with your own view.

original: don dam par ni 'chad par 'gyur ba nyid grub pa'i mtha' gyur ro zhes ston pas brjod pa ni yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni 'chad par 'gyur ba nyid grub pa'i mtha' gyur ro zhes ston pas brjod pa ni yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But we do not state that the ultimate is the tenet that is to be established, as will be explained.

original: 'di myong bar gyur ro zhes bya ba ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di myong bar gyur ro zhes bya ba ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be that one says, “I experienced this”?

original: rang rig pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of reflexive awareness.

original: 'gas pa ni thams cad kyi tshe lkog tu gyur pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'gas pa ni thams cad kyi tshe lkog tu gyur pa kho na yin te /
translated: The object is always hidden.

original: de ni rang rig pas dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang rig pas dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not perceived by reflexive awareness.

original: 'on te dran pas lkog du gyur pa shes par byed do zhe na zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'on te dran pas lkog du gyur pa shes par byed do zhe na zhes 'brel to //
translated: But if you say that memory makes the hidden object known, then we reply:

original: nga las dran pa 'di skyes so zhes bya ba 'di ni nyams su myong ba kho nas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nga las dran pa 'di skyes so zhes bya ba 'di ni nyams su myong ba kho nas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: This is understood only through experience.

original: nyams su myong ba'i zhes smos so //🔽gang zhig nyams @198a * //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i zhes smos so // gang zhig nyams @198a * //
translated: The response to this is: “Experience” is mentioned.

original: su myong ba'i dus na yod pa de nyid des rtogs par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: su myong ba'i dus na yod pa de nyid des rtogs par bya ba yin la /
translated: What exists at the time of experience is to be understood through that.

original: dran pa ni nyams su myong ba'i dus na yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: dran pa ni nyams su myong ba'i dus na yod pa ma yin na /
translated: But memory does not exist at the time of experience.

original: des na de des ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: des na de des ji ltar rtogs /
translated: So how can it understand that?

original: gal te bdag ni nyams su myong ba las skyes so zhes dran pa nyid kyis shes so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bdag ni nyams su myong ba las skyes so zhes dran pa nyid kyis shes so zhe na /
translated: If you say that memory itself knows that it arises from experience,

original: dran pa 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the response to this is: “This memory” is mentioned.

original: des ni zhes bya ba ni dran pas so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ni dran pas so //
translated: “By it” refers to memory.

original: gal te nyams su myong ba shes pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te nyams su myong ba shes pa yin na /
translated: If you say that experience is consciousness,

original: de'i tshe bdag nyams su myong ba las skyes so zhes kyang shes par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag nyams su myong ba las skyes so zhes kyang shes par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then at that time it would also know that it arises from experience.

original: nyams su myong ba rig pa med do //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba rig pa med do //
translated: But experience is not aware of itself.

original: de nyams su myong ba nyams su myong ba nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba nyams su myong ba nyid do snyam na /
translated: If you think that experience is experienced,

original: nyams su myong ba yin nyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba yin nyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Experience is experience, Nyang.

original: nyams su myong ba dran pas myong ba yin na yang nyams su myong ba kho nar 'gyur gyi dran pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dran pas myong ba yin na yang nyams su myong ba kho nar 'gyur gyi dran pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If memory is experience because it remembers experience, then it would be only experience, not memory.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar snga ma dang phyi mar 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar snga ma dang phyi mar 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is not tenable that it apprehends the prior and subsequent, therefore, it is not tenable that memory is the experience of the object.

original: de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni /
translated: At that time

original: dus gang gi ser po la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i sngon po dmigs pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: dus gang gi ser po la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i sngon po dmigs pa'i tshe'o //
translated: means at the time when blue that is associated with yellow and so on is observed.

original: gcig gis bya ba ni 'ba' zhig pa'o //
analyzed: gcig gis bya ba ni 'ba' zhig pa'o //
translated: The action of one alone is solitary.🔽What is seen

original: mthong ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni sngon po 'ba' zhig pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni sngon po 'ba' zhig pa'o //
translated: means blue alone.

original: 'di la lan ni 'on ni zhes bya ba'o //🔽rang nyid kyis rnam par dpyod par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'on ni zhes bya ba'o // rang nyid kyis rnam par dpyod par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The response to that is But if you say that.🔽Because you yourself accept analysis.🔽Because it is reflexive awareness,

original: rang rig pa la zhes bya ni de ni rang nyid kho na rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa la zhes bya ni de ni rang nyid kho na rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is reflexive awareness because it is aware of itself alone.

original: gang zhig gzhan gyis kyang dmigs pa de ni phyi rol nyid du tha snyad byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyis kyang dmigs pa de ni phyi rol nyid du tha snyad byed pa yin gyi /
translated: That which is perceived by another is conventionally said to be external.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: But it is not external in reality.

original: sems kyi zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rna pa kho na gcig tu 'gyur gyi don gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems kyi zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rna pa kho na gcig tu 'gyur gyi don gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Of the mind” means that it is of the mind alone, not of an object.🔽But how can it not be of an object?

original: yang ji ltar na don gyi yang mi 'gyur zhe na zhes pa ma gtogs par zhes bya ba zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: yang ji ltar na don gyi yang mi 'gyur zhe na zhes pa ma gtogs par zhes bya ba zhes gsungs so ;
translated: The word “only” is stated to exclude the object.

original: / gzung bar 'dod pa gang yin pa 'dzin par 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnams pa gang la yod pa'i blo sna tshogs pa'i de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: / gzung bar 'dod pa gang yin pa 'dzin par 'dod pa gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i rnams pa gang la yod pa'i blo sna tshogs pa'i de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: That which is held to be the object is held to be the subject, and the various cognitions such as blue, yellow, etc. are of that.

original: de ltar ni re zhig du ma nyid du khas blangs nas rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i rang bzhin gyis gcig nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni re zhig du ma nyid du khas blangs nas rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i rang bzhin gyis gcig nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having accepted that it is manifold, it is explained that it is one by nature, which cannot be divided.

original: de ni du ma nyid med do zhes brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni du ma nyid med do zhes brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “it is not multiple” is the response.

original: sna tshogs ma yin pa la zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i rang bzhin gcig las so //
analyzed: sna tshogs ma yin pa la zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i rang bzhin gcig las so //
translated: The phrase “in the absence of a diversity” means that there is no diversity in a single cognition.

original: phan tshun tha dad par gnas pa gang yi pa de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad par gnas pa gang yi pa de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “because they do not exist” means that the differences among the atoms do not exist.

original: rang rig pa ni gdon mi za bar rang bzhin gcig tu khas blang bar @198b bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rang rig pa ni gdon mi za bar rang bzhin gcig tu khas blang bar @198b bya ba yin te /
translated: It is certain that self-awareness is accepted as a single nature.

original: de lta ma yin na rtul phra rab kyi mthar thug pa'i tha dad pa ni rang rang gi rang bzhin la mi gnas pa'i phyir mi snang ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rtul phra rab kyi mthar thug pa'i tha dad pa ni rang rang gi rang bzhin la mi gnas pa'i phyir mi snang ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the differences among the atoms, which are the ultimate subtle particles, would not exist in their own nature, and they would not appear at all.

original: snang byang yod de des na snang ba med pa'i phyir rig pa rang bzhin gcig nyid do //
analyzed: snang byang yod de des na snang ba med pa'i phyir rig pa rang bzhin gcig nyid do //
translated: Since they do appear, they are a single nature.🔽How can a single nature be established as multiple?🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.

original: rig pa rang bzhin gcig yin pa de las kyang ji ltar du ma nyid rnam par gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rig pa rang bzhin gcig yin pa de las kyang ji ltar du ma nyid rnam par gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.

original: phyir la gcig nyid gnas par 'thad pa yin no //🔽des ni rang gi ngo bo kho nar rig par 'gyur la /
analyzed: phyir la gcig nyid gnas par 'thad pa yin no //🔽des ni rang gi ngo bo kho nar rig par 'gyur la /
translated: It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established as multiple.🔽It is not tenable that a single nature is established

original: rig pa gcig gi rang bzhin yang gcig kho nar 'thad pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa gcig gi rang bzhin yang gcig kho nar 'thad pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The nature of a single awareness is tenable as only one.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni gnyis med pa'i dngos po dang gzhan gnyis ni dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni gnyis med pa'i dngos po dang gzhan gnyis ni dngos po med pa ste /
translated: By things and non-things means by the non-dual thing and the other two non-things.

original: de dag gis so //
analyzed: de dag gis so //
translated: By those.

original: gang gi phyir tha dad pa med pa'i de'i phyir tha dad pa'i dngos po med pa las tha mi dad pa gnyis su med pa'i gzhan du rnam par gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad pa med pa'i de'i phyir tha dad pa'i dngos po med pa las tha mi dad pa gnyis su med pa'i gzhan du rnam par gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no difference, therefore, the non-dual, which is not different from the non-thing, would not abide as different.

original: gal te tha dad pa'i dngos po gnyis dngos po med par ma rtogs pa ni de'i tshe nyid dngos po med par ma rtogs pas ni /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa'i dngos po gnyis dngos po med par ma rtogs pa ni de'i tshe nyid dngos po med par ma rtogs pas ni /
translated: If the difference of the two things is not realized as a non-thing, then at that time, since the non-thing is not realized,

original: gnyis med par mngon par 'dod pa tha dad pa nyid ga las yin te ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gnyis med par mngon par 'dod pa tha dad pa nyid ga las yin te ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: how could there be a difference in the non-dual that is asserted? It could not be!

original: de ltar rtogs par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs par 'gyur mod /
translated: That may be realized,

original: nyes pa ci yod pa snyam na yang de lta na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ci yod pa snyam na yang de lta na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but if you think what is the fault, it is said “even so.”

original: dngos po med pa gnyis dang dngos gnyis med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dngos po med pa gnyis dang dngos gnyis med pa yang ngo //
translated: The non-existence of the two, and the non-existence of the two entities.

original: bum pa gnyis 'di la ka ba med do zhes bya ba'i dgag pa ni med nyid dngos po med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa gnyis 'di la ka ba med do zhes bya ba'i dgag pa ni med nyid dngos po med pa ma yin te /
translated: In the statement, “There is no pillar here, there are two pots,” the negation is not the non-existence of the non-existent.

original: ka ba 'gog pa min zhes bya bar lta'o //
analyzed: ka ba 'gog pa min zhes bya bar lta'o //
translated: It is seen that the pillar is not negated.

original: gal te de las ka ba'i med pa yod na ni de'i tshe ka ba yang 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de las ka ba'i med pa yod na ni de'i tshe ka ba yang 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the non-existence of the pillar existed there, then at that time the pillar would be negated.

original: des na 'di yang tha dad pa med de zhes tha dad pa'i med pa rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: des na 'di yang tha dad pa med de zhes tha dad pa'i med pa rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, this is also not different. One should understand the non-existence of difference.

original: de lta ma yin na de dgag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de dgag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, then its negation would not be tenable.

original: de lta yin dang gnyid med dang gnyis kyi dngos yod pa dang med pa gang yin pa de dag gi tha dad pa'i rig pa ste rog pa 'ongs so //
analyzed: de lta yin dang gnyid med dang gnyis kyi dngos yod pa dang med pa gang yin pa de dag gi tha dad pa'i rig pa ste rog pa 'ongs so //
translated: If it were so, then the cognition of the existence and non-existence of the two entities, which are not different, would come.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na med pa can te god mi za ba 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na med pa can te god mi za ba 'gyur pa'o //
translated: What kind of cognition? The cognition of the non-existent, which is not mistaken.

original: tha dad pa med na mi 'byung ba can zhes bya ba ni dngos po tha dad pa med na mi 'byung ba can no //
analyzed: tha dad pa med na mi 'byung ba can zhes bya ba ni dngos po tha dad pa med na mi 'byung ba can no //
translated: The cognition that does not occur without the difference of entities.

original: 'on te gnyis dgag pa mi byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gnyis dgag pa mi byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the negation of duality is not done,

original: dgag pa ma rtogs na ni zhes gsungs /
analyzed: dgag pa ma rtogs na ni zhes gsungs /
translated: then it is said, “If the negation is not understood.

original: cung zad kyang zhes bya ba ni gnyis sam gnyis med pa'o //🔽gnyis pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni gzhan zhes bya ba'o //🔽gzhan ni 'ga' yang rtogs par byed @199a * //
analyzed: cung zad kyang zhes bya ba ni gnyis sam gnyis med pa'o // gnyis pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni gzhan zhes bya ba'o // gzhan ni 'ga' yang rtogs par byed @199a * //
translated: ” “ Anything at all” means either duality or nonduality.🔽The second alternative is stated in the words “nor is anything else.”

original: pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa ma yin te /
translated: “ Anything else” is not understood.

original: 'on kyang rnam pa 'dis bdag nyid kho na rtogs par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa 'dis bdag nyid kho na rtogs par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But the meaning is that by this method, it is only itself that is understood.

original: de ltar na ni zhes bya ba ni sun byi pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ni zhes bya ba ni sun byi pa'o //
translated: “ In that case” is a criticism.

original: gang gi tshe rmongs pa srid pa de'i tshe gnyis med pa ni ma rmongs pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rmongs pa srid pa de'i tshe gnyis med pa ni ma rmongs pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: When delusion is possible, then nonduality has the nature of nondelusion.

original: rmongs pa dang ma rmongs pa dag kyang phan tshun tha dad pa des na ji ltar gnyis med pa yin /
analyzed: rmongs pa dang ma rmongs pa dag kyang phan tshun tha dad pa des na ji ltar gnyis med pa yin /
translated: Since delusion and nondelusion are mutually exclusive, how can there be nonduality?

original: rmongs pa med na ni bdag nyid rtogs par byed pa nyes bar mkho ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rmongs pa med na ni bdag nyid rtogs par byed pa nyes bar mkho ba ma yin no //
translated: If there is no delusion, it is not necessary to understand oneself.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni rmongs pa gsal bas na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni rmongs pa gsal bas na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the words “because delusion is eliminated. ”

original: gzhan ni ma rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma rmongs pa'o //
translated: The other is non-delusion.

original: nyes pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni snga ma dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni snga ma dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Another fault is stated: “The former and the latter are not seen to be different in any way.”

original: dang po ni rmongs pas bzlog par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: dang po ni rmongs pas bzlog par bya ba yin la /
translated: The former is to be averted through delusion,🔽and the latter is to be engaged through non-delusion.🔽In this way, the former and the latter are not seen to be different in any way.

original: dus phyis ni ma rmongs pas 'jug par bya ba yin no zhes snga ma dang phyi ma dag ni ji ltar rtogs pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par thams cad du ma mthong ngo zhes de ltar gnyis med par smra ba gang gis bsgrubs
analyzed: dus phyis ni ma rmongs pas 'jug par bya ba yin no zhes snga ma dang phyi ma dag ni ji ltar rtogs pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par thams cad du ma mthong ngo zhes de ltar gnyis med par smra ba gang gis bsgrubs
translated: Thus, how could this be established by someone who advocates non-duality?

original: par 'gyur ba de la rtogs pa 'di ma 'brel par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: par 'gyur ba de la rtogs pa 'di ma 'brel par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: This is the connection: “This understanding would be unrelated.”

original: yang ji ltar na tha dad pa mthong ba ma yin snyam na re zhig ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang ji ltar na tha dad pa mthong ba ma yin snyam na re zhig ces bya'o //
translated: Again, how is it that they are not seen to be different?

original: snga ma dang phyi ma ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: “The former and the latter” refer to the past and future.

original: de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung la /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung la /
translated: “At that time” is extracted from the text.

original: da ltar ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is to be supplied as “they would be present.”

original: gnyis pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba bzhin no //
translated: “Like the second” means like the present.

original: gal te 'das pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa'i phyir na /
translated: If it is asked, “How can it be present if it is past?”

original: de snang du zin kyang da ltar ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na de'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de snang du zin kyang da ltar ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na de'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the response is, “Even though it appears, how can it be present?”

original: 'on te mi stang ngo zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum la snang ba ni 'das par mngon par 'dod pa'i yang 'das pa nyid ma yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on te mi stang ngo zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum la snang ba ni 'das par mngon par 'dod pa'i yang 'das pa nyid ma yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is said, “It does not appear,” the response is, “Even though it is accepted as past, it is not past for the direct perception of the yogi.”

original: de'i tshe ji ltar 'dad pa la sogs pa rig pa dmigs pa yin zhes blta'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar 'dad pa la sogs pa rig pa dmigs pa yin zhes blta'o //
translated: At that time, how can desire, etc., be the object of cognition?

original: de ni gnas skabs ni rnal 'byor ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de ni gnas skabs ni rnal 'byor ba'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The state is the state of the yogi.

original: gang du zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med par smra bar ro //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med par smra bar ro //
translated: Where? In the teaching of nonduality.

original: gzhan dag snang ba nyid du ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag snang ba nyid du ston pa ni /
translated: Others teach the appearance itself:

original: rmi lam bden pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam bden pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The dream is true.”

original: skye ba 'di nyid du'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'di nyid du'o //
translated: In this very life.

original: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is not a refutation of that.

original: de ltar tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bdag gis 'das pa rtogs so zhes tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bdag gis 'das pa rtogs so zhes tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is conventionally expressed, because it is conventionally expressed as “I know the past.”

original: dmigs pa'i gnas skabs ni de dag gis kyang de da ltar ba kho nar dmigs pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i gnas skabs ni de dag gis kyang de da ltar ba kho nar dmigs pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that they also have as their object only the present.

original: de sna zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pas na'o //
analyzed: de sna zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pas na'o //
translated: The word “nose” is used because it is not understood.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa las so //
translated: “From that” means from the past and future.

original: khyad par ma rtogs par @199b ni khyad par can rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par ma rtogs par @199b ni khyad par can rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Without understanding the distinction, the distinguished is not understood.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang tha dad pa'i khyad par yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang tha dad pa'i khyad par yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that the past and future are also distinguished.

original: 'on ji ltar 'jig rten 'das pa rtogs pa yod snyam na 'das pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on ji ltar 'jig rten 'das pa rtogs pa yod snyam na 'das pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But how is the past understood? He says, “The past is remembered.”

original: dran pa de nyid kyis 'das pa rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dran pa de nyid kyis 'das pa rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said that the past is understood by that memory itself.

original: dran pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dran pa yang ngo //
translated: Memory is also that.

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pas ma 'ongs pa las da ltar ba tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes blta'o //
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pas ma 'ongs pa las da ltar ba tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes blta'o //
translated: But if it is said that the present is distinguished from the future by inference,

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid ga las skye snyam na brtan pa la sogs pa'am zhes smras so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid ga las skye snyam na brtan pa la sogs pa'am zhes smras so //
translated: from where does inference itself arise? He says, “from stability, etc.”

original: gang gi tshe dngos po brten pa mthong ba de'i tshe 'di ni yun ring por gnas par 'gyur ro zhes shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po brten pa mthong ba de'i tshe 'di ni yun ring por gnas par 'gyur ro zhes shes pa yin no //
translated: When one sees the thing supported, one knows that it will last a long time.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni snying mi mthong bas na 'di ni ring po mi gnas so snyam du shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni snying mi mthong bas na 'di ni ring po mi gnas so snyam du shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The word “etc.” indicates that one knows that it will not last long when one does not see the heart.

original: de bzhin du rgyu mthong ba las kyang 'bras bu rtogs par 'gyur ro dus phyis 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu mthong ba las kyang 'bras bu rtogs par 'gyur ro dus phyis 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ro //
translated: In the same way, one understands the effect from seeing the cause, and one knows that the effect will occur later.

original: de lta na yang tha dad par rtogs par nus pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang tha dad par rtogs par nus pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Even so, one is able to understand the difference. This is the idea.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don de dang 'brel par rig pa'i rgyu las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don de dang 'brel par rig pa'i rgyu las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: One infers the future object from the cause, knowing that it is related to the future object.

original: gal te 'di kyang 'brel pa rtogs pa pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di kyang 'brel pa rtogs pa pa yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is also a case of understanding a relation,

original: rgyud dang brtan pa nyid dag la ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don dang 'brel par mngon sum gyis rig pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyud dang brtan pa nyid dag la ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don dang 'brel par mngon sum gyis rig pa med pa nyid do //
translated: But in the case of a continuum and stability, there is no direct perception of the object that is to be inferred.

original: gal te gnyis med par smra ba'i ltar 'brel pa zhes bya ba med pa ma yin nam de ni gnyis la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te gnyis med par smra ba'i ltar 'brel pa zhes bya ba med pa ma yin nam de ni gnyis la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If, as the nondualists say, there is no such thing as a relation, because it is based on duality,

original: des na 'brel pa yod na rjes su dpog go zhes ci'i phyir brjod snyam na /
analyzed: des na 'brel pa yod na rjes su dpog go zhes ci'i phyir brjod snyam na /
translated: then why do you say that there is inference when there is a relation?

original: 'brel pa las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'brel pa las zhes gsungs so //
translated: The answer is “from a relation.”

original: 'dis ni gzhan gyi khas blangs ka kho nas de skad brjod pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan gyi khas blangs ka kho nas de skad brjod pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no ;
translated: This shows that the opponent is merely repeating what others have said.

original: / ha cang thal ba nyid ni bum pa las kyang snam bu dpog par thal lo //
analyzed: / ha cang thal ba nyid ni bum pa las kyang snam bu dpog par thal lo //
translated: The absurd consequence is that it would follow, absurdly, that a cloth could be inferred from a pot.

original: 'di la gzhan gyi brjod pa ni ma mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyi brjod pa ni ma mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent’s response to this is “not seeing.”

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'i pa'i'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'i pa'i'o //
translated: The word “if” is from the opponent’s point of view.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas mthong ba nyid du brjod na ni de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa de nyid sems pas na ji ltar na rjes su dpag pa des mthong ba zhes brjod /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas mthong ba nyid du brjod na ni de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa de nyid sems pas na ji ltar na rjes su dpag pa des mthong ba zhes brjod /
translated: If you say that it is seeing by means of inference, then at that time, since it is the very inference that thinks, how could it be said that it is seeing by means of that inference?

original: 'o na mngon sum gyis mthong ba nyid yin no zhe na rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum gyis mthong ba nyid yin no zhe na rjes su 'jug go //
translated: Well then, is it seeing by means of direct perception?

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to inference.

original: gal te rjes su dpag la lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin mod /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag la lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin mod /
translated: If you say that inference has an imperceptible object,

original: de lta na yang mngon sum gyis ji ltar mi rtogs she na /
analyzed: de lta na yang mngon sum gyis ji ltar mi rtogs she na /
translated: then how is it not understood by direct perception?

original: lkog tu gyur pa la yang zhes @200a * //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa la yang zhes @200a * //
translated: “Even with respect to imperceptible objects” is stated.

original: gsungs so // lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can gyi rang bzhin gyis ji ltar rjes su dpag pa bdag gir byed de ji ltar mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: gsungs so // lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can gyi rang bzhin gyis ji ltar rjes su dpag pa bdag gir byed de ji ltar mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin /
translated: How could inference be characterized as understanding by direct perception, since it has an imperceptible object by nature?

original: yang ji ltar na lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can rjes su dpag pa'i mngon sum gyis mi rtogs she na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can rjes su dpag pa'i mngon sum gyis mi rtogs she na /
translated: How is it that direct perception does not understand inference, which has an imperceptible object?

original: lkog tu gyur pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Imperceptible” is stated.

original: yul du mi byed pas ni zhes bya ba mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: yul du mi byed pas ni zhes bya ba mngon sum gyis so //
translated: “Not making it an object” means not making it an object of direct perception.

original: yul de'i khyad par can ni zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul gyi khyad par can no //
analyzed: yul de'i khyad par can ni zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul gyi khyad par can no //
translated: “The object’s special quality” means the special quality of the object that is hidden.

original: de'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa mngon sum gyis mi rtogs mod /
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa mngon sum gyis mi rtogs mod /
translated: “The inference that has that as its object is not understood by direct perception.”

original: rjes su dpag pa tsam ni rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa tsam ni rtogs so zhe na /
translated: “But the mere inference is understood.”

original: 'on te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te zhes gsungs so //
translated: “But if” is stated.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa mi rtogs na 'on ci zhig nyams su myong snyam na rang gi ngo bo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa mi rtogs na 'on ci zhig nyams su myong snyam na rang gi ngo bo zhes gsungs so //
translated: “If the inference is not understood, then what is experienced?” “Its own nature” is stated.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bor rig par ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bor rig par ro //
translated: “In that way” means in its own nature.

original: 'o na te de kho na ltar tha snyad byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa mthong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: 'o na te de kho na ltar tha snyad byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa mthong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi'o //
translated: “But if it is conventionally designated in that way,” this is the characteristic of seeing the inference.

original: de lta yin no zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha'o//
analyzed: de lta yin no zhes bya ba grub pa'i mtha'o//
translated: “That is the case” is the conclusion.

original: dogs pa ni tha dad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni tha dad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The doubt” is stated as “different.”

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The seeing” is the conclusion.

original: tha dad par zhen par ni mi rung ba yin pa'i phyir na /🔽spang ba kho nar rigs so zhes bya bar dgos pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad par zhen par ni mi rung ba yin pa'i phyir na / spang ba kho nar rigs so zhes bya bar dgos pa'o //
translated: The view that they are not different is to be abandoned by meditation.🔽This is the meaning.🔽The view that they are different is to be abandoned by seeing.🔽The view that they are not different is to be abandoned by meditation.🔽This is the meaning.🔽The view that they are different is to be abandoned by seeing.🔽The view that they are not different is to be abandoned by meditation.🔽This is the meaning.🔽The view that they are different is to be abandoned by seeing.🔽The view that they are not different is to be abandoned by meditation.🔽This is the meaning.🔽The view that they are different is to be abandoned by seeing.

original: de lta'o zhes bya ba ni tha dad par mngon par zhen pa mthong ba ni /
analyzed: de lta'o zhes bya ba ni tha dad par mngon par zhen pa mthong ba ni /
translated: The view that they are not different is to be abandoned by meditation.

original: spang pa'i mu nus so zhes bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: spang pa'i mu nus so zhes bya ba 'di'o //
translated: This is the meaning.🔽The view that they are different is to be abandoned by seeing.🔽The view that they are not different is to be abandoned by meditation.🔽This is the meaning.

original: tha dad pa yod do zhes bya ba de lta bu'o //🔽mtshan nyid can gyis nyes bar bsten pa gang yin pa de brtson pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yod do zhes bya ba de lta bu'o // mtshan nyid can gyis nyes bar bsten pa gang yin pa de brtson pa'o //
translated: The view that they are different is to be abandoned by seeing.🔽The view that they are not different is to be abandoned by meditation.🔽This is the meaning.🔽The view that they are different is to be abandoned by seeing.🔽The view that they are not different is to be abandoned by meditation.🔽This is the meaning.🔽The view that they are different is to be abandoned by seeing.

original: ded kyi tha mi dad pa la mngon par zhen pa yang mthong ba nyid kyis spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ded kyi tha mi dad pa la mngon par zhen pa yang mthong ba nyid kyis spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The view that they are not different is to be abandoned by meditation.

original: khyed kyi yang zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad par smra ba'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi yang zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad par smra ba'o //
translated: This is the meaning.🔽The view that they are different is to be abandoned by seeing.🔽The view that they are not different is to be abandoned by meditation.🔽This is the meaning.🔽The view that they are different is to be abandoned by seeing.🔽The view that they are not different is to be abandoned by meditation.🔽This is the meaning.🔽The view that they are different is to be abandoned by seeing.🔽The view that they are not different is to be abandoned by meditation.🔽This is the meaning.🔽The view that they are different is to be abandoned by seeing.🔽The view that they are not different is to be abandoned by meditation.

original: don med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa la mngon par zhen pa ni mthong ba'i phyir na dor ba mi nus la gnyis su med par bstan pa 'di yang tha dad par mngon par zhen pa kun du rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid spang ba'i don🔽du bstan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa la mngon par zhen pa ni mthong ba'i phyir na dor ba mi nus la gnyis su med par bstan pa 'di yang tha dad par mngon par zhen pa kun du rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid spang ba'i don du bstan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: This teaching of nonduality is taught for the purpose of eliminating the misconception of attachment to difference.

original: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is not a refutation.

original: de lta bu brjod pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni tha dad par mngon par zhen pa 'di ni ma mthong ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de lta bu brjod pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni tha dad par mngon par zhen pa 'di ni ma mthong ba kho na ste /
translated: The meaning of the statement “it is not seen” is that attachment to difference is not seen at all.

original: gsal ba ni ma yin no zhes de ltar bstan pa'i don du nyes bar bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsal ba ni ma yin no zhes de ltar bstan pa'i don du nyes bar bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of the statement “it is not clear” is that it is taught for the purpose of teaching that it is not clear.

original: gal te re zhig ma mthong yang tha dad par mngon par zhen pa de ni yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te re zhig ma mthong yang tha dad par mngon par zhen pa de ni yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If, although it is not seen, attachment to difference exists,

original: des na ji ltar spang zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar spang zhe na /
translated: how can it be eliminated?

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that were so, it would be like this.

original: ma @200b mthong ba ni med pa'i phyir na ma mthong ba'i tha dad par zhen pa yang ji ltar bden zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ma @200b mthong ba ni med pa'i phyir na ma mthong ba'i tha dad par zhen pa yang ji ltar bden zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Since what is not seen does not exist, how can the conception of difference in what is not seen be real?

original: yang ji ltar na tha dad pa mthong ba med snyam na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na tha dad pa mthong ba med snyam na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o /
translated: Again, how is it that the seeing of difference does not exist? It is like this.

original: tha dad pa brten pa ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa brten pa ste /
translated: Difference is based on the existence of the cognition of difference.

original: rtogs pa yod pa ma yin pa na de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa yod pa ma yin pa na de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: When there is no cognition of difference, it is like this.

original: gal te ltar ba'i snang bas tha dad pa mi rtogs na ;
analyzed: gal te ltar ba'i snang bas tha dad pa mi rtogs na ;
translated: If difference is not cognized due to the appearance of the lamp,

original: de ltar na 'o na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gis rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag gis rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the past and future would be cognized.

original: snga ma phyi ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma phyi ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The past and future are not cognized.

original: so sor zhes bya ba ni re res tha dad par mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba ni re res tha dad par mi 'dzin to //
translated: Individually means that each does not apprehend difference.

original: re res tha dad par mi 'dzin yang 'dus las zhes bya ba sna tshogs nas de ltar zhes bya ba tha dad par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re res tha dad par mi 'dzin yang 'dus las zhes bya ba sna tshogs nas de ltar zhes bya ba tha dad par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though each does not apprehend difference, from the combination, difference is apprehended.

original: dper na bu ram dang dod gra dag re res bya bar mi nus pa'i 'bras bu de tshogs nas byed pa de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'i don to //
analyzed: dper na bu ram dang dod gra dag re res bya bar mi nus pa'i 'bras bu de tshogs nas byed pa de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'i don to //
translated: For example, it is like the case where the effect that cannot be produced by either molasses or sugar separately is produced when they are combined. This is the meaning of the example.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni der ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni der ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is “In that case . . . ”

original: 'bras bu gcig pa ni bur ma dang dong gra dag gi phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa ni bur ma dang dong gra dag gi phyir te /
translated: The single effect is that of molasses and sugar.

original: rgyu des na dus nas te log na byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu des na dus nas te log na byed pa yin no //
translated: Because of that cause, it is produced when they are combined.

original: 'dir yang tha dad par 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ki 'bras bu gcig yod pa'i phyir na log nas byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang tha dad par 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid ki 'bras bu gcig yod pa'i phyir na log nas byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Here, too, because there is a single effect that has the characteristic of being apprehended as different, it would be produced when they are combined.

original: 'dir ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: “ In that case . . . ” is stated.

original: de las tha dad par rang bzhin ni gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las tha dad par rang bzhin ni gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the nature that is different from that is not apprehended, this is the meaning.

original: gal te dran pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu tha dad pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dran pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu tha dad pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the effect that has the characteristic of memory does not exist,

original: des na log nas byed pa nyid mi 'gal lo zhes brjod pa ni de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na log nas byed pa nyid mi 'gal lo zhes brjod pa ni de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is not contradictory that it is produced when they are combined. This is stated in “In that case . . . ”

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i myong ba dag las byung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i myong ba dag las byung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It arises from the experience of the former and the latter.

original: des na de las log nas byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na de las log nas byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that it would be produced by the reversal of that.

original: lan ni tha dad par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni tha dad par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is “If they are different…”

original: gal te nyams su myong ba de lta yang dran pa ni yod do snyam na nyams myong med par zhes gsungs so //🔽gzhan yang gal te dran pa kho na nyams su myong ba med kyang snga ma dang phyi ma'i sems dag tha dad par 'dzin par byed pa yin na de'i tshe dran pa 'di ni nyams su myong ba kho na yin te des na dran pa de dang dus
analyzed: gal te nyams su myong ba de lta yang dran pa ni yod do snyam na nyams myong med par zhes gsungs so // gzhan yang gal te dran pa kho na nyams su myong ba med kyang snga ma dang phyi ma'i sems dag tha dad par 'dzin par byed pa yin na de'i tshe dran pa 'di ni nyams su myong ba kho na yin te des na dran pa de dang dus
translated: If you think that memory exists even though there is no experience, he says, “Without experience…”🔽Moreover, if memory alone apprehends the difference between the former and latter mind, even though there is no experience, then at that time this memory is just experience.

original: mtshungs pa nyid kyis sems snga ma dang phyi ma nyid ni rig pa yin na de yang gnyis med thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid kyis sems snga ma dang phyi ma nyid ni rig pa yin na de yang gnyis med thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is simultaneous with that memory, the former and latter minds are cognized. But then they would be non-different.🔽In that case, he says, “If they have the same object…”

original: der ni 'bras bu gcig pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: der ni 'bras bu gcig pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhes bya ba'o //
translated: and so on. “And so on” refers to the following.

original: des zhes bya ba na bu ram dang dong gra dag gis bzlog par bya ba'i nad gang yin pa de zlog par byed pa'o //🔽snga ma dang phyi mar rtogs pa @201a * //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba na bu ram dang dong gra dag gis bzlog par bya ba'i nad gang yin pa de zlog par byed pa'o // snga ma dang phyi mar rtogs pa @201a * //
translated: “That” refers to the disease that is to be cured by molasses and ginger.

original: 'bras bu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the result is the understanding of the former and the understanding of the latter,

original: rtogs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, “The understanding . . . ”

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni sems snga phyi dag gi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni sems snga phyi dag gi'o //
translated: “Of those” refers to the former and latter minds.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the understanding.

original: tha dad pa na zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i sems kyi rang bzhin ltar tha dad pa nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa na zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i sems kyi rang bzhin ltar tha dad pa nyid yin na'o //
translated: “If they are different” means if they are different in the way that the former and latter minds are different.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa ni snga ma dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa ni snga ma dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent says, “The former . . . ”

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: “No” is the refutation.

original: des na dran pa yang zhes bya ba ni gnyis 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: des na dran pa yang zhes bya ba ni gnyis 'dzin pa'o //
translated: “Therefore, memory . . . ” means the apprehension of two.

original: 'o na slob dpon gyis ji ltar de skad bshad ces zhes bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: 'o na slob dpon gyis ji ltar de skad bshad ces zhes bya bar blta'o //
translated: “How is it that the master . . . ” should be supplied.

original: gzugs dang reg pa'i rnam par shes pa tha dad kyang ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang reg pa'i rnam par shes pa tha dad kyang ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the difference between the consciousness of form and the consciousness of touch is not established.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni tha dad par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni tha dad par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression “grasping as different” is used here.

original: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'i'o //
translated: “ As such” means as different.

original: 'on te snga ma dang phyi ma'i sems dag gis tha dad pa mi 'dzin pa de lta na yang dran pas 'dzin pa yin no snyam na //🔽gang gis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te snga ma dang phyi ma'i sems dag gis tha dad pa mi 'dzin pa de lta na yang dran pas 'dzin pa yin no snyam na // gang gis gsungs so //
translated: But if the former and latter minds do not grasp as different, and you think that memory does,🔽then what is the use of the former and latter minds?

original: gal te dran pas sems snga ma dang phyi ma dag rang rig go de kho nas dngos su byed do snyam na dus mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: gal te dran pas sems snga ma dang phyi ma dag rang rig go de kho nas dngos su byed do snyam na dus mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: If you say that memory is the self-awareness of the former and latter minds, then that itself is the direct experience.

original: /'dod pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni khyed 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: /'dod pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni khyed 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: “ We agree” means that you agree.

original: nyams myong ni tha dad pa'i 'dzin byed min no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: nyams myong ni tha dad pa'i 'dzin byed min no zhes 'brel to //
translated: “ Experience is not the grasper of the different” is the connection.

original: de'i phyir na tha dad par rig pa 'di ni kun rdzob yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir na tha dad par rig pa 'di ni kun rdzob yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore this awareness of difference is conventional.

original: kun rdzob nyid bsgrub pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob nyid bsgrub pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To prove that it is conventional, it says, “In this way. . .

original: kho bo cag gis gcig tu 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni sna tshogs te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis gcig tu 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni sna tshogs te /
translated: ” What we assert as one is various.

original: du mar rtogs pa ste shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du mar rtogs pa ste shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is understood as manifold.

original: rnam pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis she na /
translated: By what mode?

original: mngon sum ni de ltar 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni de ltar 'jug pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Direct perception does not operate in that way.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: 'on te re zhig snang ba ni yod pa yin te des na de tsam kho nas tha dad pa rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na snang pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te re zhig snang ba ni yod pa yin te des na de tsam kho nas tha dad pa rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na snang pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if it is argued that the appearance exists, and therefore the difference is understood just by that much, he says: by the mere appearance, etc.

original: sna tshogs dang sna tshogs min nyid ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs dang sna tshogs min nyid ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The manifold and non-manifold are understood as different and non-different.

original: gang gi phyir snang ba tsam gyis tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa zhes mi rtogs pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snang ba tsam gyis tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa zhes mi rtogs pa des na'o //
translated: Because the difference and non-difference are not understood by the mere appearance, therefore, etc.

original: dran pa goms pa las gsal bar 'gyur ba'i mngon sum gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: dran pa goms pa las gsal bar 'gyur ba'i mngon sum gang yin pa des so //
translated: That direct perception which becomes clear through the cultivation of memory.🔽That which, etc.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni tha dad pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni tha dad pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: grasps the difference.

original: goms ma kyang zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'i mngon sum snang ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid goms pa las gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis lhag par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: goms ma kyang zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'i mngon sum snang ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de nyid goms pa las gsal bar snang ba nyid kyis lhag par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: “Even though not familiar” means that the nature of the appearance of unclear perception itself becomes clearer through familiarity.

original: mi gsal ba'i mngon sum gyis tha dad pa gzung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i mngon sum gyis tha dad pa gzung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that a different object is apprehended by unclear perception.

original: des na goms pa las skyes pas 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na goms pa las skyes pas 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, it is apprehended through being produced by familiarity.

original: der yang zhes @201b bya ba ni gsal ba'i mngon sum la yang rnam dbye des zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: der yang zhes @201b bya ba ni gsal ba'i mngon sum la yang rnam dbye des zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: “In that case” means in the case of clear perception. “By that distinction” means by the distinction of difference and non-difference.

original: dran pa de las ni dran pa dang nyams su myong ba dag yan 'gar bar myong ba ste /
analyzed: dran pa de las ni dran pa dang nyams su myong ba dag yan 'gar bar myong ba ste /
translated: “From that memory” means that memory and experience are experienced separately.

original: tha dad par 'dzin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha dad par 'dzin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are apprehended as different.

original: gal te de skad brjod na de'i tshe yang du ma'i rang bzhin de yang khyed kyi 'dod pas dran pa dang nyams su myong ba dag gi yin pas de la yang rnam dben te rnam par dbye ba yod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang dran pa la snang
analyzed: gal te de skad brjod na de'i tshe yang du ma'i rang bzhin de yang khyed kyi 'dod pas dran pa dang nyams su myong ba dag gi yin pas de la yang rnam dben te rnam par dbye ba yod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang dran pa la snang
translated: If you say that, then even the nature of the many is the object of your memory and experience, and so it is not devoid of differentiation.

original: ba'i dran pa dang nyams su myong ba dag kyang gcig kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i dran pa dang nyams su myong ba dag kyang gcig kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, the memory and experience that appear in memory are only one.

original: ci'i phyir tha mi dad ce na rang ngam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha mi dad ce na rang ngam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why are they not different?

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro ;
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro ;
translated: In reality means ultimately.

original: / gal te yang rnam par gcad par bya ba mi nus pa de lta na yang tha dad par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: / gal te yang rnam par gcad par bya ba mi nus pa de lta na yang tha dad par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If it is impossible to differentiate, then they are still different.

original: gang zhig logs su bcad nas skyo bar mi nus shing /
analyzed: gang zhig logs su bcad nas skyo bar mi nus shing /
translated: What is it that cannot be differentiated and separated?

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig blta bar yang mi nus pa tha dad na yang ci zhig byar yod /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig blta bar yang mi nus pa tha dad na yang ci zhig byar yod /
translated: What is the use of a difference that cannot be seen as separate?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: blang dang dor nyid byar med phyir ro //
analyzed: blang dang dor nyid byar med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is nothing to adopt or reject.

original: de ni 'ga' zhig spang ba'am /
analyzed: de ni 'ga' zhig spang ba'am /
translated: It is possible that some are abandoned or

original: blang bar nus pa srid do //
analyzed: blang bar nus pa srid do //
translated: can be taken up.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba dang ngo //
translated: “That” refers to experience.

original: de tha dad par smra ba'i lugs la yang ji ltar dran pa gzhan nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de tha dad par smra ba'i lugs la yang ji ltar dran pa gzhan nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Even in the system of those who maintain that memory is different from experience, how is memory itself different?

original: thams cad rgyu dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad rgyu dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Everything is different due to the difference of cause,” etc.

original: rgyu skyed byed dang rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu skyed byed dang rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba ste /
translated: The difference of cause is the difference of the producer, and the difference of essence is the difference of the nature of the thing itself.

original: rgyu'i dbye ba dang bcas pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba las so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu'i dbye ba dang bcas pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba las so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is due to the difference of cause and the difference of essence.

original: de zhig rgyu'i dbye ba nyid brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de zhig rgyu'i dbye ba nyid brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The difference of cause is stated in “In that regard,” etc.

original: dbang po'i shes pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba bag chags tsam las skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba bag chags tsam las skye ba ma yin no //
translated: The sense faculty consciousness does not arise from mere latent impressions.

original: rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba brjod pa ni dran pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i dbye ba brjod pa ni dran pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The difference of essence is stated in “Memory is . . . ”

original: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang myong ba dag go //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang myong ba dag go //
translated: “These” refers to memory and experience.

original: ka ba la sogs pa ltar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khyed kyi ltar na /
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa ltar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khyed kyi ltar na /
translated: “Like a pillar, etc.” means that, according to you, memory is like a pillar, etc.,

original: ka ba la sogs pa tha dad pa de bzhin du zhes so //
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa tha dad pa de bzhin du zhes so //
translated: Just as pillars and so on are different.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa nyid rig pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ba de med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa nyid rig pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ba de med pa'o //
translated: That which is aware of the possession of a cause is called that, and it does not exist.

original: de mi 'dzin phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu de mi 'dzin pa'i phyir gal te mngon sum gyi rgyu mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de mi 'dzin phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu de mi 'dzin pa'i phyir gal te mngon sum gyi rgyu mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Because it does not apprehend that, because it does not apprehend that cause, if it does not apprehend the cause of direct perception.

original: de lta na yang rjes su dpag pas 'dzin to snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang rjes su dpag pas 'dzin to snyam na /
translated: Even so, it is apprehended by inference, you think.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Inference also, it is said.

original: dran pa tsam du zad kyi 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi de'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa tsam du zad kyi 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi de'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is merely memory, it is not apprehension, because it does not have the nature of that.

original: 'on te gang gi tshe rgyur mngon par 'dod pa 'dzin pa de nyid du 'dzin mod snyam na gang gi tshe de zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te gang gi tshe rgyur mngon par 'dod pa 'dzin pa de nyid du 'dzin mod snyam na gang gi tshe de zhes gsungs so //
translated: But when it is apprehended as a cause, it is certainly apprehended, you think. When it is said, that.

original: de ni rgyu mngon par 'dod pa'o //🔽'o na 'bras bu @202a * //
analyzed: de ni rgyu mngon par 'dod pa'o // 'o na 'bras bu @202a * //
translated: That is the cause that is asserted.

original: 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But when it is apprehended as a result, you think.

original: 'bras bu 'dzin pa'i dus na yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dzin pa'i dus na yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even when the result is apprehended, it is said.

original: 'o na dran pa nyid kyis de rgyu nyid du rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dran pa nyid kyis de rgyu nyid du rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But if you think that memory itself realizes that as a cause,

original: nyams su ma myong ba la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nyams su ma myong ba la zhes gsungs so //
translated: then it is said, “with respect to what is not experienced.”

original: rgyu ni mngon sum gyis myong ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ni mngon sum gyis myong ba kho na yin te /
translated: The cause is only experienced by direct perception.

original: des na dran pa 'byung ngo snyam na rgyu nyid du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na dran pa 'byung ngo snyam na rgyu nyid du zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, if you think that memory arises, then it is said, “as a cause.”

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'das zin pa'i rgyu yang ngo //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'das zin pa'i rgyu yang ngo //
translated: “ That” refers to a past cause.

original: gal te dus mtshungs par mngon sum gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du nyams su myong ba de lta yin na ni snga ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te dus mtshungs par mngon sum gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du nyams su myong ba de lta yin na ni snga ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: If you experience the cause and effect as simultaneous by direct perception, then it is applied as “the nature of the former,” and so on.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'o //
translated: “ Or” indicates a need.

original: ji ltar mngon sum med par rjes su dpag pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum med par rjes su dpag pa 'jug ste /
translated: How does inference engage without direct perception?

original: gal te snga ma'i rang bzhin nyid la yang mngon sum gyi spyod yul du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te snga ma'i rang bzhin nyid la yang mngon sum gyi spyod yul du 'gyur na /
translated: If the nature of the former becomes the domain of direct perception,

original: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then at that time it would be realized by inference.

original: 'di yang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: But this does not exist.

original: mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //🔽sngar zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'dzin pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba'o // sngar zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'dzin pa'i dus na'o //
translated: “By direct perception” means by direct perception.🔽“Previously” means at the time of apprehending the cause.

original: snga ma nyid du zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rang bzhin snga mar gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: snga ma nyid du zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rang bzhin snga mar gyur ba nyid do //
translated: “Previously” means at the time of the nature of the cause.

original: sngar gyi mngon sum des snga ma nyid ma 'dzin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sngar gyi mngon sum des snga ma nyid ma 'dzin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why does the previous direct perception not apprehend the previous?

original: mngon sum thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //🔽'dzin pa phyi ma la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon sum thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o // 'dzin pa phyi ma la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Because all direct perceptions” means because all direct perceptions.

original: 'bras bu 'dzin pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dzin pa la ltos nas so //
translated: “In dependence on the later apprehension” means in dependence on the apprehension of the effect.

original: des ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum snga mas so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ni mngon sum snga mas so //
translated: “That” means the previous direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'dzin zhe na rang bdag nyid la gnas phyir zhes gsungs te gzhan gyi tshul lugs mi shes pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'dzin zhe na rang bdag nyid la gnas phyir zhes gsungs te gzhan gyi tshul lugs mi shes pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Why does it not apprehend? It is said, “because it abides in its own nature,” meaning that it does not know the system of others.

original: rang bdag nyid kyi dus gang yod pa'i dngos po de'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: rang bdag nyid kyi dus gang yod pa'i dngos po de'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis so //
translated: The direct perception that apprehends the entity that exists at its own time apprehends its own nature.

original: mngon sum phyi ma la'ang de bzhin no zhes bya bar rang gi 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum phyi ma la'ang de bzhin no zhes bya bar rang gi 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The latter perception also is like that.

original: rang gi dus kyis rang ngo bo yongs su gcod pa snga ma la ltos pa'i bdag nyid ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur zhes rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: rang gi dus kyis rang ngo bo yongs su gcod pa snga ma la ltos pa'i bdag nyid ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur zhes rjes su 'jug go //
translated: How can it apprehend its own nature, which is dependent on the prior apprehension of its own time?

original: de la zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma la'o //
translated: “ In that” refers to the prior and the subsequent.

original: dran pas kyang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: dran pas kyang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: “ By memory” means by the nature of inference.

original: rig pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis spyod yul du ma byas pa la'o //
analyzed: rig pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis spyod yul du ma byas pa la'o //
translated: “ Not by knowledge” means not by the scope of perception.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyis pa spang ba'i don du brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyis pa spang ba'i don du brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ In order to eliminate the second misconception” means in order to eliminate the misconception that it is not perception.

original: dran pa tsam yin gyi de tshad ma ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa tsam yin gyi de tshad ma ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: “ It is mere memory, not a means of valid knowledge” means that it is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos pa rig pa gang gis 'bras bu rig par 'gyur ba dran pa tsam de las snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos pa'i rig par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos pa rig pa gang gis 'bras bu rig par 'gyur ba dran pa tsam de las snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos pa'i rig par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could the mere memory of the cognition that cognizes the effect, which depends on the prior and subsequent, be the cognition that depends on the prior and subsequent?

original: gcig nyid du zhes bya ba snga ma dang phyi @202b ma'i zhes pa dag gcig nyid du gzung ba'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid du zhes bya ba snga ma dang phyi @202b ma'i zhes pa dag gcig nyid du gzung ba'o //
translated: “As one” means that the prior and subsequent are apprehended as one.🔽“I alone saw it” means that the collection is just that, or “I saw the collection as just that.” The prior and subsequent are apprehended as one.

original: ngas 'ba' zhig mthong ba gang yin ba de nyid tshogs pa 'di yin no zhe'am bdag nyid tshogs par mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid 'ba' zhig pa 'di yin no zhes snga ma dang phyi ma dag gcig nyid du do shes pa nyid lhag par zhen pa
analyzed: ngas 'ba' zhig mthong ba gang yin ba de nyid tshogs pa 'di yin no zhe'am bdag nyid tshogs par mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid 'ba' zhig pa 'di yin no zhes snga ma dang phyi ma dag gcig nyid du do shes pa nyid lhag par zhen pa
translated: This is the adherence to the belief in the supremacy of that.

original: nyid de / des ni rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyid de / des ni rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: By that, it is distinguished.

original: sngon po'i rnam pa logs su byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa logs su byed pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of blue is set aside.

original: des na gnyis su med par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na gnyis su med par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, how could it be nondual?

original: 'di grub pa'i mtha' pas brjod pa ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di grub pa'i mtha' pas brjod pa ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the assertion of the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni dran pa'i rang bzhin yin la 'di zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin yin te skal ldan chen po bshad pa mdzad pa'i bzhed pas ni /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni dran pa'i rang bzhin yin la 'di zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin yin te skal ldan chen po bshad pa mdzad pa'i bzhed pas ni /
translated: The word that refers to the nature of memory, and the word this refers to the nature of experience. According to the great fortunate one who explains,

original: de nyid kyis mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is direct perception by that [memory],

original: dran pa dang 'di'o zhes 'dzin pa dag mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: dran pa dang 'di'o zhes 'dzin pa dag mthong ba yin no //
translated: memory and grasping this are seeing.

original: dran pa yang tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa yang tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Memory is not a valid cognition.

original: des snga ma dang da ltar ba gcig tu ji ltar 'dzin zhes dgos pa'o //
analyzed: des snga ma dang da ltar ba gcig tu ji ltar 'dzin zhes dgos pa'o //
translated: The purpose is to ask how it can apprehend the past and present as one.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: Now, now is an introduction to a doubt.

original: ji ltar shing rta dang shing rtas bskyod pa'i skyes bu de gnyis tha dad par rtogs pa ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar shing rta dang shing rtas bskyod pa'i skyes bu de gnyis tha dad par rtogs pa ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the example is just as a chariot and the person moved by the chariot are understood to be different, and so on.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, it is said is if.

original: de lta bu kho nar zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa kho nar ro //
analyzed: de lta bu kho nar zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa kho nar ro //
translated: Just like that means only different.

original: rnam par dpyad pa nyid brjod pa nyid rang pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa nyid brjod pa nyid rang pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The very analysis is expressed as itself and so on.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni gcig tu rtogs na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni gcig tu rtogs na'o //
translated: If it were so, i.e., if it were understood as one,

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang mngon sum gyi rnam pa can nyid du'o //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni dran pa dang mngon sum gyi rnam pa can nyid du'o //
translated: in that way, i.e., in the form of memory and perception,

original: dran pa'am mngon sum gcig kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa'am mngon sum gcig kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: there would be only one memory or perception.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod ci skyon snyam na /
translated: If you ask, “What is the problem if that is so?”

original: de lta yin na zhes gsungs so //
